Mar at the door of the restaurant was always so helpful and accommodating, others that deserve a mention are Nicolina and Beatrice.  Pool bar for lunch, food here was good, Sandra was great as was Jesus.  And in the bar…

title: Awesome yet again at Viva!
review: A family of 4 (5yr & 2yr) staying in our 3rd Viva Hotel.  Perfect for a young family, we cannot fault the Viva chain.  Reception is first class, we upgraded to a swim up ground floor apartment on arrival and were absolutely delighted at our room.  We stayed SC so cannot comment on the food, but it looked great.  Fantastic pools, the pirate pool is a big hit with the kids and a word on the lifeguard in the pirate pool - she was very alert and on the ball with attending to the inevitable cuts and bruises.  Great location - 5 mins to the fantastic beach (10 Euro for 2 loungers and an additional euro if you want the safe) and less than 10 mins walk to the port.  Highly recommend a taxi to the old town (5 Euros) and also go see the dancing puppets near the harbour.  Fantastic holiday…

title: Mixed experience
review: So. What you’ll see is what you’ll get.   Child-friendly, but crowded pool-area. We spent nine days here, and only on 2 days we were able to get sun beds by the children’s pool. (I never understood people who is on vacation, and volunteers to get up at 7 AM to reserve sun loungers. (Pun intended). Instead, we went to the beach (which was really nice)).   Food: Breakfast buffet good, but options for lunch and dinner were way below average, and certainly not what you’d expect from a “4”-star hotel.   Service: Check-in was ridiculously slow, and the way this is arranged should be reconsidered. Cleaning was ok, however balconies were not cleaned. Staff at Mini Club nice and attentive, with one exception (a woman who were directly rude). Hotel appears well-maintained. Staff in…

title: Surprisingly good
review: We had a week all inclusive here even though we live in Alcudia and have passed the hotel thousands of times. Had no idea it had so many pools and such nice facilities. This food is amazing...plenty of choice and to a very high standard considering the sheer volume of people.  The staff are lovely, nothing is too much trouble and they work tremendously hard. The entertainment provided every night is also to a high standard so all in all, a very nice stay indeed. Would recommend this hotel especially for families.

title: Lush stay!
review: We stayed here two years ago and it was perfect. Our room was more than adequate, the terrace allowing us to have breakfast after our morning chill in the adult pool. Service was excellent. We used the outside bar for lunch one day which was very reasonable, but used the excellent eateries on the main strip for meals. I'd definitely come back!

title: great place for family with kids
review: really great place for kids, super hotel service don't bring stroller for kids, hotel has own for free during your stay Alcudia beach is the best for smaller kids and perfect for learning to swim we will come back next year

title: Viva Viva Viva Bravo
review: This is the 3rd time staying at Viva Tropic in Alcudia.It's our home away from home.Myself and my family always enjoy our time staying there.The staff are spot on and always are very polite.Jesus is the guy too look out for as he looks after you during your stay.Lets just say that i always had a drink in front of me at night to get me through the entertainment.The food is great especially at lunchtime which is my favourite part of the day.Breakfast and dinner choices have a great range of food to choose from.The entertainment basically caters for kids,but on certain nights the whole family can have a good time depending on the Acts performing.The rooms are spacious and the balcony is a good size.The location is great as it's local to shops,restaurants and bars.We always go out…

title: Great for families with younger children
review: We recently returned from 10 days all inclusive in a first floor room with poolside view. The arrival was a little chaotic and slow but nothing to complain about. The room was adequate although not luxurious. The decor was a bit dated and there were some cracks in the flooring if the hallway area of the room which could do with being repaired. The staff are very friendly and attentive without being in your face. The food selection is very good and the standard high. The presentation is also excellent. The pools are great but the whole place is certainly geared towards families. I wouldn't stay with teenagers but would return with our younger children again. The entertainment is what you would expect in any chain hotel but the kids entertainment staff work very very hard and give…

title: Great family holiday but not 4 star......
review: We stayed in the viva tropic for 12 nights in a royal terrace apartment. We are a family of 4 with 9 year old twins. Regular all inclusive holiday makers. For the money we paid, the room was a little disappointing. Rips in the curtains, dated furniture and the living area cramped. The roof terrace was lovely although the cleaners didn't always venture up and so dirty glasses would be left all day. The hotel is a small in comparison to others w e have stayed and the pools are small too. We felt very cramped and squeezed in with nowhere to put drinks or bags. They got extremely busy during the day and you couldn't swim never mind play in them. On the positives, the pool bar food was good. Table service with a good choice of food on the menu. Breakfast also provided a good…

title: Beautiful hotel
review: We were pleasantly surprised with the Viva Tropic. Beautiful interior and exterior as soon as you arrive, the reception staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. Travelling in our party was 3 adults and a 9 year old (my husband, sister and my daughter) The actual room was decorated to a high standard with all mod cons, we had a separate bedroom with a king size bed and the living room had a comfortable bed settee. We were self catering so I can't comment on the food. The entertainment was great during the day for the kids and adults, plenty to do. I especially enjoyed the stretch and relax in the morning. The entertainment in the evening was great, singers, acrobats, karaoke etc, all kept us fully entertained. We had a real bargain it was only £720 for 3 adults and 1…

title: Very Good
review: Good location set back from main road – but v close to shops, restaurants and beach access.  V clean hotel, good sized and v clean rooms.  We had 2 premium appts and 1 premium studio.  All v nice with walk in showers/wet room, hairdryer, toiletries etc.  Kettle, toaster microwave and the norm as well as massive double bed in bedroom.  Only downside was the sofa bed – not the comfiest.  Hotel very busy as you would expect, but loads of pools, sun beds etc.  Food ok in bar but wasn’t all incl so not sure about any other food option.  Only downside we found was the waiter service after 10.15pm – once the shows finished the waiters appeared to go on clean up duties as opposed to seeing if anyone else wanted a drink.  Not great if you’ve been out for tea and come back at 10pm to…

title: Fabulous family holiday!
review: Fabulous location, close to harbour, shops and restaurants. Hardly saw my kids (8 and 10) all week, they had so much to do! Pools are amazing, all 7 of them! Highlight had to be the wet bubble, hilarious!  All inclusive was worth the money, great breakfasts, plenty of fresh fruit as well as plenty of the rest!! Lunch by the pool was always a hit, dinner buffet was never a bore...something different every evening and very tasty. Cocktails also very good while watching the evening entertainment..I'm not a fan, but that is not a reflection on the entertainment team! They worked so hard to make sure kids were happy and occupied!  Room had a pool view and good size balcony. Clean tidy and plenty of storage, no complaints there..  Wifi was reliable but air con could have been…

title: A relaxing holiday
review: Returned on 14 July 2016 after 10 nights. The hotel is in a very quiet location whilst close to the beach and port. 29.70 Euro was collected, by the Hotel ,for the Balearic evniroment tax introduced on 1 July 2016. The hotel is well maintained, clean and very small children friendly. Although suitable for all ages. There is a wide range of food to suit all tastes. All the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Studio 1503 was a delight overlooking a small park in front of the hotel.

title: Viva Espana!
review: Second visit to the viva tropic, and would like to come back, so that says it all really.  Hotel is cosmopolitan and ideal for families, plenty for kids to do with kids club for under 10 and activities for teens ( with a daily timetable you can see in advance on the viva website).Lots of different pools to keep everyone happy, plenty of lifeguards also so extra peace of mind for parents. All the staff are helpful and cheery, both animation team and waiters are great with the kids.  We were half board and had no complaints with the food, breakfast especially good. We ate out a few times at night as there are so many great restaurants near by. All inclusive option is expensive here however the food and drink options are as good as I've seen for AI. Most cocktails and items from…

title: Another fabulous holiday ,going back again next year
review: Fabulous staff  in all areas of this complex ,so  friendly and helpful , it is a pleasure to go back and see so many happy people working in a wonderful environment, many different swimming pools to cater for all ,families ,couples and older clients, excellent food in the all inclusive restaurant ,you  don't have to go all inclusive to avail of the restaurant  , the food at the poolside bar, and the a la carte is also excellent ,have been going there since 2002,will be going back again next year.

title: GREAT LOCATION, MORE FOR FAMILIES THAN COUPLES
review: Stayed for a week first week in july, hotel in a fantastic location just 5mins from beach and restaurants and shops, had a room with balcony overlooking the road, room was clean but balcony only had sun in the morning so shady afternoon and evening, got a upgrade to room with terrace jacuzzi sun beds much better but overlooked, only paid for breakfast which was well cooked you could have a cooked breakfast, fruit, cereal,cake,cold meat etc have to say it was pretty hectic loads of children taking ages and some mornings had to wait for a table, had dinner out loads of lovely restaurants all doing t bone steaks !, the beach was superb clean and not (when we went) overcrowded try the boat trip round the caves well worth 20euros, we didnt use the hotel pool to crowded and lots of…

title: Great family holiday
review: This was a lovely hotel, very welcoming and clean. As a family with two older teenagers we had two studio rooms on the third floor which overlooked the front of the hotel. We found the rooms spacious and very clean, everything was supplied even down to pool towels. They cleaned and replaced room towels daily. We were all inclusive and on arrival our rooms were not ready but were given our wristbands so we could have lunch and explore the hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly and waiters worked very hard ensuring food and drinks arrived quickly and plates cleared away. The policy of no reserving sun beds seemed to work and we were able to sit round the pool where we wanted. The adult only pool is a MUST do with jacuzzi and plush double loungers, total luxury and…

title: Good holiday
review: Well located hotel. Good standards of cleanliness.  Good staff. Great pools. Very child orientated/friendly hotel. Would recommend this hotel for families more so than for couples. Food and drink all good.

title: Fantastic
review: Me (22) and my girlfriend (21) stayed here for ten nights on a bed and breakfast package. Everything was great. The pool facilities have something for everyone, the kids pools look great for families and we enjoyed the adult pool with Bali beds. It was a bit strange how close it was to the kids pool but isn't too much of a big deal. The room was great, clean, spacious, and modern. Some days the maid didn't get to our room until 3 o'clock for cleaning which was a bit of nuisance sometimes but again is forgivable. Our experience of the food is limited to the breakfast and we had no complaints. The pool bar food looked great at lunch time and the bar had a good selection of drinks at night. The hotel suites us for self catering as there are plenty of great restaurants nearby. The…

title: beautiful holiday in viva tropic
review: Had an amazing holiday, staff were amazing on reception, spotless everywhere, pop bar food above exceptional, lots of entertainment for children of all ages, three pools with different activities especially the bubble pool for bigger kids. Slight walk to main entertainment if wanted but was enough as I have a little 2 year old girl x could my fault this hotel we loved it. There was a young women on reception she spoke fabulous English and made every query pleasant and made us feel like no question was a problem to her . Thank you so much for a brilliant holiday xx

title: JD
review: Great hotel for families. All inclusive totally worth it. Lunch best in pool bar, but buffet ok. Different pool areas, from pirate ship for the smallest to relaxing quiet area for +18. Spacious around pools with a lot of sun beds. Not any problems to finding one, at least not in June.

title: Great facilities, Basic hotel.No Way a 4 Star hotel
review: We have just returned from a 9 night stay at Viva Tropic.When we arrived We went to check in which was quick With no information other than the lifts are over there take that to your room number. When i booked i requested pool view room which was not what we recieved. Anyhow on to the room which was located on floor 3. The Room was very very small, We had a fold up bed also jammed in beside the double bed for our daughter to sleep in..wardrobe,fridge,kitchenette and few cupboards.Decent size tv, balcony was also quite small.The bathroom was also very small with the tiolet stuffed in behind the door. The shower was decent but it absolutely soaks the whole bathroom as there is not proper shower tray.The bed is quite hard which resulted in back pain for 4 days.The air conditioning…

title: Upmarket Butlins Camp
review: We stayed on self catering. Loved the resort. 5 minutes walk to the gorgeous beach. 11 euros for 2 beds a umbrella and a safe. Lots of lovely restaurants, himalaya Indian restaurant is amazing and so is new cacao for burgers and Spanish good.   The hotel is very clean, however the cleaning of our apartment not the best. I ended up cleaning it myself. staff are very helpful especially Tony on reception and the life guards around the pools. The apartment was modern had a microwave fridge few cooking utensils.   There is a relaxing adult only pool. The only downside to that is it is next to the small children's play are where there is a lot of noise.  The main pool is not big enough for the size of the hotel. The sun beds are like sardines lined up too close together. You cannot…

title: Fantastic
review: We spent 11 nights here with a 4 yr old and a 2 yr old. It's fantastic for kids. Everything you need is provided from baby baths to buggy hire.  Rooms very clean and fantastic facilities.  We were here as a family celebrating my husband's recovery from cancer and the hotel took great care of us. Thanks to Toni for looking after us. I would highly recommend this hotel for family holidays. We will definitely be back.

title: great for family holiday
review: we went as family holiday with grandchildren and was excellent staff were  brilliant and kids entertain was really good food was good as well  there is lots of activities for kids beach is 5 min walk and is very nice resort suggest best for children . very good area of alcudia .the only thing is you have to pay for safe deposit and baby cot .

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed at the viva tropic hotel for 10 nights with our two boys, aged 2 and 4. Though there are over 300 rooms, the hotel didn't feel too big compared to others we saw in the port. The rooms are spacious with a modern feel and the kitchen area is fine if you are self catering as there are many great places to visit for meals out. The pool area is well equipped with enough sun loungers and some good bits like the inflatable half sphere. Our kids loved the kids area with the pirate ship pool and play park, complete with bouncy castle. They also liked the mini golf course. The staff were brilliant and even on the days the cleaners were not doing our room it was never too much trouble to empty the bins when I asked or give me spare bed sheets after our lad had an accident. The…

title: Great Family Oriented Hotel
review: We had a fantastic 10 night stay, self-catering at the Viva Tropic as a family of 4 with children aged 4 and 2. The only regret was that we couldn't stay for another 10 nights!  According to the Viva Hotels website, the Viva Tropic has 340 rooms/apartments; it honestly didn't feel that big, with accommodation spread over a main block of 5 floors and further smaller blocks around the grounds.  The location is great: close enough to the beach (200m) and the harbour area (400m), but far enough back as to maintain a peaceful setting. The grounds are compact and well laid out with well maintained garden features and walkways. There are an impressive 6 swimming pools (7 if you count the indoor spa pool), ranging from an gated adults-only pool, to a knee depth children's pool complete…

title: Great time had by all.
review: Visited the viva tropic for a week in June with my husband, 2 children age 5 & 2 and my mum. Had requested an apartment with a pool facing view on the ground or lower floors. The hotel were unable to accommodate this, but phoned me the day before to advise me of this, they gave me a choice of 3 rooms, emailed me a map of the hotel so I could see the location of them and advised me that on arrival they would show me round the rooms and I could choose. True to their word they did this. 2 of these apartments were upgrades, and entailed an additional supplement of 30/35euro per night. I did ask for discount, but the manager was unwilling to budge over the phone. However, we picked room 2005 (an additional 35euro per night) the manager gave us 1 nights discount on arrival. If you can…

title: A bit disappointing and more of a 3 star than a 4 star
review: Just back from a 9 night stay at the Viva Tropic and overall we were a little disappointed.   Last year we stayed at the Viva Zafiro which is their 5 star hotel just up the road. The Zafiro was an amazing hotel but further away from the beach so we chose Viva Tropic as it was closer to the beach and local shops and restaurants.  We had a one bedroom family apartment and upon arrival it was quite dated compared to the Zafiro and I would say it was more of a 3 star room rather than a 4 star.   The rooms was a little grubby in places with cracks on the wall and damp stains on the ceiling in the bathroom and could do with being freshened up and modernised. The sofa was very dirty and needed cleaning.  We paid £1400 for this room for 9 nights on a B&B rate so it is not cheap and we…

title: Great Resort
review: Great family resortresort. The buffet was phenomenal every meal. Definitely go all inclusive because they don't skimp on anything. The roomsrooms are spaciousspacious and have all the amenities. Pools are clean and there's something for everyone. The animation is top notch and goes all day and through the night. A+++

title: A lovely hotel and a calming family break
review: We spent just three nights at the Viva Tropic. We were All Inclusive and chose a 'swim up' room.   Meal times are great. Waiter service drinks and a really varied buffet. Loads of choice for salad and show cooking for fish, meat, etc.   Rooms wise, they're really nicely laid out. The bed is dressed particularly nicely - made us feel extra at home.   The kitchenette looked really well equipped, but we only used the fridge for bottles of water.   The evening entertainment was 'OK' - but honestly, it's only a few mins walk into Alcudia, where there's always loads going on. Definitely venture out!!   We have an 8 year old girl and she loved the place. Highlight being the pools (there are at least 4.... Maybe 5). And the Wet Bubble is literally hours of fun for kids and grown ups.  …

title: viva tropic great family holiday
review: lovely hotel staff all round lovely and helpful would go back again place was vwry clean kids loved play park and mimi golf which are close togather which was grwat for us as we could play golf with kids and the.others play in park pools are lovely as well

title: 3rd Visit, very reliable self-catering base
review: Our 3rd visit to the Viva Tropic.  We like the location, easy for the beach, harbour and the old town.  Excellent for cycling, running and walking. (or just relaxing!)   We chose a garden-view room this time, got one on the 5th floor of block 1, nice views of the mountains and you can see the sea to the side.  Room will get warm if you forget to draw the curtains when you go out! Adults-only pool is the place to relax on an afternoon.  We went self-catering ( which really means eating out every night as there is such a good choice of places nearby ) so didn't use the restaurants or pool bar.  Only minor niggle was getting stuck in the lift, but we were got out within 3 minutes.  Wi-fi is free but there is a charge for the safe in the room.

title: Fantastic family holiday
review: Great location, lovely staff, fantastic chefs, great food and amazing for the kids - all ages family holiday, grandparents, sisters with their husbands and 4 cousins ages 3,4,7 and 13 they all had a blast.  Walking distance to beach although there are so many pools to use at the hotel we only went once to the beach. Great bike ride to Puerto pollensa (45 mins)

title: Holiday at viva tropica and spa
review: We have just returned from viva tropica, the hotel is amazing with friendly efficient staff from the reception, cleaners, dining area, bar staff, rooms great, food great, and refreshments terrific, overall would highly recommend and must mention Lorenzo and his team plus Kenneth and his team, all round excellent, Julie and iain

title: Viva Tropic
review: Stayed in this hotel for week, Really nice room with pool view. Room was bit small. But you are only getting your head down for night.  Pools, are lovely. Kids have a lot of choices. Kids pool is amazing, with play park next to the kids pool.  Crazy golf is fun, kids can play it when they want too.  Staff at this place, don't stop all day. Really hard working.   Pool manager, who cleans the pool side in the mornings. You must watch, he will remove your towels from you sun beds. Done this on Saturday to 40 people at lease. Causing a up roar. Then soon disappeared away. Coward. Leaving the life guards to sort out the situation.   Great place, great holiday.

title: Excellent
review: This is the second time we've been here, and it really is fantastic! The staff, from reception, to the waiters, to the cleaners are super friendly and do an excellent job. The rooms are nice and clean, the food is superb, with lots of fresh fish dishes. The evening entertainment is great if you have kids, ours love the mini disco, and the entertainment staff are great! They should make a dvd of it for parents to buy, our kids are still singing the songs at home. All in all, a great hotel, in a nice location, can't fault it, we will go again :)

title: Perfect Family Hotel
review: Excellent hotel for families and those looking for a quiet holiday. Clean rooms and hotel in general. No litter anywhere. Rooms are big and cleaned regularly with fresh towels on request. Food was great from heathly options to Gluten Free. Nightly entertainment.

title: Loverly  holiday
review: we   stayed  at  the  viva  tropic   once  again  ,  we  love  this  hotel   the  hotel  is  very  clean   the  rooms  are  very  good   ,  the  staff  are   brill   they  cant  do  enough   for  you   ,  the  food  is  great   never  get  the  same  meal   twice  every  thing  cooked  in  front  of  you  and  there is  some thing  for  everyone  ,  cant  wait  to  go  back  ,  we  get  a  lovely   welcome  every  time  we  arrive  ,  thank  you  viva  tropic  staff   you  make  our  holiday

title: A week in the sun
review: Firstly, before I start, this hotel is an absolute jem but for the right families....families being the word! I've got to start with a few negatives but only trying to give an honest review. We flew with Thomsons as a couple in May. We always travel with them as we have never been let down by there service. But apart from the plane, we never saw a Thomson rep! We were put on a coach at the airport, no rep on board, and dropped off by the driver outside the hotel. Not that we bother with the welcome morning, but be prepared, you don't see or hear from anybody linked with Thomson. Even on the day of leaving, there is no notice board with departure times. We had to ask reception to contact Thomson regarding the pick up time. The hotel is not really catered for British, and the…

title: Pleasant stay felt at home.
review: We stayed at the Viva Tropic mid May for a week. Mum dad and 5 1/2 year old boy. Premium room on 3rd floor with a pool view. Reception was very friendly on our arrival. My key card didn't work twice on arrival at the third attempt a lady went with me to my room all ok. Rooms are spacious and clean with a large balcony... Permanent ant trail up left hand side of kitchen but it didn't bother us that much. Kitchen is missing a sponge or cloth to wash dishes/mugs. We didn't use it to cook as we went AI which was a good choice. Walk in shower was very good with a non-slip floor. Some of the furniture at the pool restaurant was very tatty but it was all replaced a few days later with comfortable chairs. Food was good at the pool. We had mostly a salad etc €12,00... A bit steep if you…

title: If you want the best
review: If you want the best food cooked and served by the A TOP HEAD CHEF....If you want your food served by Lorenzo and his team whose aim is  MAKE THE GUESTS HAPPY then stay here. But be warned my wife and I stayed for seven days from 18/05/16 to 25/05/16 there were it seemed MORE children then adults... It is the fourth time we have stayed at this hotel and normally the Management get the ratio right but this time we saw children aged 5 and  under staying up running wild which was poor. I had to tell some children who were running around a swimming to stop because the pool was CLOSED .Imagine if one or two children SLIPPED and broke a bone or two,,,The parents who I can say were not from UK let the children run riot.. So summing up if the management get that ratio right this Hotel…

title: 3.5/5: mostly good, some not so...
review: Stayed as a couple for 7 nights all inclusive in May. Room and hotel were clean and comfortable but air conditioning in room was useless. Staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel is very geared up for and brill for young children and not suitable for couples at all. Kids running around in the dining rooms when you're carrying hot drinks and touching the buffet with hands...yuk. Entertainment starts and finishes early (10pm) but is reasonable with bands and dance performances. Adults only pool with Bali beds is lovely but right next to the kids adventure pirate pool, playground and football ground so noisy! Also annoying that people think it's fine to bring their kids into the adult pool even if they are being quiet. Drinks are good, great selection and branded spirits on AI, food…

title: Great base for cyclists to explore the Island
review: We stayed here as a group of cyclists/triathletes using it as a base for a training week on a self-catering basis.   Facilities were perfect - the locked bike store, laundry and supermarket a real bonus - and rooms sizeable and comfortable.   The buffet dinner was a bit overpriced but there are so many places to eat within a few minutes' walk that it really doesn't matter.   Location was great for bike rides out of town or heading down to the beach for a swim or run.   Would definitely come back!

title: early may holiday
review: Visited the Viva Tropic in early May and booked a one bed apartment with pool view self catering. Our room was lovely with fully equipped kitchen, full size kettle, toaster, pots and pans etc.,microwave and fridge.And you have lots of English tv channels, and free wifi that works everywere. There are plenty of pools to use 5 in total, one being inside. This hotel is fully geared for family's with children and the play pool area is quite impressive. We did eat and drink at this hotel a couple of times, you are billed at reception on departure which we found reasonable. Really close to the beach and shops, restaurants bars, approx.  3min walk. Take a cab to Alcudia city, under 5 euros. Lovely beach great for kids, nice and shallow. This part of Alcudia is dedicated to cyclists.…

title: Great family hotel!
review: We went for 5 nights beginning of May, weather was just right for our 3 and 4 year olds. The kids play area and pool was great, they loved the kids clubs and the shows in the evening. The rooms were lovely and clean, as was the hotel. Deffo would recommend for families. We went self catering, plenty of nice restaurants around and literally 5 minute walk to the beach. Only down side are the pools are cold at this time of year and the kids shows were all foreign songs so they couldn't join in. Overall a fab place to stay!!!!!!!

title: Very nice, just don't have a beer or a snack there!
review: We didn't choose this hotel, we were supposed to be a Seaclub but it wasn't open for the new season yet so we were redirected here by Jet 2.  First impressions...very nice! Lovely reception desk, quick check-in.  Room, Floors, walls and beds clean, kitchen very basic but you don't go on holiday to cook do you? Beds very comfy, shower hot and strong, just how I like it. :D Not so good for a bath as when I put hot water in the tub the paint started peeling off! Slight mildew on edges of curtains and discoloured tile grout, so not perfect but livable. Had a ground floor apartment with a little "garden" with a hammock which was a lovely surprise, 2 sunbeds and a hanging rail for towels.  Dumped the cases and went off in search of food. Chose the hotel bar. Paid almost 50euros for 4…

title: Great family resort
review: Went early April for a week. Weather was excellent, low 20s but very sunny.  We were upgraded to the Royal Terrace Apt on 1st floor which was perfect, it has a large own private patio, hammock and hot tub. Apartment was very good - spacious, big comfy bed, great shower and adequate cooking facilities/utensils. Dishwashing liquid was provided and free wifi in the room too!  Only negatives, room was not cleaned everyday by the maid which was fine for us but maybe not for some people. And hot tub was not that clean, should be cleaned regularly.  Hotel facilities were great. Excellent playground for kids with trampoline and bouncy castle, and kids pool has many features however it was too cold to swim except a couple of afternoons.  Beach was 5 mins walk from the hotel and there…

title: stay on cycling break
review: nice one bedroom apartment - spacious and plenty of storage space - downstairs bike room that is controlled by your room card- reception provide locks - plenty of pools and one indoor one also. good buffet if you want to eat in hotel or 2 minute walk to port area and other restaurants .  lovely place and would go back

title: Very nice stay for our small family
review: Perfect stay off season in a superior suite with private terasse and jacuzzi. Perfect for our infant who could crawl around on the deck and never had to bother going to the pool but enjoy our privacy. Good food in the restaurants. Excellent pizzas!! Staff was very polite and caring. Unfortunately we heard that management or the chain doesn't treat the staff very well. Too bad cause the staff is their biggest asset. Never understood the cleaning part. We where told every day but the info in the room said not every day. The room could have been cleaner at arrival. It was dusty and seems uncared for.

title: Very nice hotel for families and couples
review: Viva tropic is a brilliant hotel but does have its negatives first I'll start with the positives. The adults only pool was very nice especially the beds always fell asleep  on them! The rooms are very nice and always cleaned with new sheets towels etc. The shower was amazing too. The indoor pool with jacuzzi is very good for a cloudy day or something a bit different. Negative things during my stay are the fact the adult only pool known as the quiet zone is right next to the kids pool wich I find odd as it condraticts the point. The air con in the room was pretty much useless and the rooms got so hot dread to think of it in peak season. Asked to hire a fan and apparently they don't offer this. The indoor pool isn't heated it's the room that's heated which is a bit of a downer as…

title: Wonderful stay for romantics
review: Wonderful hotel with room with terrace and jacuzzi on the roof. Beatific views of the hotel and outside. Way to the beach takes 5 min and to the nearest recreations.  It also great for spending time with children with many playgrounds and special pool with pirate boat for them  to play.  A little bit noise from children for someone who wants to be in quiet.

title: Great base for a cycle holiday
review: Stayed here with SportActive for a week cycling holiday in April. Great studio room, nice balcony, very clean. Stayed half board  and the food was fantastic! Walking distance from the beach and alcudia old town. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location and modern apartments.
review: I have just returned from a short 5night stay at the Viva Tropic.  The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes from the shopping / port area and also Alcudia beach. The apartments are modern and spacious.  There are plenty of sunbeds around the pool and the adult only 'relax' pool is also a nice addition to the hotel. Unfortunately as the pools were cold the hotel did allow children to use the pool and also the kids pool is situated right next to it. So sometimes its not quite as relaxing as you would hope but still its a nice space.  We ate lunch at the pool bar twice and the food was of a high standard and at a reasonable price.   The Tropic is certainly a family orientated hotel and they have several kids entertainers who always seemed to be working hard. This is…

title: Amazing ☀️
review: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Viva Tropic. Previously stayed at the Viva Sunrise in September. The hotel was faultless. Good value for money and we upgraded when we arrived to a room with a terrace and hot tub. This was worth every penny. One morning we opened our door to find a bottle of wine and fruit with a thank you note for returning to a Viva Hotel, this was a lovely touch considering we hadn't mentioned this to the staff upon check in. I would highly recommend this hotel and we can't wait to return in September.

title: Great Holiday
review: Just returned home today from a week here with my partner and daughter!! Had a great holiday would highly recommended this place for family's so much to do for kids my 3yr old daughter had lots of fun and really enjoyed the disco and bufo the bear staff where amazing really keep kids entertained cant wait to return next year!! Hotel beautiful and really clean staff all very nice 😊⛱ also do very gd cocktails 🍹😆

title: Absolutely superb
review: Friendly professional staff that get it just right!! Great food - spotless well cared for environment makes for a very relaxing break. Second visit and will return for sure. Excellent bathrooms and luxury full size toiletries - make such a difference!!

title: Fantastic holiday
review: We had a week at the viva tropic and wow what a great time. Although April we had great weather and the kids club and evening entertainment was brilliant. Charissa and babbia were amazing sorry if I've spelt that wrong but you girls are amazing my Eldest son loved your kids club. All staff at pool bar friendly and evening bar too. We were all inclusive and food was good and the pool bar at lunch was amazing. We will defo be returning to the hotel. Brilliant holiday xxx

title: Lovely
review: Stayed here the last week in the easter holidays .had a fantastic time pools were a tad on the cold side but to be expected for April was very quiet and plenty of loungers to choose from . Used the gym which seriously needs some maintenance  The spa was very good with good services on offer  All in all very pleasant holiday

title: Another Wonderful Stay
review: On arrival we upgraded to AI from halfboard which was well worth the money. Toni on reception was excellent as always and attended to our every need even giving us room near the rest of our party. Our room was pool facing on the 4th floor and spotless. The maid did a fantastic job. The food for breakfast and evening meal was buffet style, plenty of choice and changed each day with some theme nights. At lunch you could choose from a buffet style sitting or could choose off the bistro menu and the food off this menu was great. They had a kids menu to with lots of choice for the little ones and all on AI!!! Drinks on AI were just as if you paid at the bar. The staff worked tirelessly and to be honest they were a little short staffed for the amount of guests staying (in my opinion).…

title: my review on viva tropic
review: very expensive in hotel restaurant,very poor menu, very cold water in swimming pool.Nothing to do for teenagers.At night you can hear peoples footsteps,when they walk past your door.Very good bar steak house near by.

title: Adult pool
review: Just back from short visit to Alcudia..staying at viva tropic with the promise of quietness at the adult only pool.  The pool was crowded with children, babies both in the pool and on the loungers. Very disappointed.  Also gym with jazz is full of kids only..

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed at the viva tropic july 2015 and have rebooked for this july the hotel is really nice food was really good plenty of choice staff helpful rooms really spacious really nice pools although used adult pool daily as there are alot of families and children but then its a family hotel not many british guests but that didnt bother us entertainment most nights was great and we stayed all inclusive cocktails were amazing . Hotel really close to the beach and port cant wait to return this year

title: Great week in the sun, lovely hotel
review: Stayed for first time Easter April 2016, had a lovely week blue sky and sunshine every day which showed the hotel off at its best. Hotel was really nice, well maintained grounds, very clean, nice swimming pools and although most were very cold there was one pool heated outdoors and one indoors at the spa. We used the tennis court every day, no charge but you need to book at reception. Lots of sun loungers, every two have a parasol, off season in April so pool areas very quiet which was great, I imagine peak season it would be really busy if all those loungers were taken. Ate out so can't comment on restaurant, easy 5 min walk to stunning huge long beach and nice walkway great for a stroll to start the day. Rooms fine, cleaned every second day with fresh towels. Would come again…

title: Very nice hotel
review: Very nice hotel. Room was nice, nothing special, but big enough for 4. we went SC, their was a fridge, microwave and a couple of hobs (we didn't use). Free WiFi was great worked very well. We didn't eat in the hotel or watch any entertainment so I cant comment. Lots of pools, the adult only pool did allow kids in while we were there, the double beds were very comfy, the pool was supposed to be heated, but it didn't feel like it. The indoor pool was amazing as the weather was up and down, not much room for beds in there though only around 8, but the pool was great. Free crazy golf on site, only 9 holes and not spectacular, but good fun. Nice kids play area with a bouncy castle, trampoline and climbing stuff. my only disappointment and this is not the hotels fault in anyway is the…

title: Very happy
review: This was our first trip to Alcudia and we were not disappointed. We stayed at viva tropic for a week mid April. Although very early in the season and no outdoor bar, we were really pleased with facilities on offer. 4 adults and 2 children (age 6 and 3). We had 2 one bedroom apartments. We went room only and we're happy enough with the restaurants on offer locally. We did eat al a cart which was ok and reasonably priced (all inc at €53 per day and half price for kids but we didn't go for it).  The rooms were clean and well maintained and had kitchen facilities  and basic kitchen equipment. Mini filter coffee machine on offer (which we didn't bother using but would have brought coffee and filters if I'd have known). You're provided with washing liquid too! We have been potty…

title: Holiday
review: Viva Tropic in Alcudia,   Hotel Viva Tropic   On arrival at the hotel we were asked if we would like to change from two rooms to appartment which we took. The appartment was good ground floor gate opens to pool area.   But the only downside to it was the children's playing area was right outside the appartment,  but this didn't stop us enjoying the holiday.  Staff good, but the only problem the bar staff weren't friendly as all other staff were.  Weather mostly windy overcast, but still could enjoy walking around by the bars and beach, about 5 to 10 minutes walk depends on how quick you walk.  Free wifi in all areas including the rooms and appartment. This good family friendly place

title: Return to the port of Alcudia
review: After visiting two year's ago and staying in a sister hotel last year (see Viva Blue review), we decided to return to the Viva Tropic. The Hotel is very busy at the moment but there is no lacking .n the quality of the facilities or the presentation of the surroundings. The hotel even welcomed us back with a small bottle of quality red wine and a fruit plate - just another little touch that make these hotels the places you wish to return to - I just hope the weather picks up so that we can really enjoy all the hotel as to offer.

title: Friendly, pleasant hotel disappointed with pool and food
review: Nice clean room, lovely staff particularly those on reception and beauty therapist in Spa. Well located for restaurants, beach, shops. Very disappointed by the pools - being low season we had access to the two heated pools (one indoor as part of spa, one outdoor normally adult only) - lukewarm would be an overstatement - we had to brace ourselves to go in the water and our little boy could only tolerate five minutes or so before he got too cold. Very glad we were self-catering as there were lots of good places to eat locally and the food in the hotel (we tried the bar area and the buffet) was mediocre. However, the self catering facilities amounted to a microwave and two very tiny electric rings so clearly you were expected to eat out.

title: Everything perfect
review: Spent a week at viva tropic (1st week of April).....we were half board in a one bedroom apartment which was a good size and well furnished etc. everything about viva tropic was fantastic from good and pleasant staff, excellent food, clean and good rooms,central location and in easy walk of old town and facilities to suit every age. Really couldn't fault anything about it and is certainly a great place for families.  A great place for a holiday!

title: Fantastic holiday
review: This hotel is a fantastic family hotel. Amazing facilities for children of all ages mini water park and other water features for older kids.Very close to port and beach.Loads of places to eat around the corner and beyond.Very clean well kept and was one of the most relaxing holidays due to the facilities. Really nice adults only area with water jets and jacuzzi. Great steam room, sauna.. Gym. If you are a cyclist there are organised tours and a professional bike shop...Bar staff great although very busy ..entertainment staff work hard and keep kids happy...this is a family hotel and if you have children they will make many friends ... All in all we loved it and I will return to viva hotels as there are many on the island and on menorca!!

title: A bit disappointed....
review: Viva Tropic is a typical familly-resort with a big outside-pool area and playgrounds. We've stayed for a week with a 2 year-old in an privillege-room on the ground-floor, that comes with a private terrace. The room was more ore less tidy, with a little kitchen/living room area. The big minus here is that the whole furniture and bathroom is in desperate need for renovation. Everything works dough, but please, since they claim to offer a 4 star standart...well it is not, at least not for 2016!!! If you want to be familly or kids-friendly, everything is about details: The big private terrace is only surrounded by little young hedges, so our toddler had absolutely no difficulties to get by pool area by himself! So we had to watch him all the time... the main pools are not heated The…

title: Amazing for children
review: Just returned from a week so with my partner and 5 year old. Although a mixed bag concerning the weather the facilities were brilliant. There is a great park which is in the shade including a trampoline, bouncy castle and slides. Attached is a child's pool with several slides for various ages. There are also another 4 pools all catering for different ages and interests. My partner particularly like the bouncer one you had to climb up! Indoor pool for those days without sunshine. Never a problem to get a lounger, no mad rush!  My daughter loved the kids club too! As well as the evening disco, she would like it to be longer, 45 minutes goes quickly. Only ate in hotel once as sc for a change. The food was to a high standard when we did have it. Best range of desserts I've seen in a…

title: Good family hotel, service let it down
review: Recently returned from a family holiday here. Overall it was a great experience - the hotel was lovely and clean and the reception staff were polite and helpful. We asked for a room close by to family members and a travel cot in the room and was sorted straight away. Check in was quick and easy. The hotel has a range of swimming pools which were clean with lifeguards on duty. The children's pirate pool didn't open until 30th March and when it did it didn't seem to have been cleaned. The shop in the hotel is well stocked and reasonable prices. Indoor pool was lovely and if you ask at reception they will turn on the steam room and sauna. The only thing to let the hotel down is the bar and waiter service. We stayed here self catering but wanted to eat here from the bar menu a…

title: Gatecrashed xx
review: Family were staying at this hotel. Our hotel was awful so spent 3 days here. Great for children. Pool cold. Wonderful clean rooms with kitchen facilities. Entertainment good for kids in the evening. Bar man needs to cheer up. Would stay here xx

title: Cycling trip
review: Great base for a cycling trip. Hotel has excellent facilities and is very clean. One slight complaint is the uncomfortable beds. Please upgrade them.  The resort was very quiet but it was February. If you want the mountains or flats to cycle along everything is on your doorstep here.

title: Perfect hotel. Perfect location.
review: This hotel was amazing for me my partner and our then nearly two year old!!! The staff were so friendly, and they couldn't do enough for you. The food was lovely. And different every night. The entertainment was really good. And they encouraged kids to get involved too. There is severely pools to choose from. Including a children's pool with little water slides and a park to play in. My little boy was always having a brilliant time running around with the other children. The hotel itself is walking distance from the beach (which is lovely). And so close to bars, shops and restaurants. I would recommend the paella ones along the beach!! We did lots of tours. Which were all well organised through the hotel. Absolutely no complaints! This was one of my favourite holidays by far.…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Lovely family friendly hotel. All staff helpful and approachable. Rooms comfortable and spacious. Within walking distance from the beach, shops bars and restaurants. A visit to Alcudia old town is recommended. Would book to stay again.

title: Perfecf family holiday
review: I'm a Majorca convert! We came here 'out of season' but it was still the perfect first family holiday abroad.  The food at the hotel is a buffet style every night, but the food is changed daily so you don't see the same things all the time, and it is delicious. There's a lot of salads as well as cooked food, desserts and cheeses to choose from, and the breakfasts are just as plentyful, and I know that 'in season' there is an a la carte menu to choose from. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with a undercounted fridge to keep your own cold drinks etc if wanted. There's several outdoor pools and activities to keep the kids entertained, as well as an indoor pool, spa and gym. The hotel is perfectly located, a quick and easy 5 minute walk to the beach, where there is white sand…

title: Short break in March
review: Booked a last minute 4 day break and what luck - booked into this hotel.  A 4 star hotel 5 minutes walk from the beach and beautiful port.  Although quiet the hotel still had a lovely relaxing atmosphere - great for bikers with its own bike hire - great standard of bikes - bike garage for storage and organised bike rides - didn't try them and you may have to pay separately.  We stayed self catering but did see the food and it looked great.  The room we had vas very spacious with a well equipped kitchen and great walk-in shower.  We were very lucky with the weather 18 to 20 degrees for the days we were there - the only down side of going this early is that only the bars and shops around the port are open - still plenty of places to eat and have a drink - finding an early…

title: Viva Tropic
review: My boyfriend and I have stayed here twice; in October 2014 and September 2015. During both holidays we stayed in a (self-catering) studio, and found the studios to be clean and quite spacious (the bathroom has a good sized walk in shower). There is a small kitchen area in the studio, although we didn’t use it to cook, we did use the fridge to store water/drinks. During both holidays we spent most of our time on the beach, and out and about in the resort, but did spend a few afternoons chilling in the adult only pool area with the bali beds, which was lovely.  It’s a short walk from the hotel to the beach and an abundance of restaurants, bars, and shops. We have also walked to the Old Town on several occasions, which is wonderful.  All the staff we came into contact with were…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed here for 4 nights. Lovely hotel. Quite impressive inside. The room was a great size. With large bed, pool view from sitting area and bedroom. Great ealk in shower. Bathroom was quite big and well decorated. Came with a full selection of toiletries. Didnt go outside much as the weather wasnt very good. But great size pools and very well kept. We ate in the buffet restauramt twice. It was ok for €18 euros each, maybe a little over priced amd the food could have been a bit warmer. Its a great location. 5 minute walk to the beach and port centre. If you go early march be prepared for most of the bars restaurants and shops to be shut. We are glad we hired a car. We got around the island very well. And on half a tank of fuel. Tje stafg were very friendly. The shop is well…

title: Good and not so good
review: We have stayed here twice. First time in a studio which was a bit grim. Had single beds with awful mattresses with heavy duty metal frames inside. This year have upgraded to a double apartment which is soooo much better, if you can afford it. Bathroom has very decent marble walk-in shower with overhead and hand held versions. V good. Lounge and bedroom kept v clean. Mattress on double bed OK - a bit soft and had collapsed a bit through use so we turned around. Also has one of those awful plastic undersheets on that makes you sweat - and this was February. Spa in hotel has decent Turkish steam room and sauna. Massages on site. Excellent for cyclists - has secure store room with mechanic on site (if he turns up...) and a free laundry to wash kit. Now the not so good - the food.…

title: A great winter getaway
review: We booked this on New Years Day as a need for a 4 day escape from our wet winter. We had never been to Majorca before. We wanted somewhere with self catering, inexpensive and with sunshine, that was our only criteria. This met our needs perfectly. Many parts of the island are closed at this time of year as it's their winter but it is still sunny and warm in the middle of the day, but chilly mornings and evenings. The area this hotel is in is still open with some bars and restaurants near the beach open for business. We had a fridge, microwave and hob in our room and the bed was huge and very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with a lovely shower with huge head. We hired a car online and collected it from the airport, an easy process, so we explored the island and asked the…

title: Great place fantastic people
review: It's taken a little while to sit down and review the hotel but it was such a good holiday that I felt I should write something.  We visited the hotel in September and were lucky enough to manage an upgrade after our first night to a garden room which we'd just missed out on when booking.  This was a real benefit for when our toddler was napping.  Both rooms we had were very clean and spacious enough though not quite big enough to move the single bed into the double bedroom without having to put it back in the sitting room every day.  We did try to store it under the double bed but it was a squeeze and caused problems for the maids.  On that front, they we really lovely and very helpful and our room was always well looked after.  That was the theme for the hotel.  The pool staff…

title: Holiday
review: Lovely holiday with good food, great selection at evening buffet and beautifully presented. Nice lunch options, good selections in all inclusive choices and friendly staff. Evening mini disco very good. Adult only pool area lovely. Gardens nice for relaxing. Wifi good. Rooms very nice. We have already booked again for next year.

title: Nice Hotel In near Alcudia port
review: Efficient check in / check out Good location to beach & Spar shop which was convenient as we were self catering. The room was a good size with chairs & table in the room. The patio was a good size with a plastic chair and table. We got the sun in the morning but the other hotel side possibly offered a better sunset, though we did have a view of mountains. The hotel does have other hotels apartments / residential accommodation around it though.  We were on the top floor 5th floor & had no mosquito issues. Not that I was aware of any during our stay.  The bed was very big & comfortable. Safe was available at 2.50 euro per day There was a small electric cooker, microwave, fridge freezer, coffee maker, crockery, knives forks etc. Enough for basic self catering. Noticeable no oven or…

title: Family friendly
review: Overall a good hotel but a few pros and cons.  Pros-  Staff are exceptional! Friendly, pleasant, welcoming and fantastic with children including crazy toddlers! In particular Maria at the pool bar, she is a credit to the hotel.  Great range of facilities, decent size complex. Entertainment is good and kids club has good activities during the day.   Could not be more child friendly. Kids are in their element here.  Great location, quiet but near beach and short walk to Alcudia Old Town.  Cons-  Rooms. Kitchenette is useless unless you are staying half board or all inclusive do not expect to prepare much more than snacks. No oven and no work surface at all. Cramped and no electrical outlet for kettle or toaster. The dining table becomes multi functional... 1bedroom apartment felt…

title: Lovely place
review: This hotel is lovely and clean and well situated for all your needs. The supermarket, beach and restaurants are all close by making this hotel ideally situated. The hotel itself is lovely and clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The pools are clean and the pool area is litter free and very well maintained. Our room was cleaned almost everyday and our cleaner used to leave my sins Teddy's in different positions every time she made the bed which had my son laughing his head off. Lovely place.

title: Relaxing hotel, ideally placed, with great food!
review: Room had everything you could wish for and it was clean and comfortable. Even the bed my wife had was changed (the mattress had a 'sunken' spot within it) within the hour following an uncomfortable night.  The spa was just great, with a really professional masseuse, who was charming as well. Food variety was ideal, with something for everyone.   This family-oriented hotel had a relaxed and safe atmosphere throughout our stay, with children happily being themselves with minimal restrictions on what they could or could not do!  You can easily reach the beach and the Port of Alcudia within ten minutes, or the walled old town of Alcudia itself the former capital of Majorca.

title: Cycling holiday in Majorca
review: Great hotel for a cycling holiday and we also incorporated days by the pool. Lovely room with a great little kitchenette, lovely and clean and couldn't fault it. Although we ate in Alcudia which is a lovely 20 minute walk, the food at the hotel was exceptional and we chose to eat there most times . The beach is literally a 200m walk with bars and restaurants close by for an evening stroll. The supermarket at the hotel is very handy but there is a Spar and Eskardi supermarket down the road . We also went for the cycling and lots of cycling routes close by that we downloaded from the Internet. The hotel has a locked space for bikes and also an area for washing the dust off.  There were only really a couple of negatives about the hotel - one being the wi-fi which is very hit and…

title: Pretty good
review: Visited here on a deal, fantastic location. Rooms were clean and well presented. Facilities are good, plenty of space for kids and adults. Outdoor pool is freezing! Gym could do with an upgrade and machines repaired. Food was poor, only ate onsite once. Fab layout of hotel and the port and beach only minutes away. Supermarket nearby is much cheaper than hotel shop. All round a good place, dying to try the new viva hotel up the road as it looks amazing.

title: Ideally located hotel
review: Booked as a last mi it's break for me and my daughter I was unsure of what to expect but this hotel was perfect for us.  Choosing to go self catering I cannot comment on the food but the evening drinks are reasonably priced. We were located in the hotel block so felt safe although were woken up one night by a couple having a domestic! Not ideal! The kids pool is perfect for entertaining little ones, even if it was freezing! Definitely worth a visit if you want to be located near to the port (5mins walk). We will definitely be returning.

title: Cycling holiday
review: First class hotel offering very good accommodation, rooms offer all the requirements needed fridge,microwave etc. Vast range of buffet style food. Entertainment every evening, excellent particularly if you have children. Would definitely visit again even with wife next time for a break. My recent visit was included in a cycling holiday through Sportsactive who use the hotel as a base.

title: Top quality hotel
review: Just back from another visit to the Tropic which has given us many happy holidays.Yet again this hotel met all our requirements.Our one-bedroom poolside apartment was perfect,Toni and all the staff really work hard to maintain this hotel at a high standard.Hope to be back for many more holidays

title: great hotel
review: Thank you for your comments, we are so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you the next year again.

title: Fantastic family hotel!!
review: Well here we are again back from our two week break at the Viva Tropic. Lovely time had by my husband and I. Staff lovely and hard working, Toni on reception, waiters, Carlos,David and all the rest whose names I did not get work very hard to make your stay enjoyable. Outdoor space is always great and kept clean, I know there are issues with the lounger, but I was informed that hopefully new ones will be in place next year. Many thanks to all at Viva Tropic, see you next year. Dave and Denise Benson

title: Great family resort, rooms need renovating
review: Fantastic all round hotel and family friendly with fantastic entertainment. Very clean and located close to the beach would go back again. Friendly staff and entertainment team. Downside to holiday very few uk/ English citizens for my children to play with or us to speak to.

title: Good location, Good for families
review: Stayed here with my boyfriend 3rd week of September on half bored basis which included breakfast and dinner.   Pros- *Good location, only couple of minutes to the gorgeous beach. Close to shops, restaurants & bars and harbour. *The food in the hotel was amazing, cooked perfectly and plenty of choice for everyone's taste. For this reason alone i would go back there! *Great for families with kids, the staff treat the kids really well and the children's entertainment seemed good.  *The chill out pool was good, for 18+ although the beds in the sun go quickly. *It wasn't a problem getting a sun bed round the main pool after breakfast, there are so many you should find one easily. There's also a big garden at the side of the hotel (with a volley ball sand court) and there's tons of…

title: Great hotel with little kids
review: This is a fantastic hotel. We loved the pools, playground, food and the service in the restaurant. All the waiters were always making jokes with our one year old. Especially Toni. We also enjoyed the entertainment and the facilities for kids like renting à high chair.   We booked à privilege appartement with garden, absolutely very relaxing to chill in our sun loungers when the baby was asleep.  The room was à bit outdated and especially the bed was not comfortable. We were in block 3 and after reading the reviews we asked for à room in block 4. We would have to pay 30€ extra per night. Since we are already in à quiete expensive privilege room this was too much for us. Anyway the room was very clean, cleaned everyday by friendly Polita. One last thing: there was an electrical…

title: Well maintened and nice, modern hotel
review: We stayed 6 nights in Viva Tropic, and the studio was very nice and practical for our needs: small but well functioning kitcenette, nice bed, large balcony and a good enough shower. The air condition worked also very well. Only down side in the room was the quite unpractical table/chairs- set: the table was too high for the chairs, so eating in the room was a  bit tricky. The chairs were also dirty with some breadcrumbs, so although the cleaning is generally very good, some spots seem to be missed by the cleaning ladies. This wasn't an issue thought. Wifi was really slow in the room (ours faced the street). It was a bit better in the lobby, though. The pool area is big enough even during the high season, so we always found ourselves free sunbeds even if we arrived during the…

title: Wonderful Port d'Alcudia
review: We stayed at Viva Tropic the last week of August. We had  a one-bedroom on the fifth floor, facing the surroundings. Every morning we got to experience the wonderful sunrise from our balcony. The apartment was fresh, with good size and layout; nice furniture, big bathroom, kitchenette with everything we needed. The only complaint we had were the beds. They were awful! Really hard and you could feel the springs in the mattress (no top mattress) and it had a pee sheet on that made a lot of noise when you turned in bed. One of us actually slept on the sofabed (which was soft and comfortable) instead of the bedroom bed. I slept in the bedroom bed, but had to put two wool blankets (folded) and the "duvet" (also folded in half) on the bed to create a "top-mattress" and had a towel as…

title: Absolutely fantastic!
review: Oh my god wow. Everything about this place is amazing. This hotel is definitely our kind of hotel... Very smart, modern and clean yet not 'snobby' like a lot of other hotels of this standard. Check in was smooth and efficient and our room was ready for our arrival even though we arrived early morning. Fab! Our studio room was very clean, serviced by Lorena and very modern. Huge TV on the wall and very smart beds/bedding and shower room was superb!   The pool areas and grounds are lovely. Very clean, plenty of room to spread out with sun loungers and a lot going on throughout the day in terms of activities & entertainment should you want to join in. If you want a bit more peace & quiet then the over 18's adults 'chill out pool' with 'double mattress's' is wonderful. For small…

title: Fab hotel fab holiday
review: Went to viva tropic, stayed in the main building on the first floor from 5/9 to 15/9 what a lovely hotel the whole place looks like it's been refurbished very recently. Check in was very easy and fast all information gave to us there is a young blond girl on reception very helpful, the room had a wooden floor bathroom to the left kitchen to the right and very large modern TV on the wall, and a balcony, we were self catering so can not report on the food but we did have food around the pool what was delicious. The rooms are cleaned every day apart from Sunday and Wednesday, our housekeeper lorena was very good and a very nice lady  our room was cleaned to a high standard room was spotless, this hotel is great for family's as the days are jammed packed with kids entreatment the…

title: Fab hotel
review: Absolutely loved this hotel, visited with my husband & 1 year old son. The facilities are great, we used the bikes on a few occasions and would recommend it. Great way to see Alcudia. Extremely family friendly and will definitely be back. We had bed & breakfast, and the choice & food was fantastic! The kids entertainment even for our one year old was awesome. Would absolutely recommend.

title: Must have accessory is a small child!
review: Lucky for us we had one of those - this hotel was full of young children even after school holidays ended. Perfect and just what we were after. The splash pool and kids play area were a big hit with our two yr old. Beach was just what we were after - sunbeds for hire were worth the €4.50 and the whole beach area was immaculate. Sea perfect for kids. We walked to Alcudia old town several days and evenings and so glad we did - lovely shops and restaurants.  My only small gripe about the Viva Tropic was that I thought our studio apartment was a bit tired and dated. We were self catering but facilities limited and we didn't end up making anything other than toast. The beds were a bit like two kids single beds pushed together. We didn't bother much with the entertainment at night and…

title: Perfect for young families
review: We have just got back from a week a t Viva Tropic with our 1 year old daughter. We have had the best time and our little girl had the time of her life. The entertainment for the kids is great and the staff are all very friendly and enthusiastic! Rooms are lovely and clean and have everything you need especially for little ones. We are sad to be back and already planning our next visit!

title: Great in some bits
review: First time in majorca, traveling with the a 6year old and a 9 month old.We booked a royal terrace apartment. we where a bit concerned that we booked top floor royal, because of the kids, however there was nothing to worried about.The room was top notch, with great views, stairs go up to the jacuzzi from your balcony,and very safe for kids.The hotel itself was good, with good food at the pool bar, and the night time entertainment was well organised,with variety late evening. Great entertainment team, always smiling and saying hi to you.Did find the kids entertainment a bit repetitive, my 6 year old even noticed this, and gave up going to it on 4th night.great kids pool,and adult pool.Now the bad bits, there seem to be a lack of security at the hotel, firstly they charge to use…

title: Absolutely Wonderful
review: I have just arrived home from a wonderful week with my husband and two sons (16 and 10). Without sounding like a walking advert :-  ROOM We paid extra for a royal terrace apartment.  We were allocated the first floor.  Having a 10yr old with us,  having a first floor was perfect as he could relax in the jacuzzi or on the terrace without our panicking about him being out there as we would have with a roof version of this room.  Bed in the main bedroom is spacious and comfortable.  The pull out bed my youngest used does have a habit of rolling away during sleep but not a big issue.   POOLS Busy during peak times.  Has one relatively shallow pool and one deeper pool both of which my family had a great time in.  There is a splash pool for younger children and an over 18th pool that…

title: Family holiday
review: Overall we had a fantastic holiday and would return to this hotel without question.  That said, in order to fairly review the hotel I should discussboth the good points and the areas where improvments could be made.  In order not to end on a bad note I shall deal with the negative first; although none of the negative were particulalry bad, I hope that the small details make this hotel even better.  Wifi:  Although free it was very patchy and very often I could not get the signal.  The hotel 200 yards away had a very stronger signal than Tropic's!  Table service for the bar:  Very slow.  This however, does not seem to be the fault of the staff rather than a lack of them.  Come on Viva, employ a few more!  Poolside Sun Loungers:  Almost every one of them was broken.  The plastic…

title: What a great family hotel highly recommeded
review: We have just returned from a fabulous holiday at the Viva tropic where I struggle to find anything wrong at all. The staff are friendly, the food is great something for even the fussiest child (mine!) and the pools are excellent, the kids pool has a pirate ship with slides and water cannons, there are also other water play things that kept my four and two year olds amused all day.  The room was spotless and we paid the extra for a room with a garden which was so worth while, great to let the children calm down from the fun of the pirate ship and also brilliant from some peaceful sunbathing without anyone else bothering you.   The entertainment for the kids was very good with a bit of acting and sing a long fun for all ages, the later evening entertainment appeared to be of a…

title: Some good some bad
review: Me and my wife have been visiting alcudia for several years and have stayed at the viva tropic on 7 occasions. We enjoy the Adult area so this is the main reason why we stay and its location. This year we was located at the back of the hotel overlooking a road and facing a private apartment block . For the 10 nights we had to listen to a dog barking from 5am onwards ? I reported this on three occasions and not once did I get a reply . I no its not the hotels fault but they have a responsibility to do something about this as we are there customers. We cannot be the only people that has complained about this as it was unbelievable at times . That was a massive negative for us and no response poor . The hotel is clean maids very good and generally in good condition not sure four…

title: Holiday With The Children in Alcudia
review: The weather was fantastic and our two young daughters had a fantastic time. The pools and play facilities (water slides, ship, bouncy castle, climbing frame and kids club) were excellent and we never needed to venture away from the hotel in a 10-day stay.  We stayed all-inclusive and the buffet for breakfast, lunch and evening meal offered a very good choice of food for both adults and children. A good range of soft drinks and snacks was also included in the price.  The evenings were filled with entertainment for the kids followed by a more mature show and on the whole, the quality of acts was very good.  The rooms and hotel as a whole was kept very clean and the facilities were very good.  The waiters in the restaurant were very professional and service overall was excellent. …

title: 2nd Visit to Viva hotel
review: Myself, husband and two Young children enjoyed Viva Palma Nova last year so we knew we wanted to try another Viva hotel this year, so we booked Viva Tropic.  The room we requested was excellent near the kids pool and playground  Food was good we ate lunch mainly in the pool bar.  Husbands birthday was whilst we were away and we found Cava in the room which was a nice touch.  The hotel however does need to review its smoking policy as having to move your children from people smoking adjacent to them by the pool and whilst eating is not really ideaL  The entertainment was good especially kids disco and the bar service at night was very good and Toni was excellent.  The room was good although the a bit tired in the bathroom, which only had a large walk in shower  Pool beds were…

title: Perfect Family Hotel
review: We stayed for one week at the Viva Tropic from 20-27 August 2015. We were impressed by the Viva hotel in C'an Picafort in 2013 so decided to book again with Viva and we were so glad we did. We booked all elements of our trip separately and easily located and booked the Tropic. We booked a studio for our small family of 3 which was basically a double room with a small single bed next to a double bed and a small kitchenette unit with fridge and hob. It was perfect for what we needed, a good size and we didn't miss having a lounge area at all as we were hardly there and there was the balcony to relax on when our daughter was in bed. The room was cleaned daily, even on the days when they said it wouldn't be cleaned so it always felt fresh. The bathroom was large with a great walk in…

title: Fab Holiday
review: Excellent holiday!!! The hotel room was lovely, with a garden and gate leading to the swimming pool.  Really enjoyed the food, always a lot to choose from.  All the staff were very helpful, especially a lady at reception which helped us with our transfer back to the airport when we missed the bus.  Would not hesitate to return but would stay longer next time.

title: Superb hotel
review: We travelled to this hotel with our 3 children. 8,6 and 2. Although our children chose not to join the kids club they were happy throughout. The kids club staff looked very busy keeping lots of children very happy. The hotel is suited highly to families however does have a quiet pool for adults only so couples would love too.  We found the hotel spotlessly clean. The staff work so hard and are all very friendly. As others mentioned the pirate ship and park area is a massive hit for the kids.  There is a great variety of food and the option to have a la carte. The evening restaurant for a la carte is not included in the all inclusive option.  Entertainment varied on an even. We found it finished fairly early  compared to other hotels we've stayed in. Not really an issue for us as…

title: Wouldn't stay again
review: Family of four. On arrival, allocated a room in block 3. Don't know why but we paid extra 30 euro a day to upgrade to a more modern room in block 4.   Don't get me wrong the room is adequately sized and nice comfy bed.   Floor never very clean, long black hairs on towels and on floor.  Can't go barefoot in room or you would get the beds minging.  Drinks are very overpriced and night entertainment not good.  We went to the delfin azul in the evening, entertainment much better and drinks more realistically priced.   Kids enjoyed the pool area for children and amenities Are good but would not come back to this hotel.

title: Excellent hotel and facilities
review: We stayed here for the last two weeks of August for our main holiday and were not disappointed.  The hotel has excellent facilities for families with numerous pools catering for all ages, including the children's pirate ship with slides. The entertainment staff offer activities throughout the day for both children and adults.  There are more than sufficient sun beds and the impressive thing for us compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Majorca is that there is no rush for beds in the morning. We could come down to the pool in the morning between 9 and 10 and have no problem getting beds. The hotel provides pool towels and they will remove them if people do try and reserve beds.  The location is excellent within a few minutes stroll to the beach and the marina area with…

title: Superb
review: We visit every year .we stayed here two weeks of holiday. Really it is very cheap and neat clean . Staffs also very friendly and helpful Defo we will come back next year .this is very quite place and beach also not so far form here we did not find any wrong .

title: Great stay!!!
review: Fantastic hotel to have a holiday with the family! We have 3 kids aged 11,5,3. We all had a great time there. All the staff are excellent, they all work very very hard. The kids club staff made it very enjoyable for us and the kids. I would definitely recommend this hotel for every aspect, location was also excellent if you wanted to dine elsewhere, visit the beach or go for nice walks.   Our son misplaced his wallet with about €100 in it, and it was found and handed back in to house keeping. Very grateful to the house keeping staff for finding it! We think it got tangled up in bedding, regardless we really appreciate the fact that it was turned in!   We will definitely be returning, some great memories had and hopefully more to make.   Thank you Viva Tropic!!

title: Best All-Inclusive Hotel
review: If you are reading this review because you are thinking about booking a holiday at the Viva Tropic - book it!    If you are reading this review because you work for Viva or at the Viva Tropic - thank you, thank you, thank you for a truly amazing holiday.  See you next year x   .....................  It's not easy to find words to describe the Viva Tropic without sounding like a PR exec, but put simply, it's perfect!  Never before have I been to a hotel and had absolutely no complaints.  Literally not a single thing to moan about.  From arrival to departure every moment of our stay was idyllic (bar the three days of rain, and I'm sure that if the hotel staff could have made the sun shine, they would have!).   On arrival the reception staff were efficient, friendly and helpful.…

title: Fantastic family hotel
review: Just back following a 10 day stay at this fab hotel.
