My 9 year had a ball, there was always something going on to keep him entertained from morning to night.The staff were the best we have ever come across and ensured we were all well looked after, they never stopped and always had a smile for everyone. Food was great, rooms clean and comfy,  near beautiful beach. Cannot recommend this hotel enough if you are looking for a child friendly relaxing trip away. We will return!

title: Brilliant family holiday
review: Just returned from a weeks holiday at Viva tropic from 14th to 21st August. . We were a large family group with 2 grandparents, 4 adults and 4 children ranging from 3 to 8 and stayed All inclusive.  The only downside was the 3 days of rain but we made the best of it and the hotel kindly provided umbrellas when going out.  Room : we stayed in block 1 and had requested adjacent rooms via email prior to arrival which the hotel kindly accommodated.The rooms overlooked the road but was quiet and peaceful. Good size bedroom and ample storage space . Useful kitchen area with everything you needed. kettle, microwave , glasses.  plates cutlery and tea towel etc. Safety deposit box in bedroom costing approx  2.50 a day. bathroom had a large rain shower with a lower attachment for the…

title: Nice Hotel with good all inclusive and service - but crowded pool area
review: We stayed at Tropic in August 2015, two adults and one kid 3 years-old. 2 room apartment towards the garden (building 3, room 3201). Our first charter vacation and first ALL inclusive, and our first FAMILY hotel - so we were excited to see if we would like it. Keep reading if You want to learn from our experience.  The Room: Our Room had a good location, not too much noise from pool/bar area. Nice and clean, all though they don't clean everyday which is a little annoying. Nice micro-Kitchen which would cover most needs. The extra bed for the kid was under the sofa and folds up in the living room which is also where the balcony is, so do consider if You want to spend Your nights just outside where the kid sleeps.  Food & Service: We had ALL-Inclusive, which was really good since…

title: Family friendly hotel
review: Our review is based upon a family of 3, 2 adults, 1 child (10) staying self catering for 10 nights in a deluxe one bedroom apartment in block 4. The score is based upon comparing to other hotels we have stayed at in Spain which is why we felt a score of 3 was fair although if we could give it a 3.5 we would.  The hotel itself is set back from the main road and about 5 minutes walk to the beach and about 20 minutes walk to the old town(which is a must if you want to feel like you are actually in Spain).There are plenty of bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk , steak houses, burger bar, Chinese, Indian, fish and chips. There is also a small tourist train which takes you for a ride around the area.We come away for the culture so we ventured further afield to find the more…

title: Great hotel!
review: We stayed in Viva Tropic from 14th Aug to 21st Aug, During our stay it rained for three days; usually this would cause a lot of angst with children (6 and 8) but thanks to the amazing children's entertainment team (especially Josephine, Kenneth and Kevin) they managed to keep the kids occupied with face painting, pirates's adventure activities etc.     We loved this hotel and we were more than happy with the food provided, Great overall!

title: Great family holiday
review: We were on holiday with our daughter and young family in two apartments...we in a qpremiere studio in Block 1 and the young family in a 2 bedroom apartment in Block 2 where, strangely, as many residents had young children and buggies to cope with, there was no lift. However, I think this, and the fact that my mattress was not very comfortable as I could feel the springs digging into me, was the only negative aspect of the holiday. The real treasure of this hotel is its staff. Every single member of staff we came into contact with was polite, friendly and keen to be of service. My daughter had a couple of minor issues with her apartment and maintenance staff were dispatched and sorting out the problem almost as soon as she replaced the phone!  But the real stars for our…

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Stayed here for 7 nights in August 2015 with Wife and 2 children.  We had a deluxe 1 bed apartment (room 4104|) which is in a newish block towards the rear of the complex.  The room had a very big bathroom with shower for adults and a lower attachment for children (very useful).  2 sinks and a large mirror on the wall with shelf to put things on.  Only minor issue with bathroom was the electrical connection for shaver was off the wall with an exposed earth wire, didn't effect us and assumed it was going to be fixed soon.  The main room had a small kitchen area with a small table and 2 chairs, 2 more chairs were in the room if you wanted to move the trable to seat 4 at once.  Small sink with 2 hot plates to cook on.  Ample for breakfast but anything more would have been a…

title: Still a lovely hotel
review: Our 2nd visit to the Viva Tropic and still a lovely hotel Rooms were very clean and the staff were again very friendly Our only negative was the menu at the pool bar seems to have been reduced from the last time, but we would certainly go again

title: nice hotel, great splash pool
review: We have just come bacl from our stay at the Viva Tropic. We went as a family of four with a 3 year old and 7 year old. Check in was slow as first they try to upgrade you for a supplement which the people in front didn't understand and i think were duped into paying more. We were offered a pool view or room with terrace, we declined and stuck with what was allocated which low and behold was a pool view room! The pool areas are fab, the splash pool allows children to play and adults to relax.  The larger pools get busy and it is impossible to get a bed unless you go down at 7am!!!! We never ate at the hotel as we were s/c but we did have a few drinks in the evening.  The entertainment was good but we felt the staff favoured the children who attended the kids clubs, our didn't as…

title: Viva Tropic - 2nd Fantastic Stay
review: We booked Viva Tropic last year and were so happy that we booked again for July/August 2015. The hotel and staff were just as good as last year and we were so pleased by the little touches that make your stay all the more enjoyable.   We received a courtesy bottle of red wine and a fruit selection on the first day as a returning guest which was a great touch; then later in our stay were asked if we would like to spend our final night in the Royal Terrace room courtesy of the hotel which we gladly accepted.  The hotel has high expectations in respect of cleanliness and this is a credit to the Viva Group. To top it off we have booked for a third straight year in 2016!

title: 2nd visit Amazing staff all round top notch will be returning.
review: This was our 2nd visit and the staff were even better than last year. I emailed the hotel asking for the same block we had last year as it was quiet and allowed my son to nap in the afternoon I also asked for a bath as my son has severe eczema and needs a big greasy bath after swimming. When we arrived the hotel the manager Toni said he had sorted our request for us and put us on the second floor as it is easier with children the first floor is the best but these are the ones with gardens you have to pay extra for these but they look beautiful. We arrived a little early but they got our room ready for us whilst we ate lunch. We returned from the beach to find a bottle of red wine and a note to say welcome back really nice touch and makes you glad you returned. My son also had a…

title: Another great holiday at the Viva Tropic
review: This is our second year at the Viva Tropic (a couple with a 7 year old) and again it was  a fantastic holiday.  We wondered if it would be as good the second time round and it was so good we're even looking at returning for a third year. We booked the cheapest room which is a Studio and even though it's quite small, for the amount of time your in the room it was enough, lovely and clean and ample. There are 3 pools - a main pool, kids pirate pool and another pool which was new last year.  We never sat around the main pool as you needed to be down extra early to get a sun bed, but our daughter loved the pirate pool which you could usually get beds around up to around 9.30 but at lunch time the all inclusive bunch head off for lunch so there are usually an abundance of beds. …

title: RIPPED OFF BY GREEDY MANAGEMENT
review: We stayed here in June this year having used trip advisor to find it   We were 2 families of 4, 2 adults in each family and 2 kids aged 1 and 5   On booking the holiday which was 1 single booking for us all we requested with JET2 that we have rooms close together and on a low floor as with young children we wanted peace and mind and safety for our little ones when they strayed onto the balcony   This request was also followed up by 2 emails direct to the hotel requesting these rooms for our children's safety we didn't ask for any room in particular just low down and near each other   On walking into the hotel it smelt nice and was clean   On checking in this was where the issues started they found our booking at which point we reminded them about the 3 requests   At this point…

title: Lovely  holiday
review: Dear guest Thank you for letting us know your disconformity at your stay in our Hotel, it helps us to improve and set where we fail, also we apologize for the poor service Mr. Toni may provided you, he is our Head receptionist and great professional. Sometimes we also make mistakes, but reading your comments the Hotel acted according the contract with the Travel Agency Jet2 (the price and conditions we have with them). It is true that you sent us an e-mail requesting low floor, what happened is every TTOO or Agency has a room type, all the rooms with views to the pool, garden etc has a 10€ extra cost that is what a TTOO has contracted, that’s why when we give that type of rooms we have to charge it. In your case and because of your disconformity was made a 50% of discount, the other 50% was assumed by the Hotel. Regarding the baby cot, JET2 has not contracted this service, that’s why it is charged separately. We understand what you say about the children safety, we are fathers and mothers also and we try to help all of our guests. We apologize the miss understanding you may have had and if you are thinking about returning to our Hotel I would be delighted to greet you personally and to help with any circumstance. Yours Sincerely, Pep Escalas Hotel Manager

title: Great Hotel for young families
review: We spent  2 weeks at viva tropic  lovely  hotel  the only problem  was in the 2 weeks we couldn't  get a sunbed by  the family  pool so we spent our time at the beach which was very close to walk to lovely  beach the sea is warm and safe we loved eating  out in the local restaurants as we were self catering  we didn't  have a bad meal in 2 weeks plenty  of shops to buy fresh fruit and water  daily all the shops stay open late we had a great  holiday  definitely  will stay again

title: Mrs
review: Just returned from Viva Tropic hotel - we were very happy with it.  We stayed 7 days, the staff were fantastic and always smiling.  Our room (in Block 4) was wonderful, spacious/air con, clean and the bathroom was impressive, walkin shower and use of private pool at back, only available to Block 4 guests.  The childrens pirate pool was fun (our 9 & 10 years old loved it).  over 18 pool/no kids was a treat.  The lifeguards didn't do anything, one girl was doing her make up and hair, there are signs saying "no lifeguard on duty" but they do have people sitting in lifeguard chairs, so I don't know what that's all about.   Normal eat all your can breakfast/dinner, lots of choice and not too manic.  Yes you will never get a sunbed, but does anyone?  They try to explain in the…

title: Fanstastic Family holiday
review: We went as a family of 4 (children ages 5 and 8) for 10 days in July and had an amazing holiday, could not fault it.  We upgraded to Pool view on arrival which we feel was worth it.  Went also went self-Catering as  we had read that there were many lovely restaurants down by the Port / Beach and were not disappointed.  The fact the beach and Port are a short walk away from the hotel was fantastic.  Gorgeous beach.    We could not fault the hotel or its staff.  It was very clean and rooms tided every day (apart from Wed and Sun) The staff were very friendly and accommodating and the kids loved the pirate ship / play area and other pools.   The adult only pool was lovely as well.  It was difficult getting beds by the pools unless you were down VERY early but the life guards at the…

title: Brilliant hotel, excellent waiters/waitresses.
review: Lovely hotel, very clean, food choices amazing, they have two different outside eating places, both a la carte menu with a variety of nutritious food so you have a choice other than the normal all inclusive buffet. Pool area very clean and spacious.  Sunbeds that are reserved in the morning but not occupied for more than 30 minutes get removed by the lifeguard.  There are numbers on the back of the parasols and he notes down the time that it has been unoccupied. This is such a brilliant idea and I would like to see all hotels done in this manner.  Therefore you can go to the pool around 9.30am and still get one.  The sun beds are all rattan with cushions with arm rests and are extremely comfortable. The beach is a 5 min walk from the hotel across the road. 5 min taxi ride into…

title: Great place lovely staff food area rooms etc
review: Great holiday with 6 adults and 4 children. Love hotel and food. Waiters and service excellent. Childrens club staff great. Activities go on throughout day for adults and children. Rooms great for what you need. Great showers !!! Alcudia itself is great also....Beautiful beach although weather extremely hot when we visited so a visit to beach in evening is the best!! Great holiday enjoyed by us all thank you to all the staff at viva tropic xx

title: Return visit
review: Just got back from our second visit to Viva Tropic - we booked a Royal Terrace again as loved our top floor room last year.  Was disappointed to find out we had been put on 1st floor terrace room this time - was still lovely but didn't have the views.  When I asked if a top room was available I was told there wasn't which was a real shame as I had paid the same.  Hotel provided a lovely bowl of fruit and bottle of wine as a thank you for returning and also a bottle of cava as it was my birthday - this was a lovely touch.  Kids loved it - made friends and enjoyed the pools and activities.  Adult pool is fantastic.  Sun beds round main pool seen better days - if you reserve a bed you are given 40 mins from 9am to return or your towels will be removed.  Went S/C as loads of lovely…

title: Amazing holiday
review: Amazing stay at the viva tropic  Room a little on the small side but we did book a studio it was cleaned every day except Wednesday and Sunday . 10 day stay and bed sheets were only changed twice would have liked a few more times.  Pool is great tip you can get up a little later if staying round the pirate pool you can still get sunbeds at 9.30 if u haven't got a sunbed at 7.30 round the main pool you haven't a chance at getting one!  Food is amazing especially the pool bar lunch food is fab so tasty! The main buffet restaurant has something for everyone and has themed nights too.  On a night it's drinks served to your table and to be honest it's quite slow but you have to remember that the vast amount of people that they are trying to serve . Wide selection of Lollies slush and…

title: Very enjoyable family holiday
review: Just leaving viva tropic after wonderful 10 night stay . The staff were lovely and friendly especially the house maids the children's entertainment was fab as my daughter loved it as they worked si hard with all kids, the pools are lovely especially kids pirate pool with slides .I was sc so didn't try food but it looked lovely ,beach and fab restaurants near by only gripe beds were shocking but over all fantastic hotel

title: Nice family holiday
review: I enjoyed our stay, however we stayed at Viva can pic afort last year and booked this thinking it would be similar and it wasn't quite as good we had an initial problem when we arrived the ground floor room we had been put in had patio doors that could be opened from the outside when locked with a 2 & 4 year old there's no way I was staying in this room I would not of slept a wink the hotel manager showed us another room that had no bath my daughter needs a bath due to a skin condition we were offered a plastic bath to put her in I said is there nothing better you can do the answer was no not until Saturday (3 days later) to be fair on the Saturday as promised we were upgraded to a lovely room with a wonderful location but packing up and moving with the kids was a pain took a…

title: Fantastic
review: A wonderful hotel with great service, friendly staff and wonderful shows. The fact that most of the staff are so well-versed in so many languages was, to say the very least, impressive. I attempted Spanish as long as I could and rather than embarrass me when I made a mistake, they would explain to me my mistake in a well-mannered and understanding way.  The hotel itself is in the perfect location, especially for those who wish to venture away from the establishment itself, but should you want to stay in the hotel you will not be left wanting for much.   It can be somewhat expensive at the bar, but this is much to be expected in such a beautiful, well-placed area. The entertainment is wonderful and well worth sticking around for.

title: Another great stay!
review: After an initial problem with our room not being clean (which was sorted out quickly and efficiently), our stay was perfect. Our two bed apartment was excellent and benefited from lovely views over the main pool. The day time entertainment programme was superb and kept us, our 15 year old daughter and her friend, occupied all week. Many thanks to the hard working Viva team!  We were self catering but ate at the hotel twice and the food was of a very good standard. The grounds are well maintained and spotlessly clean..just one gripe, the sunloungers around the main pool are terribly tired, many have broken slats and are uncomfortable. We chose to sunbathe in the gardens where there are better loungers. It was our daughter's birthday during our stay and a box of sweets and a note…

title: Very good 1 week stay
review: Just returned from a very relaxing stay at the Viva Tropic. My partner and our 2 girls aged 11 & 13. We stayed self catering in block 4, top corner plot, balcony looking to the hills and around into kids activity pool. Very clean and comfortable, no noise.  Plenty of things for youngsters to do, 3 outdoor pools and 1 indoor, entertainments. Also only a 5 to 10 minute walk to a great golden sandy beach. Over 18's pool was a nice touch to retreat from all the kids for a short time. We did try the a lacarte restaurant a couple of nights, reasonable rice and quality. We preferred to go out to eat as Alcudia has many eateries of quality.  Only down side was that we planned to try the all inclusive option at the hotel for a day. We were told that we could try this at resort. So we…

title: family friendly resort...
review: This is a lovely and family friendly apart hotel. friendly staff that speak english.  the room are tidy and clean with a mini kitchen that have almost everything you need for cooking  apart from a oven. a supermarket just inside the hotel too as you go out the hotel, very convience. very comfy bed but the sofa bed is a bit too soft. cleaner come everyday to change your towels and tidying up the place if you request it. excellent service. this hotel also provide free laundery area for you to take the dirty cloths to wash and tumble dry and also you can pay to do it if you wish. free fast Wi-Fi. great atmosphere at the pools, great entertaining and also runs a mini club from 10am to 10pm everyday keeping your kids entertaining all day long. hotel food is ok but there are many…

title: Fantastic Family Hotel & Holiday
review: Had an excellent 1 week stay at Viva Tropic with hubby and 2 kids (5 & 7).  Central to beach, bars, shops (5 min walk) but situated back enough not to endure noise.  Rooms modern & well enough equipped for self catering which we were and complimentary bottle of water on arrival . Fantastic facilities for children with mini club and disco which finished at 9 PM. Bar area great with lovely bar staff especially Jesus who was very efficient. Pool areas fab especially pirate ship pool brilliant for families with young children which meant you could lounge in the sun and keep a watchful eye on your kids with added benefit of lifeguard overlooking area also-playground situated next to kids pool which kept kids amused when taking a break from pool-all in all an excellent holiday,…

title: Best in Alcudia
review: This is THE family hotel in Alcudia. Been to Alcudia several times. Stayed at seven different hotels. Viva Tropic is without a doubt the best. Large, clean rooms. Great food and free wi-fi all over the hotel and the pool-area. It may not be «on the beach», but it is only a two-minute walk from the hotel down to the best family beach in Alcuda. The hotel is situated only a five minutes walk from Alcudia harbour where all the restaurants and shops are. Absolutely perfect for families with small children.

title: Perfect family hotel, equally welcoming to couples
review: A lovely hotel with efficient staff who created such a happy atmosphere without being overt. You could feel that this was a well run hotel from the happy welcoming smiles at reception and this lovely attitude from all staff continued throughout our five day stay.   All the services were tip top and with four pools to choose from we were thrilled that there was an adults only pool where we could chill out. Beautifully positioned only a few minutes from the sea and a host of restaurants and shops.  Cant recommend this one too highly

title: Happy fun in a well managed resort hotel
review: What a great hotel for couples and for families. Four pools and splendid grounds including some delightful ancient olive trees adding gravitas to the atmosphere.   Our studio apartment was delightfully equipped for self catering yet the locale offers more restaurants, including the onsite ones, than you could imagine.   We will definitely be recommending this to our friends.

title: Excellent; would stay again; brilliant hotel.
review: My partner and I got a last minute, same day deal at this hotel after moving from Bellevue Club Hotel. Bellevue Club was so horrendous we had to get out of there, and Viva Tropic saved our holiday! Amazing!   The pools and whole hotel are extremely clean, with welcoming and kind staff who helped us with all our queries throughout our stay. We appreciated there being space for families alongside a separate 18+ pool that was quieter and relaxed (and never busy despite the hotel being fully-booked). We had a self-catering room with a well-equipped kitchenette and were able to buy and cook our own food alongside using the hotel restaurant and bar if we wished. The food and drinks in the hotel were reasonably priced and had a reasonably good selection of vegetarian options (given…

title: Good spot for family holiday
review: We stayed at the Viva Tropic in July 2015. We are family of 4 with two children age 3 and 5. We also had family of friends staying at the same hotel, they had young kids too. We enjoyed the place a lot, however my advice for people - please do manage your expectations! This is NOT luxury "adults only" hotel, so if you are planning romantic holiday - do not go there! The hotel is paradise for kids (and their parents) but you may only enjoy the place if you have little ones. For us it was a perfect spot, although there were couple of things which require some improvements. But most importantly for us was the safety of kids (life guards at each swimming pool), relatively small area (which might be a problem for adults) and amazing kids activities and entertainment.   I looked at…

title: Holiday with 2 grandchildren
review: Having a great 2 weeks away from Scotland and not missing home one bit. Hotel very busy with lots of families with children. 3 pools to choose from and the 2 boys aged 5 and 6 spent ages in all pools. Accommodation for self catering was adequate and had maid service cleaning every day. Sheets and towels changed regularly and paid for upgrade overlooking 2 pools. Didn't rate the food beside the bar as being good but plenty of restaurants within 5-10 minute walk. Didn't try the buffet restaurant. Beautiful wide beach only 5 minutes away which we used alot. Kids had a whale of a time. Kids Club was loved by the boys and staff were friendly and enthusiastic. Hotel was always very clean and receptionist were knowledgeable and helpful. We stayed in Block 1 on the 3rd floor. Rooms with…

title: Family Holiday June 2015
review: We stayed at the Viva Tropic Hotel for a week at the end of June 2015. We are a family of 4 with two children aged 4 and 2. If you are looking for a hotel in Alcudia then look no further! The Viva was an amazing hotel, centrally located to the shops, beach and Marina, in the heart of Alcudia. The staff were brilliant, especially the entertainment staff. Our children grew very attached to Josephine and Robin in particular and were in tears on our final day when we had to say goodbye, They worked so hard all week to ensure the children were occupied with games and activities, day and night, this meant happy children and happy parents!! We have never wanted to return to a hotel before, but we would defiantly return to the Viva Tropic in an instant. I have already priced it up for…

title: Great location and hotel with only some minor issues
review: Stayed here for a week with wife and 6 month old son. Check in was ok, nothing exciting and of course asked by reception if we wanted to upgrade. At €80 a nigh it was a bit steep. The €560 we saved was really okay.  I thought we had reserved a 1 bedroom apartment, but turned out we got a studio room/apartment. It worked out for the most part good, but since our son needed a nap indoors during the day and also went to bed early we would have preferred to have a separate bedroom then all of us being in the same room. The kitchen was small and didn't really work if you wanted to prepare more then a snack and the fridge was very small.  Another thing Viva Tropic should look into is sound proofing the rooms. Guests walking from the elevator could be heard very loud inside the room or…

title: Best hotel we have ever stayed at
review: We have just come back from a week at the viva tropic, my husband ,our 2 year old daughter and myself loved this hotel, very family friendly the kids pool was lovely with all the slides and shallow enough for her to play and be safe, they had a adults only pool that looked amazing (admittedly right next door to the kids pool so you could hear the kids but still lovely) they had a bigger pool also and had games and clubs for the kids everyday our little girl was a bit young but when we go back next year she will love that. We went all inclusive The food was really nice breakfast was a buffet and changed everyday a huge selection, the lunch was at the snack bar and this was served to you which i thought was really good a nice selection of pizzas, pasta,wraps etc and evening meal…

title: Not For Couples
review: Came back from Alcudia on 19th June 15. On arrival we were asked if we wanted to upgrade, after reading previous reviews we said we did not wish to upgrade. The man on reception seems a bit annoyed with us because we did not wish to be upgraded and told us to go and wait till our room was ready, which took another hour. Our one bedroom apartment was clean and tidy and had all the required amenities. However we were on the first floor and outside of the recycling area, so every morning at 8am on the dot was awakened by the recycle lorry turning up and also the hotels recycling. Our apartment also was underneath some sort of fuel tank, which every few days a lorry would turn up and pump something that was very dusty into a hole just under our balcony. The hotel was full of…

title: Love this hotel
review: Fantastic Location.... 2 mins walk to the nicest beach in Majorca and 5 mins walk to the beautiful port with the most gorgeous restaurants.This is my 8 time in Alcudia and keep coming back. Love the Viva Tropic but unfortunately couldn't get it this year so we are going to try the Viva Eden Lago. Hope I'll be just as impressed.... Can't fault the hotel really.. the pool areas are great, fantastic pool for small children and the option of Adults only pool. The rooms aren't plush but are CLEAN and adequate for the amount of time you are in them.... all in all highly recommend The Viva Tropic...

title: Best all inclusive we have been to
review: We went out here as a family of 11 3 children and 8 adults, the hotel is spotless we could fault a single thing! Our check in was smooth, the room was great, pools clean and lovely play area and kids pool, good food and drinks amazing and staff very attentive! The pool bar food was just excellent with freshly made pizzas, wraps, muscles,sandwiches,chips, salads  and much more, lots of ice creams to choose from tooThe drinks were also very good! With lots of cocktails and spirts along with beers and none alcoholic drinks! If your all inclusive here it's money well spent. 5 out of 5 for us!! Amazing hotel I'm sure anyone with a family will not be disappointed

title: Push chair city
review: Don't get me wrong, this is a nice hotel, but... On arrival, we were immediately asked if we wanted to upgrade our room. Having read previous comments we chose politely not to. The response was somewhat negative and our room would not be ready for an hour. Still, the self catering apartment we got was nice and clean. Generally, all the staff were pleasant, the hotel was kept spotless. My gripes are down to us going as a couple. This is NOT a couples hotel, this is a family hotel, geared up for families. The one part of the complex for couples relaxing is right next to kids play areas. In hind sight we would of picked a different location, maybe Pollenca. If you're taking the kids you'll love Viva Tropic, it's got practically everything for toddlers to teenagers. I must be…

title: Nice return visit, but not sure we'll be back
review: Just finishing our second family holiday at the Viva Tropic. Overall had a good week. Apartment layout is Ok, bedroom and bathroom are good size, but living space is tight for 4 people, especially if with a buggy. Location of apartment was great, beside the main pool, with direct access via a gate from our garden. Unfortunately on most days we found that people blocked this access by moving sunloungers there. Bar food was Ok, and a bit pricey. Onside shop a bonus.  Kids facilities are good and typical of other Viva hotels.  Leaving a little sour note. Requested a late checkout as flight isn't till 11pm, so kids(2 years toddle and 8 months baby) have a chance to rest during day. Was told by reception that cost was €26 which I agreed, they said it was noted and to come back day…

title: Family friendly
review: Visited Viva Tropic hotel in april 2015. Very nice place and family friendly. Great pool for kids with pirate ship and slides. Too bad only it was a bit too cold weather for kids to swim there as much as they would have liked. But luckily the hotel has an indoor spa- and sauna centre so kids got to swim in the indoor pools.  Rooms were nice and clean. And were cleaned almost everyday if wanted. Staff was nice and helpful. Nice restaurant. Beach and shopping street are close. Big supermarkets are not very far either if needed. Overall I'd say a very nice plave for a vacation :)

title: Great family holiday
review: Just returned home from a lovely family holiday at the viva tropic. Great location it's perfect for kids great kids pool with a pirate ship and bouncy castle and playground next to it. We went all inclusive and the food was excellent. Staff especially in the bar were v nice to us and to our kids. We thought the all inclusive was v good lovely cocktails and wine. Our room was lovely one bed apt in the 4 Block with large balcony. Kids entertainment was v good. Would really recommend hotel it's very clean, v deserving of 4 star.  Alcudia has lovely places to visit such as the old town. All in all we would return!

title: Amazing hotel with perfect location
review: Amazing hotel 😍   All the staff were fantastic.  Everywhere was spotlessly clean.   The on site shop had everything you could possibly need.   Can't comment too much on food as we were self catering, so many restaurants to choose from nearby.  The kids entertainment were great as was the evening entertainment and didn't go on too late (10.30) It takes 3 minutes to walk to the beach which was absolutely gorgeous.

title: Cycle friendly?
review: Having done lots of research,choose Viva Tropic to stay for a triathlon training camp in April 2015. Viva Tropic is the official race hotel for Ironman Mallorca,so I assumed this would be a cycle pro hotel.Unfortunately not. On arrival we were told that our training bikes,which were in a suitable bag,were not allowed in our room and we were expected to store them in the bike storage room attached to the hotel. This would have been a reasonable request had the storage been secure! and offered insurance,should they get damaged or stolen. We were met by a bike storage room,where the door was constantly left open by all. You were expected to rack your bike,and leave,hoping that it would be there the next time you returned. The hotel staff were exceptionally rude and informed us that…

title: Great family holiday made extra special by Josephine and the entertainment team
review: We had a fantastic time at the Viva Tropic last week and would like to give an extra special thank you to all the entertainment team especially Josephine who went out of her way to gently involve my children in the activities by the end of the week they couldn't get enough. if I could give 6 stars I would!!

title: Second Vist, last time
review: This is our second visit to the hotel. I don't understand why there is such a change from last year. I complained several times about PINK CHICKEN. But before I had the chance to source alternative restaurants I found my self in bed for 4 days rushing to the toilet. I have been going to alcudia for 8 years and can say I have been put off for good. My travel agent is in process of complaing to sort this out. Save any other people/ family from a ruined holiday !!

title: Nice hotel. Great staff.
review: Dear Sir/Madam  I am so sorry about what happened in your second visit to the Viva Tropic, about the chicken issue , our Cheff supervisor is  in contact with our provider to check the quality standards. Anyway , as you probably know, the hotel was fully booked during your stay, I mean that because in a case of food not being in a good state it would have happened to many more clients, which was not the case. We are very thankful about your comments to keep us alert on this kind of situations. I must advice as well that during this period there was an extended stomach flu in Mallorca. We also do work ( as is prescribed by law) with two different companies  who control our quality standards in food, drinks, quality of the water., there are controls twice a month. I just hope that your next visit will be more pleasant and do not hesitate to contact me on your arrival.  Best regards Pep Escalas Hotel Manager

title: kids paradise
review: My husband, myself and our 4 children (aged between 15 and 5) stayed here for may half term. Rooms ok, bathrooms really nice and pools lovely (not heated though). Beds very comfy. Fun play area 4 younger children. The hotel staff were fab throughout, from reception to waiters, cleaners and kids club reps. Nice selection of food with the all inclusive option.  Good location, 5 minute walk from shops, beach and harbour.  Entertainment hilarious, especially the Michael Jackson tribute act, this had us in stitches (still not sure if it was meant 2 be serious though). Magic act was very good, kids were mesmerised watching this.  All in all a great week :))

title: The 1980's is not dead, and this hotel proves it!
review: Took my grandson aged 7 to this hotel for 3 nights. He had a great time as the hotel is very child friendly. Lots of children babies and pregnant women. I wouldnt recommend  this hotel to couples although there is an over 18s area with nice beds. Only ate there at lunchtimes and the food was very good. There are lots of restaurants nearby all reasonably priced and the beach is a five minute walk.Old town Alcoudia is a 15 minute walk away surrounded by a roman wall, is a small array of shops and restaurants. The hotel is also near an aqua park. Staff very kind and helpful.

title: Nice hotel
review: Have just returned from a week at viva tropic hotel with my 4 year old daughter and a friend.  We had a one bedroom apartment room number 1147 it was nicely decorated, small but not too bad. The rooms are cleaned 5 days per week and fresh towels on request if you leave the dirty ones on the floor which I found odd lol. The TV has some English channels so whilst we were getting ready each night my little girl watched TV.  There is a shop in the hotel where you can buy bits if you're staying SC  The kids entertainment is excellent there is lots for them to do throughout the day and evening. My little girl loved the kids pool and the kids club entertainers were really good. She enjoyed t'shirts making and cocktail (smoothie) making as well as the kids disco each night.  We chose…

title: 2nd Visit, excellent for cycling, beach and the old town
review: Our 2nd visit, previously we were there Sept 2014 and returned May 2015 for 12 nights, again with Jet2 from Newcastle.  Transfer from Palma takes less than an hour.  On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a garden room for 6 euros a night, but with the option of seeing both rooms first, we stayed with our allocated room 1502 the last room at the end of the top floor with and end balcony with excellent views towards the port.  As usual there was a 30 euro charge for the room safe for our 12 nights, but beach towels and the wifi were free.    We had just booked self catering so the only meal we had in the hotel was a lunch at the pool bar which was good and reasonably priced.  The room was comfortable as usual, nice walk-in shower, and a small kitchen area, air con worked fine. …

title: Excellent for a Cycling holiday
review: The hotel was adjacent to Sportactive who we were  booked with for a cycling sessions , so thus was great . Breakfast was good , dinner hit or miss , restaurants nearby are very good , but walking distance usage old town of Alcudia , which I would recommend for food .  We had a very dissatifactory checking out of the hotel , we were refused a late check out time , they were abrupt and rude , I would go again but I would be insisting on better flexibility on late check outs ..

title: Not worth it.
review: My friend and I went to Mallorca for a cycling holiday and we were recommended Viva Tropic and their 'more luxious' apartment with balcony & jacuzzi. It cost us +200€/per night and we though it would be worth it. Not.  The balcony was there, but it was on the first floor with a view to inner courtyard. The jacuzzi was dirty and we could only guess for how long had been standing there. The Wi-Fi was slow and only worked occasionally. Room flooring was laminated wooden floor, the cheapest you can get. The room door was broken.   My personal benchmark is the shower silicone sealant. Good hotels have them clean, but poor hotels like Tropic had black mold in it.  The only good things were: non-stinking air con, +46 inch led-TV with tens of channels, breakfast buffet, bicycle rental &…

title: Cycling break.
review: Great location. Food was top class with the evening dinner a feast. Great variety.  Excellent base for cycling and across from the Sport Active center.  Rooms were spacious and well equipped.  Staff friendly.  Bear beach but away from over busy part of Alcudia

title: Hotel OK, however service poor and charges for extras
review: I have been thinking for several days whether to give the hotel an average or poor rating.  We stayed in May 2015 and stayed in a first floor Royal Terrace apartment and were self catering.  The hotel was nice enough, and the facilities were good. The apartment was however quite small, that said there was a large outdoor terrace area which was a good size and very nice.   The issues began at check in when we were informed that to have a cot in the room and a high chair to enable our baby to sleep and eat, we would have to pay a surcharge of 8 Euros per day, which for a family orientated hotel is frankly disgusting! The cot was a travel cot and was perhaps worth 50-60 Euros and the high chair was of the IKEA plastic variety which are around 20 Euro's to buy. What that means is…

title: Great value for money
review: Stayed for a week over the Mallorca Half Ironman competition, so a very busy part of the island and the hotel was just as busy. The room was good, spacious and clean. We had a room with an upstairs part which included a private jacuzzi, dining area and sunbeds which was lovely.  The staff were friendly, helpful and up for a laugh. The little problems I had with the hotel included the elevators, which only sometimes worked, and the adult only pool. It was a lovely pool but it was surrounded by the kiddie play area and a sports area, so it wasn't the quiet space it needed to be.  Otherwise, good location, the food was really nice, and no real complaints.

title: Short stay, but lovely
review: Stayed in a self catering room. Nicely finished spacious room with all the essentials. Nice balcony too. It's a big complex, but doesn't feel like it. There's a kids pool, adult pool, family pool and indoor pool as well as sauna, steam room and ton of other activities on site. It's a short walk from the beach, shops and restaurants. We didn't eat in the hotel much, but what we had was tasty and not overly expensive. Some tasty cocktails on the menu too!

title: Family holiday
review: Excellent from the start. This is our second stay with viva but first in the tropic. Checkin was quick and we got upgraded to a deluxe room as the hotel was quiet. All thanks to Pep on reception, he is a credit to Viva hotels. All staff are very polite and friendly. The room was lovely overlooking the swim up pool. Beds are very comfortable, and rooms were spotless. Children's area was fantastic we had 3 children with us aged 10, 5 and 8 months and was thoroughly enjoyed by all especially the trampoline. Adults only pool was very nice and double loungers are very comfy. The Spa and indoor pool is free and can be used by children water was a bit chilly but the kids enjoyed it, sauna and steam room were very relaxing. We had a couple of drinks in the bar area in the evening whilst…

title: Fantastic hotel, cycle trip based at this amazing hotel that gets it completely right!
review: We stayed here on half board basis for 3 nights as a large group on a cycling weekend. This hotel was perfect and it partners with Sport Active cycle shop that provide the best of bikes with option of guided or self guided cycling in the best parts of Mallorca. Everything from rooms, pools, proximity to beach, amazing food that catered for every dietary need, was absolutely fantastic. I would strongly recommend this complex for all types as it caters for every need. Spotlessly clean! They do a great job and the cycle company are really efficient and know what they are doing!

title: amazing
review: hello... this hotel is amazing, beds are clean & comfy...location is excellent great for familys & couples.we stayed in april 15....bars & resturants on your door step beach 2 min walk....breakfast was great sooooooo much to choose from...hotel staff polite & friendly supermarket in hotel.pools clean the whole experience was 10 out of 10. we will most certainly be booking again this year wouldn't stay any where else in alcucdia,highly recommend to all. more like a 5 star hotel they have thought of everything to make your stay an enjoyable visit. block 4 is lovley we had a premier room wow bed was huge. thank you soooooooo much for an exceptional stay will return again. mr & mrs harkins x

title: Wonderful time out for rest and relaxation
review: Spend a quick 5 night break in a most wonderful location, in a fantastic hotel and extreme helpful and polite staff.   The studio apartment and hotel offered all the facilities  we needed, from clean and tidy room, working devices, great food (we went B&B, although half and all in is available) but there are also many delightful restaurants within minutes of walking, a lovely port, a brilliant beach with white sand beach, plenty of space, and local shops. Therefore if you wanted to do something different each day, or the same thing then it's all available to you.  Hotel staff are always polite and willing to help, the adult only pool with Bali beds is a delight to stop and unwind,   This is defiantly a place for return visit, to do it all again and more.

title: Excellent couples escape!
review: We have just returned on April 26th from a 7 night stay at Viva Tropic. This hotel is AMAZING, and worth every one of it's 4 stars. Our premium apartment was lovely, modern and clean. We went self catering, and the kitchenette was fully equipped and there is a big Eroski supermarket a five minute walk from the hotel which is relatively cheap. The over 18s pool was the definite highlight- with amazing double beds to sunbathe on. The hotel was really quiet due to the time of year, so we enjoyed quick service and occasionally an entire pool to ourselves! The area around has some lovely restaurants (we ate SO much food) and the beach is only a 5 minute walk away.  The staff were all friendly and helpful, the only issue we had all week was when our lights stopped working. We went to…

title: Great holiday as the staff are a merit to the hotel
review: We spent 6 nights here in mid April and found the hotel really good. The hotel was just getting ready for the busier months coming up up but we had everything we needed. The food is really lovely and we were well fed at every meal time. The drinks package for AI is the best we've ever had. The spirits were all branded and there was an excellent range of cocktails including non alcoholic for the children. The staff were always happy and chatty and welcomimg. This included the exception staff also which can be frosty in some hotels, but not here.  We had a one bedroom apartment and we were comfortable. The bathroom was very big and well stocked with little extras. My only complaint would be the temperature of the pool, it was sub zero. This enticed the children over to the adult…

title: Lovely Family Holiday
review: We stayed here for a big family holiday in the middle of April 2015.  Firstly the hotel is lovely, it's very big.  We went at the beginning of the season so the hotel did not feel overly crowded or full during our stay.  Pools There are 4 pools, the kids pool is by far the best I've ever seen for children! I even wanted to go and play! There was also a kids play area with a trampoline in the floor and a bouncy castle.  The only thing I couldn't understand is why they would build the adult only relaxation pool next to it? However that pool was also lovely, comfy double beds to lay on and the pool was slightly warmer than the others.  The main pool was very big and had two different sections with different depths.  The inside pool is the spa pool, I think if i'd paid for a spa…

title: Ok hotel.
review: Just arrived back on the 19th april after 8 days .the hotel is lovely but not worth the all inclusive unless you like drinking.the drinks package is brilliant but the food in the restaurant is un worthy of the money paid.you get a menu round the pool which is the same day in day out which is hit and miss if its warm except the pizzas.after 4 pm when that finishes you only get sandwichs which arent worth a mention.we found a grill menu which stated we could have instead of going in the restaurant  only to be told after getting the managers that it was a miss print yea right. We was a party of 21 people who paid over 20.000 pound to go there to be told we couldn't have it.yet it was printed exactly the same as the drinks and bistro menu.photos to follow.total rip off.we was told…

title: Great place if you love cheap all-inclusive stuff
review: We stayed here as it was the official hotel for a run we were participating in. Therefore we got a great fare (around 30 euro per night!) which made the hotel a great option. I'm not sure what the standard fare of the hotel is.  It's one of those hotels for families willing to go to a not much expensive all-inclusive with activities and stuff. If you don't enjoy the idea of children splashing next to you in the pool you are done: you will find them playing around even in the spa -and in the pool reserved for over 18's (!!). The apartments may need some renovation -but again, it all depends on what your objective (and your standards) are.   I need however to mention the massage services in the spa: the lady had really grrrrreat hands and I loooved the massage I got. I loved it so…

title: Viva tropic loves children!
review: Spent one week in this awesome hotel with my wife and our 2 little girls aged 3 and 5. To start, the hotel webpage  gives all the details so you have an idea what to expect. Check in was perfect. The rooms were very spacious, and we had one with the terrace and hammock; awesome. You have all you need in the rooms to cook your own meals. The all inclusive meals were really delicious, with a variety that will suit even the fussiest of people.  One notable feature of this hotel, especially for those with kids, is the kids club, where kids can be left in care of child minders, who were just wonderful. My kids came back glowing with excitement after each session, and, of course, we parents had time spend by ourselves.  In summary, this wonderful hotel is all about ensuring that…

title: Lovely
review: Just had a lovely holiday 8/4/15 to 15/4/15 have never been so chilled. Hotel was lovely,food great, staff very friendly close to all amenities,beach etc I couldn't  fault it. Will definitely return soon.

title: awesome family holiday
review: 2nd visit to a Viva hotel, fantastic as ever.  Once again cannot fault a single thing.  Staff, amenities, entertainment, food & drink excellent.  So much choice of food, themed evenings.  Paco the restaurant Manager was very welcoming and made a fuss of our child.  Location is nice, close to beach but quiet setting.  Have booked Viva again next year.

title: Disappointing for families out of season
review: Just returned home from viva tropic where bufo disco for children was advertised both online and in the hotel lobby as being on each night from 20.00 until 21.00 but our children were left very disappointed when bufo only turned up on two occasions and on most of the others nights the actual disco on lasted twenty five minutes.

title: Relaxing family holiday....with friendly service
review: We visited this hotel from 1/4/15 for 7 nights all inclusive....to sum it up for those who dont want to read long reviews it was a beautiful trip, with friendly staff, clean modern rooms and great location!!.we arrived at 2am and the reception greeted us with a smile and organised our paperwork as quick as possible...this was great after travelling with a tired toddler! The following day we spent exploring the kiddies splash pool and park.....although a little windy, this area was great for toddlers.  We ate lunch at the hotel on our first day before going out for the evening...on the second day we went back for lunch...the friendly waiter politely asked if we had forgotten our bill from previous day...it was then we discovered we hadnt been given our all inclusive arm…

title: Highly recommended.... FABULOUS upgrade
review: Easy to find this hotel is out the way enough to be quiet and set back but near enough to walk to everything you need.... Alcudia is very much catering for the cyclist and the hotel even has its own station for them and hire out some very top of the range bikes. The hotel itself caters for all...It's huge many blocks so you can have ground floor rooms if u wish and it seems well catered for disabled guests....we would highly recommend an upgrade if they are available we had booked a one bed premium apartment but having read reviews and contacted the hotel direct we were told we can I understand upgrade to a royal terrace on arrival... Due to the time we travelled out-of season I believe we got an excellent price... €40 euros a night extra and you get a top floor room beautiful…

title: Enjoyable holiday..
review: We are on our last day at Viva Tropic and have thoroughly enjoyed our stay.There are a few minor negatives however that hasn't impacted us greatly.We stayed in a Royal terrace suite with a fabulous terrace including hot tub,bed,table and chairs and outdoor shower!Negative 1-The hot tub water got very dirty quickly and I wouldn't let the children use it that day-had to ask twice for someone to clean it and waited a full day however the guy was lovely and changed the water fully.The stairs up to the terrace are fine for an adult however coming down the stairs is abit risky for wet children,The balcony railing isn't very high and with tiled stairs and wet feet(risky)Overall a lovely hotel and is lovely and clean (always being clean and maintained) we actually are not ready to leave…

title: "Excellent Hotel"
review: We travelled out of season and found the hotel to be excellent. Upgraded to a two bedroom room with cooking facilities (thanks Toni). Room, like the hotel was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The indoor pool was great for the kids - the outdoor pools and leisure facilities looked great for use in the warmer seasons. We will definitely be back.

title: Perfect for cyclists going offline
review: The hotel is lell organised and comfortable. My room is large and has a balcony with a sea view and a kitchenette. There is a good storage room for bikes and the hotel offers massages, a gym and indoor and outdoor pools. The restaurant is by no means a destination in its own right but offers a very good buffet. If you've come here to get away from it all and go cycling it's perfect. There are also two good bike shops within an easy walk of the hotel. However, if staying online is important to you it falls short. The wifi in my room has the lowest bandwidth I've ever measured and in fact tests usually fail to complete. This is why I'm dropping it a star.

title: Ideal Base for Early Season Cycling Holiday
review: Stayed 15-22/02/15, well worth the upgrade to have a room on the sunny (pool view) side. Staff and room were great. Pre-hired a road-bike from viva:cycling and got excellent service. Will certainly return.

title: Lycra-tastic!
review: What's the best word you can hear when checking into a hotel? Upgrade!  For an unknown reason we were upgraded to a room with a huge terrace with sofas and hammock . It could be argued that this review is therefore biased but that was day one and it could have gone downhill. In fact things just got better - all the staff were friendly but also had a good sense of humour.  Its definitely a kid friendly hotel with a good indoor pool, outdoor play area, mini golf, bikes to rent and tennis courts. The amazing Alcudia beach is a 2 minute walk away but the best of all has to be the breakfast buffet - quality food and a great choice.   The hotel seems to be very popular with cyclists so if you go expect to see a lot of men in lycra moving around in tight units discussing strategies and…

title: warm holiday in may
review: Room wasn't so clean, its like sometimes it was cleaned but not very good. Breakfast was good a lot of different chooses, and Champagne...  Good hotel for child, a lot of activities in hotel for family also for adults and children's.  At diner time food wasn't good , but its good price out of hotel, u can eat at local restaurant. At may the whether wasn't very warm but still good. Also price for car rent was god in this time of year but in this side of island only have of places was working,  if u rate the u should try  crazy creeps man cheek in youtube

title: Just booked to return
review: We have just booked for May 2015 having been there in Sept 2014.  We use Jet2 Holidays, flying from Newcastle to Palme, and the transfer to Alcudia is only about an hour.  The hotel is situated in an ideal location, handy for both the old town and the harbour.  We went self catering so we didn't use the dining room, the normal apartment was adequate, we didn't upgrade, nice big walk-in shower, a small kitchen area with a good fridge. though we never used the cooker as there were just too many nice places nearby to eat out at :) Our balcony overlooked the road near the handy little shop at the front of the hotel, we didn't have any problem noise either.  The pool areas were really good, we particularly liked the adults pool area with its spa pool and big sun beds. There is an…

title: Great place for kids
review: We stayed here in the summer 2014. We had one of the smaller rooms but it was good enough for the four of us. The balcony is a little useless as we had a view of the street but other than this the room is clean and well kept. The hotel has lots of pools for both children and adults. They offer many activities for kids and is very well located near the beach yet still its quite at night. The staff is friendly and even remembered to put small gifts for our children in our room when they had birthday. Overall a great place to stay.

title: Viva Tropic Alcudia Majorica - a great place
review: We stayed at this hotel in half term Oct 25th to 1st Nov 14.  We were in the main block, the rooms were nice and the bathroom with the shower really was great.  The sofa beds were not as comfortable for the kids.  Hotel was clean and the food was varied and would meet all needs, the staff really took care with this.  All staff were very helpful and welcoming to you.  Facilities on site meant you did not have to leave, but everything was close by.  Transfer was an hour, which I did expect, but all round the houses.

title: Lovely rooms
review: The hotel was lovely overall rooms big and clean as was the whole hotel. It was a few mins walk from the beach ,shops and rests. We stayed in a two bedroom swim up pool room which had it s own garden which was quite big. The pools were really good but the only one that had heating was the adult one which I couldn't use because I had kids with me . The pools where take your breath away cold that's the only bad thing I can say and that did spoil things a little because we normally big pool users. The food was good a nice variety but could have been slightly better for the price.  Overall a good hotel and i would recommend it.

title: Great facilities, but..
review: We went in the last week of Oct 2014. Weather was splendid, the hotel was clean, very well appointed, rooms cleaned well, and handy for the beach, shops, marina and bars.  Food was good, plenty of variety, as were the drinks. We went as a couple, but the entertainment staff looked as though they did a great job with the kids that were there.  Would have given it a 4 or 5...   BUT... we spent a lot of money on this trip thinking that, even though it was the last week of opening, the staff would still be on the ball.  Sadly, our first few days there left us feeling so unwelcome that I asked for a transfer to their sister hotel (The Sunrise, I think). The lady at reception asked why, and that I could come and see the manager tomorrow. I didn't, as I guess she mentioned something…

title: Great family hotel
review: This hotel is in a good location, only a few minutes walk to the beach shops and restaurants,  The hotel itself is very clean and modern, reception staff are brilliant and very helpful.  We stayed in a 1 bedroom deluxe apartment and was very spacious clean with a great big bathroom , most days the maid came in to clean and change towels, the swimming area is good we pretty much stayed at the kids pool which kept the kids entertained , the food in this hotel is superb and cannot fault this in any way as we ate out most nights as we were not all inclusive , the staff are all very helpful and the kids entertainers are all very hard working.

title: Fantastic!
review: It is very rare for me to do a TripAdvisor review for a restaurant or hotel etc, but with the Viva Tropic Hotel in Alcudia, Majorca I thought I needed to provide one!  I booked a 7 day all inclusive deal (last minute) and saw this hotel and instantly wanted to have my holiday here. The pictures looked great, the rooms looked modern and spacious, and the food looked good, I know that not every photo is realistic, but in this case they were.  On arrival at the hotel we entered the reception area, which was bathed in marble and big comfortable leather sofas/armchairs, along with some modern pieces of seating furniture. First impression was that it was exceptionally clean there, with no mess or dirt anywhere to be seen. We were invited to take a seat whilst the reception staff dealt…

title: Nice hotel
review: The location of this hotel is great if you like being near a fantastic beach and also near shops and restaurants. We went self catering. The hotel itself is nice but got a few things that bring down the overall rating. The pool areas are fantastic. There is a large normal pool, an adult only pool, a splash pool & an indoor pool. Unfortunately the pools were very cold and this include the splash pool. This is why there was an issue with children in the adult only pool, as this was partially heated, and also why the indoor pool got very busy. Use warmer water in the splash pool and this can then be fully utilised in the beginning and end of season. This would sort the issue with children in the adult/indoor pool. We had a studio and as it was just me and my daughter it was fine…

title: quick late deal
review: My daughter and I had a great last minute deal in this beautiful hotel. The staff were all brilliant, and especially the distinguished gentleman on reception. He was so helpful in many ways. The restaurant was so clean, and the manager very helpful. For once I sat on a chair in the dining room that actually enabled me to sit comfortably at the table.Most are so worn out, I end up in hollowed chair. It was always clean, and the gorgeous fragrance as you entered the swing doors was very welcoming. Shame we will have to wait till next year to visit

title: Wouldn't return
review: My sister and I visited this hotel at the end of October, we had selected the hotel due to the modern facilities and as it had an adults only pool and a gym and spa in the event that the weather was bad.  We had requested a twin room on booking, when we arrived we had been given a double so had to ring down to reception to request a twin, luckily there was one available.  We were in a studio apartment and the rooms are very spacious, we had our own little seating area and kitchen with various appliances in case you didn't fancy eating out.  The rain shower in the bathroom was very pleasant. Maid service was excellent.  Would have appreciated more English channels on the tv for the evenings while getting ready to head out, mostly German and Spanish channels available.    We were…

title: The good and the bad
review: Dear Guest, Let me start by thanking you for taking time to give us your feedback. We are constantly trying to improve our service here at Hotels Viva, and your comments and queries helps us in this matter.  It is very disappointing that your holiday did not meet your expectations and we send our apologies. Let me apologize that you have to advise us several times about the children in the adults pool. It is advertised in the main gate of the pool but we are going to work to improve it.  We pride ourselves in having very high standards and strive to give our guests a wonderful holiday experience.  We hope in the future to welcome you again in Hotels Viva, and allow us the opportunity to give you the holiday experience you desire.  Un saludo,  Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: Excellent hotel
review: Came here for a 3 day break, didn't pay loads so was not sure what to expect, excellent hotel and all the staff very friendly, we ate in hotel one night and selection of food was great. Rooms lovely too. Overall I was well impressed and will definately come back again.

title: nice hotel
review: Dear guest, Thank you for recommend us to anyone and for highlighting the lovely rooms,  good food, but specially our  friendly staff who made your holiday. We have transmitted your observations to the staff members, who will be motivate. Your comment inspire us to continue striving towards excellence. Thank you for sharing your excellent opinion about us, and looking forward to welcoming you Kind regards, Daniel Martorell Hotel manager.

title: A perfect place to stay in Alcudia
review: nice little hotel, its very family based so as a couple not the best we've been to.  food was nice the hotel room was very clean and decorated to a high standard. lovely spa like bathroom  the hotel staff weren't overly friendly   would visit again for a cheap little getaway

title: Relaxing and enjoyable hotel
review: This hotel is well worth staying at in Alcudia. A great base for cyclists and anybody visiting Alcudia. Rooms very modern and spotless. Food excellent, the all inclusive package is great value. The staff were welcoming and friendly. A really relaxing, luxurious hotel with a great spa, although pool seemed quite chilly when we used it. Well priced in October but seems very expensive for summer visits.

title: Absolutely Fantastic
review: Dear guest, It is an honor to know that you have spent a great holiday in Viva Tropic. Thank you very much for your nice comments about excellent food and great value all inclusive package, and about our staff who worked hard to make your holidays special. We are looking forward to seeing you very soon!!  Un saludo,  Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: Active holidays with MTB
review: Still summer in this time in Alcudia. Perfect for sunbathing, swimming in a sea or riding your bike. We came with our own bikes but you can also rent a good bikes for all levels of cycling (road, mtb, city bike) There are many families but it is still very quite place also for couples. We love there is normal restaurant during the day where you can order what ever you like...I recommend you their delicious salads. Buffet breakfast and dinner are perfect and delicious fresh food in diferent variation every day. Staff is very friendly and evening program full of great entertainment first for kids then for an adults. Highly recommend place to be any time with anyone.

title: Denise and Dave Benson
review: Dear guest,  It is a real pleasure to know that you had a wonderful stay here with us in Viva Tropic. Thank you very much for taking a time and let us know about your experience. One more time thank you for highlighting our Buffet, entertainment and friendly staff. Thank you for recommending us and looking forward to welcoming you once again!!!  Un saludo,  Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: Quality hotel for a last minute trip!
review: We have just come back from a 2 week stay at this hotel, which is not our first visit there, and I cannot praise the hotel and all their staff enough. Nothing is too much trouble and they are always welcoming, our room has also ways been spotless when we have stayed here. The staff work so hard and I know I have read complaints about time waiting for a drink from the bar waiters, although this did happen to us, nobody could say they weren't working hard it just seems that at times they are a little under staffed, and on a wait for drinks they have always been apologetic. The food is lovely with lots of choice. So my final word on this hotel is that all staff there should be thanked for making our stay so lovely.

title: Me gusta
review: I stayed at the viva tropic half board with my girlfriend for a week from the end of September start of October. It was my girlfriends 21st birthday so it was a last minute booking. We had never been to Majorca or alcudia before.   We flew over there with monarch really quality airline.  The transfer took under an hour and was fine.. It was raining when we got there but it cleared up over the week.   We arrived at the hotel ( around 2pm) which looked really nice from the front definitely looked 4 star. We were checked in immediately by Toni the reception manager who was brilliant. He made us feel welcome and upgraded our room from a studio to a top floor apartment overlooking the pool when my girlfriend told him she also works in a hotel and that it was her birthday. Perfect…

title: Just Fab!
review: Dear guest, It is an honor to know that you have spent a great holiday here with us. Thank you very much for your nice comments about our rooms,  all our staff who worked hard to make your holidays special and our different facilities.  Thank you for sharing your experience and for recommending us.   Un saludo,  Daniel Martorell Hotel manager

title: Viva Kindergarten Tropic.
review: This is a well run hotel set up especially for families with young children, we were a party of 4 over 60's and we have never seen so many in a hotel, so its not quiet. If you disregard the children this is a very nice 4star with good facilities good food and nice rooms,its kept very clean the staff are excellent and there is plenty of entertainment throughout the day, you can hire bikes but they do need upgrading, there is an inside pool,sauna, steam room and massage centre. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the harbour and sands and is in the better part of Alcudia. So if you have kids you can't fault it,without,there may be better alternatives. its your choice.

title: best family holiday experience
review: Dear guest, We thank you very much for taking the time of sharing your opinion, I really appreciate that you have chosen our Resort as your holiday destination. Thank you very much for highlighting our cleanliness, good food and the excellent staff. Thank you for recommending us and looking forward to welcoming you once again! Kind regards Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: Solid family hotel
review: we traveled 11th September 2014.  4 adults and our 4 year old daughter.  our stay was a week. outstanding hotel. great rooms, very friendly staff. im going to make this simple rooms 10/10 food 10/10 service 7/10 entertainment 10/10 location 8/10 hotel facilities 8/10 activities 8/10 for kids 9/10  I would recommend this hotel to others.  you will have the best time with the whole family.  one downside we all thought alto its not too big of deal.  the drinks at dinner or pool side was very slow service.  some times its nice to get the wine when eating a meal and not when finished.  all in inclusive is the way forward. we saved a fortune.  Alcudia in General is beautiful, the hotel is situated near shops and also walking distance to the nice beech Alcudia has to over

title: Brilliant holiday
review: Dear guest, It is a real pleasure to know that you and your family had a wonderful stay in Viva Tropic. Thank you very much for taking a time and let us know about your best family holiday experience. One more time thank you for highlighting our rooms and Staff. Thank you for recommending us and looking forward to welcoming you once again!!! Kind Regards, Daniel Martorell, Hotel Manager

title: Great Hotel, good beds but terrible resturant
review: Just spent a week here and agree with another review on here about the food.   The room was fine, very good and clean in fact. We treated ourselves to the Royal Terrace which I thought was expensive for what it was - basically a hot tub. It was too hot during the day to spend much time up there. However the normal rooms are much better value.   The restaurant was poor. Food was average and uniformly tepid. We only ate there once - thank goodness we didn't go all inclusive. My in-laws went twice and it was the same. Ambience is non-existent but I guess you have to expect that in a cafeteria style serve-yourself restaurant.   The pools are very good, and clean. In fact all the public areas are clean and well maintained. It irked me a bit that I couldn't go for an early morning…

title: Good hotel but understaffed
review: This was our second time at the viva tropic but we have stayed in viva hotels for the past 7 years. Travelled as a family of four ( children aged 3 & 7). Great hotel and the kids club staff are brilliant: Benie, Terese, Freda, Emma. Everything is great with the accommodation and pool but the major problem is the staffing in the evening. They do work hard, but the hotel needs to employ more staff to help. Waiting for food for 40 mins, and waiting for drinks for 20 mins when sat watching a show is totally unacceptable. I did discuss this issue with the receptionist and asked him to pass my concerns onto management. The staff who work very hard are Francisco and Carmona, but as a previous customer stated, Joaquin needs to gain some manners and customer service along with the staff…

title: Fantastic!
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much that you spent again your holidays in Viva Tropic. We are very happy that your children enjoyed in the miniclub with our staff. I let it know to the  entertainers. Let me apologize about the service in the bar, I ´ll inform it to the responsible of the departments and I’ll inform to the waiters of your their hard job and the comments that  you have done. Thank you again for your feedback. Kindest Regards Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: All Inclusive Plus Beware - (Jet 2 Holidays)
review: This was a last minute, panic booking for us as we we left in the lurch by villa parade. We needn't have worried. On arrival we were offered a pool view upgrade for €10 a night but we opted for a room on the third floor overlooking the road, residential apartments and the mountains. We loved watching the comings and goings and never found it too noisy. The room itself was ideal. We had a lovely bedroom and our (5'10") 14 year old daughter found the bed after in the living room comfortable enough. The room, hotel and grounds were all kept spotlessly clean as were the lovely pools. The entertainment staff were out of this world and kept all ages busy throughout the day. We enjoyed body balance, volleyball and water polo in between sunbathing on Sun lounger which were easily…

title: A fantastic family holiday!!
review: Came here last year as all inclusive, could not get the hotel we wanted for this year, therefore we were mis sold and was given this hotel as all inclusive plus, which does not mean a thing, exactly the same as last year, we were told we would have branded drinks and Al a carte in the evening but on checking in, the reception had never heard of this, and said we would have to pay extra to have the Al a Carte at night, spoken to the rep to complete a form, have chased several times back in England via phone and email not heard a thing from Jet 2 Customer services, have been into a high street travel agents and they confirm that a plus should include extra's.  We would not have booked knowing this because its like a cattle market at meal times in the restaurant with very young…

title: Fab family holiday
review: Dear guest, First of all we would like to thank you for taking the time to send us your comments and queries. It is very important to us as it improves the service level of our hotel.  Now let me apologize that you were not given the holiday you expected. Our aim here in Hotels Viva is to ensure that your holiday is an extremely happy one. It’s very difficult for us to give you a service (All Inclusive Plus) that we don’t have,  and we didn’t promote it in the hotel or in our website because it doesn’t exist.  I hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you again to Hotels Viva. We pride ourselves in having many returning, satisfied customers. When we do have a complaint we treat all correspondence seriously.  Un saludo,  Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: Definitely a 4* hotel
review: We travelled as a couple and got back a few weeks ago from this hotel. Its probably the best and most flexible hotel we've ever stayed in.  We arrived at the Viva Tropic following an airport transfer from Palma Airport at about midday. Alcudia is actually quite far away from the airport so you're looking at approx 1.5hrs for a transfer or about 45 minutes for a private transfer. Palma airport is heaving no matter what time of day so best to book before you leave to avoid queuing.   The lady who checked us in was friendly. She offered us a free upgrade (garden view room, which would normally have been 6EUR extra per night). We decided to go all-inclusive on arrival so she charged us for 6 days instead of 7, and we basically got free lunch and dinner. Good start. We went to check…

title: great resort location and great for families
review: My wife 10month old daughter and parents booked this last minute as we had to cancel a previous holiday due to illness and to be honest wanted to avoid the family hotels as no doubt will be experiencing them in the future. we stayed on a B & B basis However Alcudia and viva tropic are both place we would be willing to return to. Alcudia is great for families lovely shallow sandy beach lots of watersports nice marina and lovely old town near by. The viva tropic is approx. a MAX five minute walk to the beach ten to fifteen minutes walk to marina (some lovely yachts to dream about) and a fifteen to twenty min walk to the old town (5Euros in a taxi) The hotel is ideal for families the food is nice however we decided to eat our most nights due to the lovely weather and the abundance…

title: A brilliant hotel...
review: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on TA and happy to contribute to the positive comments afforded this hotel. After reading the reviews we asked for an upgrade on arrival but the very pleasant reception staff said we had a good room in the newly refurbished block 4 and we were not disappointed with the high standard of the accommodation.  The new pool was an inspired addition for those wanting to get away from the bustle of the main pools.  For those with younger families the pirate ship pool area and dry side park is brilliant.  The only comments on the room design: waste water pipes from the bathroom above came through the main bedroom/sound through AC vent which was like water torture (why not have external pipes?) and the little used second sink could be replaced with…

title: Wonderful holiday
