review: Returned last week from a 10 day all inc stay with my wife and 12 year old son. Apart from a mix up with our room at the start the hotel stay was faultless. All the staff were friendly and polite and work so hard to please. Our son is autistic and he loved the pools, mini golf, volleyball but most of all the waiters who went out of their way to entertain him. He knows them all by name and still talks about them now. The all inc deal was well worth the money too as we found all the meals to be delicious with a very wide choice of food. The entertainment staff were also great and seemed to have endless energy and enthusiasm particularly with the kids. For a family holiday I think think this is probably the best you'll find in the resort.

title: Fantastic!!!
review: Great hotel, great food, lovely clean rooms. We stayed 1st week of july and we were very impressed. Hotel is just 5 mins walk from beach and restaurants. Though we didnt eat out much as the food was top quality and varied each night. Entertainment was better than the usual hotel stuff and our 8 year old had a ball in all the pools. Overall fantastic holiday at Viva Tropic booking for next year.

title: one of the best hotel in Alcudia
review: what a lovely hotel , the staff , the price and the atmosphere all are perfect . also it situated just 2 minutes from the beach . They have  nice and quite environment . and if you like sunbathing but dont want to go to the beach , dont worry they there is a park with vollyboll court just behind the hotel .  highely recommanded

title: Cannot fault this hotel!! Ignore negative reviews!
review: Just returned from a week stay at the viva tropic with my partner and our 2 and 6 year old sons and my parents.  From the moment u check in where they offer u the chance to view and upgrade your room (which is worth the 10 euros per night) till the time u leave u will not be disappointed with this hotel! The splash pool for the kids is fantastic. The bigger pool is amazing and the adult only pool is lush if you are a couple without children!  We stayed all inclusive and loved the food so much we didn't eat out once!  The service is outstanding. The waiters do not stop and never leave u waiting long for a drink!  The hotel is spotless throughout! Hats off to the cleaners!  The location is fab. 5-10 minute walk to the beach, shops, harbour etc.  There is also the land train stop…

title: Good but not great ?
review: Me and my wife have just returned from our holiday at the viva tropic this Is our 5th visit in seven years . Me and my wife have read the reviews over the last couple of months and was surprised about the comments about the staff ? So here are thoughts about the staff and our experiences .  The staff was excellent from start to finish we was welcomed from front of house pep who was very friendly and excellent through out . The maids worked so hard and cleaned the rooms to a very good standard . The bar staff was friendly and always laughing . One thing that I will say  The bar is far to expensive 4.20 euro for a pint bars around and other hotels two euros ? The entertainment is not brilliant and there is no plan b as the weather turned a couple of days I think they could of done…

title: Great hotel
review: The hotel was lovely, we stayed in a one bed apartment, the room was spacious, modern and clean. The staff were great and the kids club team were brilliant. It's located very near to the beach, and has some lovely restaurants and bars in walking distance, we stayed self catering so can't comment on the food. We would definitely recommend to anyone, we loved it!

title: Nearly perfect
review: 2 Weeks Self Catering Studio (sleeps 3)  Two adults and a 6 year old  Transfer - tedious as is any airport transfer but arrived in around 1hr 45 mins from the airport Check in - we arrived early afternoon and check in was quick and easy.  We'd read on line about an offer of upgrades, but there were none available. Room - why did we worry about an upgrade?  We'd paid for the cheapest room available which slept 3 of us and it was perfect for our requirements, it had adequate SC facilities - to be honest we only ever had breakfast in the room so never used the hob or the microwave but used the toaster, kettle and coffee maker.  The room and bathroom throughout was lovely and modern and the shower was awesome.  Just make sure you put a towel down to stop the bathroom flooding as I…

title: Fantastic family hotel
review: We have just returned after spending 10 days at the viva tropic, we had a really lovely relaxing time, our room was spotlessly clean and of a good size (we had a two bedroomed room in block 4), I was a little apprehensive as our children are of different ages (three girls 17,15 & 9), they all had a fab time and made lots of new friends, the staff were very friendly particularly the waiters who made our holiday, francisco,xim, richardo and pako are a true credit to the hotel! The pool and surrounding areas are spotlessly clean, we did however struggle to get sunbeds as they were all occupied by 9am, this was not too much of a problem though as we relaxed in the garden area instead, the food was of a very high standard, we stayed on half board basis. The port is a 10 minute walk…

title: Fantastic!
review: Just returned from a one week, self catering stay at Viva Tropic in a Royal Terrace Apartment.  The room made the holiday - the spacious terrace, with jacuzzi and balinese bed made the stay so relaxing.  The main pool was spacious and the adult pool a dream!  Don't know why others have complained about the noise from the splash pool - it's a family hotel, what do you expect?!  Just put your earphones in and relax :) Five min walk to the lovely Alcudia beach - 2 beds and umbrella for the day for 9 Euros - bargain!  Some lovely restaurants around the hotel with usual prices.  Kids (9 and 12) had a fab time, with lots to join in with if they wanted to.  The place is so clean and tidy and noise levels not too bad - we are seriously considering going back next year, which is not…

title: Great Holiday
review: Spent 10 nights self-catering at the Viva Tropic in early August. Overall, we had an excellent time and the hotel is generally very good.  On arrival, Trip Advisor posts had informed us that we would be asked if we wanted an upgraded room. We were shown 3 rooms; the one we had paid for, a ground floor garden room and a room in the new Block 4. Having budgeted for the upgrade, we took the garden room for an additional 25 Euros per night...and what a great room it was (2005).   Inside, the 2 bedrooms were spacious and well maintained, the room was clean and cleaned regularly by the staff. The kitchen was OK for breakfast and lunch preparation with ample utensils, toaster, kettle, fridge. The bathroom was clean and we always had plenty of fresh towels. But the best bit was our…

title: Topgran01
review: Don't believe the moaning minnies. Lovely hotel. All staff very polite and good with children. My room was spotless and cleaned on the days specified. Walk in shower brilliant. The daily entertainment suited all ages. The food was top class and very varied. Pool areas clean and staffed by lifeguards. What more can I say. Definitely somewhere we would go again with family as the All Inclusive options gave a large variety to choose from.

title: FAULTLESS!! Best family holiday ever!!
review: After just getting back from a week at this hotel I simply can't believe some of the negative reviews! If you are thinking of a family hotel with good food, good staff and loads to do for the kids.... THIS IS IT! Book now! Can't recommend this hotel enough!  We went as a party of 7. Me & my wife, a six year old boy & a 2year old girl plus 3 grandparents. Upon arrival we were told that the hotel was booked up & they asked if 1 of our party would mind spending a night in another hotel... They couldn't apologise enough & to compensate they gave my other in law a free 30 minute massage in the spa, gave us a free cot bed for the duration of the holiday, free safe in the room, they personally escorted my mother in law to the other hotel which was a more expensive hotel anyway only 50…

title: Another Great Stay
review: Just returned from what would be out third visit to this hotel.  We have always stayed on a self catering basis, as there are plenty of good restaurants within fifteen minutes walk.  Therefore can comment on the service in the hotel restaurants or bars, but it did look a bit manic at times.  The hotel still offers good quality accommodation for families and is in a great location.  You are about a 5 minute walk to the beach, a 10 minute walk to the port area and around a 30 minute walk to Alcudia old town or the Bellvue strip.  If you don't fancy the walk, there is a ting ting train stop outside of Burger Luna just around the corner or a taxi will cost around €5 each way.  If checking in between 1200-1400 there can be a little wait for your room as the are cleaned, but it's…

title: Perfect family holiday
review: This hotel is of a very high standard, the hotel and rooms are very nice decorated lovely and immaculately clean. The furniture is decent to. We stayed for 7 nights All Inclusive and we never ate out once as the food was outstanding, breakfast you could get bacon, eggs,sausages etc or cereals, fruits and yoghurts for the healthier holiday makers unlike my hubby and son who were in heaven with the pancakes and waffles. Prosecco is also available at breakfast. At lunch we chose to dine at the pool bar the food was very nice and there was a good choice of burgers, lovely salads chicken kebabs, lasanga etc and everthing from spaghetti bolognaise to chicken nuggets for the kids. Dinner in the evening is a buffet which was varied and delicious. We stayed in a one bedroom premium…

title: Great family hotel
review: Just returned from a 10 day break at Viva Tropic and come away very impressed. We arrived late on a Sunday night and were offered an upgrade which we took. Our two boys (aged 7 & 9) have had the time of their lives. Kids entertainment is offered throughout the day should they wish to join in and the pools offer great fun for all the family. We stayed self catering & enjoyed a great selection of restaurants in the port and old town however did eat twice from the a la carte restaurant at the hotel, which was delicious. Have noticed some other reviewers commenting on poor service from bar staff which we did encounter on a couple of occasions (not all staff) but this should not put off others from what is a great hotel, catering well for families.  All in all this was a great family…

title: One of the best ..but too expensive
review: Great hotel..perfect location, friendly staff, kids will love it, but if older than 10_12 years, something is missing for them to do. a little too expensive if you buy terrace apartment. But wont find better place in alcudia.

title: High standards and price, unprofessional staff
review: We had a great time with kids playing in the pools or enjoying the many activities.   The lunch restaurant is not a good choice but the dinner a la carte is reasonably priced and a good choice with evening shows.   The housekeeping was ok. Workout was small but well maintained.   The reception is not to standards. They give wrong information when they do not know and there is no point in telling them about things to be arranged like missing linens or lightbulbs (catch the service-minded maids instead). The most serious issue was their lack of control with airport transfer organized by themselves. We waited 55 minutes after agreed pickup time (confirmed twice) and they took no responsibility for their shortcomings and only repeated over and over again that it "would be in 5-10…

title: Great holiday, lovely hotel
review: Just got home from a 10 night stay.  We stayed self catering myself, husband and son first Impressions where excellent, room a little small but immaculately clean and had all the amenities we needed.  Hotel grounds where fabulous, garden, adult pool, golf, play area, kids pool and a main pool also plenty of sunbeds :) small on site supermarket, pool bar offering snacks and main restaurant.  We decided not to book all inclusive as we like to get out and about and sample restaurants in the resort so cannot comment on food.  Hotel staff where helpful, friendly and accomodatiing would definitely return.  The resort itself was lovely, loads of restaurants, nice beach and prom and lovely harbour to admire the many yachts!! Michael Schumacher's was docked when we stayed.

title: Perfect for families
review: Me and my mum and son of 4 have just come back from a very good holiday at the Viva Tropic.   The only criticism was the poor service when we first arrived. Our plane was delayed and we arrived at 1.30am, my son was asleep around my arms and the man on reception did not offer to help with the luggage and watched me struggle with the cases and my son asleep. I do not think this is acceptable for a 4 star hotel. He also then programmed out cards incorrectly so we had to go back down to reception to ask for help. Having payed the same price as an adult for my son I was disappointed to see a pull out bed in the same room as me and my mum. We had to share a double bed also. We then thought this was going to be an unpleasant holiday.   Fortunately the rest of the staff made up for our…

title: Great holiday, fantastic hotel
review: We have just come back from a fab holiday at Viva Tropic.  We have stayed at Viva Hotel every year for the last seven years & this was our second visit to Tropic. This hotel is fantastic.  I can't understand other reviews about unpleasant hotel staff as this wasn't our experience at all.  In fact totally the opposite, they were extremely friendly and helpful.  We were all inclusive and I felt we were treated exactly the same as those 'paying' in the bar and restaurant. We stayed in a Royal Terrace apartment, which I can highly recommend.   The entertainment staff were great & work extremely hard.  The shows were good on the nights the viva Flying Team performed, but I wasn't very impressed with a couple of the other shows.  All in all, a fab hotel and location.  We will…

title: Fab Viva Tropic
review: Arrived for our 10 day holiday,booked in and went to our room which was facing the street. Went straight back down to ask for a different room as I had requested pool view. After being told nothing was available, they found us a room at an additional cost of 10 euros per day! Room 1237 was great, large bedroom with huge bed, plenty of wardrobe space and hangers, sofa bed in living room opened up to large single or double, bathroom was spacious with large shower. Balcony was spacious and lovely view over complex. My only gripe is the air con-ok in living room but terrible in bedroom. FOOD- would have to say this was excellent. We were AI and a wide variety was available to suit everyone. We also ate at the A la carte on 2 occasions and although we enjoyed it, wasn't any better…

title: Pretty standard really!
review: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here from the 16th June for 1 week. We meticulously trawl through reviews on here to find good hotels before we go away. We always stay self catering since we prefer to eat out at different places each day.   My positive points are that it is very, very close to the beach, port and shops and since it gets very hot it's nice not to have to walk too far. There is a train which takes you to and from a few places, although not the old town. It's about a half hour walk to there. There is a nightly market on the pier, lots of places to eat and the food is well priced and lovely, lots for veggies to eat, too.   There are quite a few negatives compared to other hotels I have stayed in abroad. I wore flip flops in the shower because the floor of it looked…

title: Awfull hotel
review: We are currently halfway through a 14 day stay at the viva tropic and are desperately miserable every minute we spend in the place, this is totally down to the front of house bar and restaurant staff. They are appalling, they are making our stay almost unbearable. One of the recent reviews commented that they thought because they were all inclusive they were treats poorly. We are not all inclusive , so pay for everything but are still treated like dirt. Customers service is none existent. The staff are miserable, rude and totally alien to any other I have experienced in Spanish hotels, we love Alcudia and the old town especially but Viva Tropic is one hotel you should avoid at all cost if you expect happy smiling staff looking to make your stay something special.

title: Disappointed
review: Dear guest, First of all we would like to thank you for taking the time to send us your comments and queries. It is very important to us, as it improves the service level of our hotel.  Now let me apologize that you were not given the service in the bar/restaurant that you expected. Our aim here in Viva is to ensure that your holiday is an extremely happy one. I’m going to inform to the responsible of the department about all your comments.  I hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you again to Hotels Viva. We pride ourselves in having many returning, satisfied customers. When we do have a complaint we treat all correspondence seriously  Un saludo,  Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: Good Position, better for families with younger kids.
review: Me and my extended family stayed one week at Viva Tropic in June. We were there to celebrate my mothers 60 years birthday and treated ourself with all inclusive. Big mistake... We felt like we were being punished for that choice throughout the stay. The service in the bar area and restaurant was really rude and unpleasent. We felt like we were bothering them every time we ordered something. We do understand that other paying guest are more likely to tip them but this is not acceptable. We were prepared to tip if we got good service but unfortunately that did not happen...  The entertainment at night was ok but a bit boring and repetative. The bar closed at 11 pm and so did the light on the appartments balconies..  Roomservice was almost not existing. Seemed like all they did was…

title: not for adults
review: First of all we would like to thank you for taking the time to send us your comments and queries. It is very important to us as it improves the service level of our hotel.  Now let me apologise that you were not given the holiday you expected. Our aim here in Viva is to ensure that your holiday is an extremely happy one.  I hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you again to Hotels Viva. We pride ourselves in having many returning, satisfied customers. When we do have a complaint we treat all correspondence seriously.

title: Fabulous family holiday
review: This hotel is in a great location, within a 5 minute walking distance of the Port and the beach, which is great for kids as it is shallow but a bit cold. There is a lovely breeze in Alcudia, most of the time. It is about a 20-25 minute walk from the old town and a bit less to the Bellevue Strip. There are lots of shops nearby but the Spar shops are overpriced. If you go out of the hotel, turn right and right again, then walk for a few minutes, you will see Eroski supermarket on the left. Much better than Lidl and you can read what you are buying! Prices much lower than the Spar shops. The prices in Bip are also better than Spar and they do 3 lovely, big, freshly baked croissants for €1. The hotel is multi national and we found our 11 year old struggled to find someone to play…

title: Excellent stay
review: A great hotel in a great quiet location with a 2 min walk to beach. We stayed in the Royal Terr apartments - excellent and a must stay. Staff efficient and polite, very clean hotel, rooms cleaned every day, beds comfy also. will def be staying there again- excellent. you can upgrade whilst there also subject to availability.

title: Good Hotel for Young Children
review: We are a couple who stayed for a week at the Viva Tropic with our two year old son in June 2014.  We stayed on a self catering basis in a studio room.  The room was fine and looked out the front across to another hotel.  The hotel area was always kept clean although more attention to detail in cleaning the room itself could have been made.  There were long dark hairs all over our room that I had to keep cleaning up.  However, this is a minor point as overall the room was clean.  What really makes this hotel are the pool areas and the location of the hotel itself.  There are 3 pools, the main pool, an adults only pool and a children’s pool.  All pools were lovely and the children’s pool was great and also has a play area right next to it with a small bouncy castle and trampoline…

title: Fantastic family holiday, can't wait to come back
review: Just recently got back from viva tropic with my partner and 4 year old boy. First thing I noticed immediately on arrival is how nice the place looks from the outside, and also the reception area is immaculate. I spent the week self catering so didn't eat there much to comment properly on the food, however given how enjoyable the time spent in the complex is I would definitely recommend all inclusive. The swimming pools are brilliant and cater for everyone. As a dad I had the main pool to play with my son, which is of a great size and couldn't be cleaner, the kids splash pool is fantastic for kids to play in on their own, and the adult only pool is the perfect tonic when you need a break. There is literally so much fun to be had there we only really left viva tropic to eat, and…

title: Only okay with toddlers
review: We stayed one week in Viva Tropic in the end of June 2014 with our 1 year old daughter. While the hotel was bustling with families with young children 3-10 who seemed to enjoy themselves, we found it hard for us to relax in the hotel: There is no pool with water depth of less than 35 cm, thus for toddlers who cannot walk there is no pool to play in. Kids Club (entertainment for kids), playground, general layout of the pools all favor older children: The water is too deep, the pools are in the sun, the toys are not age appropriate, there is no indoor area for kids. In total: We had a hard time to do anything except stay in the room during the noon hours, when the sun was too hot and scorching for a toddler.    About the room: The typical scam when arriving at the hotel. Our…

title: Lovely family holiday
review: Dear guest, Let me start by thanking you for taking time to give us your feedback. We are constantly trying to improve our service here at Hotels Viva and your comments and queries helps us in this matter.  It is very disappointing that your holiday did not meet your expectations and we send our apologies. We pride ourselves in having very high standards and strive to give our guests a wonderful holiday experience.  We hope in the future to welcome you again in Hotels Viva, and allow us the opportunity to give you the holiday experience you desire.  Kind Regards,  Daniel Martorell Hotel manager

title: Great Holiday More than expected altough could be picky!
review: 4 of us stayed at the Viva tropic first week of June with a rather large generation gap! 89 years old to 7 year old. and the place catered fantastically for it!.  On arrival we had asked to upgrade both rooms to a privilege room, (these are on the ground floor and have a little terrace a grass area a Hammock and a gate that leads directly to the pool) this was perfect for us as my grandfather had his own little space to enjoy the sun as you can imagine he was not interested in any thing else we were delighted to learn that this was only 300e to upgrade the 2 rooms for a week, and in our position it was well worth it and couldn't of been more perfect. the rooms were well equipped and beds very comfortable only gripe would be bathroom tiles need replaced but was very clean. Clean…

title: Lovely place to stay
review: I stayed at the Viva Tropic for 5 nights in May. I was very impressed with the hotel. The apartment was spacious and well decorated, pool areas were lovely and the staff very helpful. I will stay again.

title: Family hotel
review: Great with children. Rooms good size and bathroom showers excellent.   Lifts rather tiresome, closing very fast and often long wait, so easier to walk.   Staff great and small leak fixed immediately. Impressive.

title: Fab  holiday
review: just  got  back  from   pto  Alcudia   stayed  at   the  Viva  Tropic   was   great   the  staff   where  great  the  hotel  very  clean  rooms  very  nice  the  food   was   brill  could  not  fault   this  hotel  night  entertainment  was   good  cant  wait  to  go  back  the  holiday  was  just   what   we  wanted

title: Lovely Hotel for Family Holiday
review: Overall a thoroughly nice place to stay. we had a Royal terrace 1 bed apartment which was nice & clean & big enough for couple with 2 toddlers. We fitted travel cot in our room & 3.5 year old had sofa bed in living area. Our terrace was what made it with garden table & chairs, garden seating areas, 2 loungers, hammock & Jacuzzi and enough room for kids to play on. there was a shade over half of it too so was nice for kids when it was too hot during day. Found room nice & clean throughout our stay. We stayed all inclusive and found the food & drinks better than most others we've stayed in, plenty of choice and dealt with my husbands gluten free diet very well (head chef personally cooked him gf pizza on request). All other staff were really happy to help with anything & great…

title: Mosquitos, faulty air con and noisy neighbours
review: The location of the hotel was perfect for Ironman 70.3 Mallorca & room sizes are good. The mosquito nest in our room, hundreds of insect bites, lack of working air con and being woken up by noisy neighbours at all hours were less good. Without these faults, the hotel would be great value money, but as I sit here and write this review covered in bites, I would have gladly paid more for a cleaner room.

title: Great hotel, excellent staff
review: Dear Sir,   As we consider guest comments and suggestions very useful to improve our services we would like to thank you for leaving a comment  about Viva Tropic.   We are sorry to hear that you were unable to enjoy your holidays as wished for. If we would have been informed at the time we could have given you advise which treatment to use to avoid mosquito bites. We would like to mention that a few factors such as being close to the coastline, having vegetated natural ponds nearby and temperature changes are the ideal habitat for mosquitos.   We believe that tranquility and being able to relax is one of the most important things for our guests; if we would have received the information about the noise in the surrounding rooms  we would have taken the measurements needed to reduce the noisiness , though we like to mention that changing rooms to solve the inconvenience  was not possible at the time as being fully booked due to the international event of the Iron man.  We hereby want to reconfirm that guest - comments and suggestions are taken seriously by the management  and we hope you consider giving us another opportunity in which you can fully enjoy your stay at our establishment .   Kind Regards, Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: Great hotel
review: This hotel is great, the staff is nice. When we were there it was quiet. That is good for the buffet. We did not have all inclusive, but the formula looked good. Our booked room was not ready yet, so we got a bigger one and a free dinner. No problem with that. We had a garden appartment with 2 bedrooms. The bedrooms are very small, too small to put a babybed in there. The pool was cold (beginning of May), the 18+ pool was nice warm. But with the baby you are not allowed in the 18+ pool. So no swimming for her.

title: Fab hotel
review: We stayed at the Viva tropic over the Easter break with 2 young children. On arrival we were offered various upgrades - pool view, garden terrace etc but we decided not to take them up on this. I was somewhat disappointed with the view from the room we were allocated which was overlooking overgrown grass/waste land but as we don't spend a lot of time in our room, I wasn't too bothered.  We had one issue with our shower but after speaking with the maid it was fixed by the time we returned after lunch. Our room was a good size, there was plenty of storage space, it had a good variety of toiletries (the sewing kit came in useful!) and was clean. The rooms are not cleaned on a Sunday or Wednesday.   The food was amazing, with lots of choice during the breakfast and dinner buffet. I…

title: Lovely hotel, loved it!!
review: Stayed at viva tropic with my partner and six year old son, who loved the pirate ship!! Room was clean and catered for just what you need, we were in a premium one bed apartment with a pool view food was excellent for all inclusive would visit again

title: Good hotel, great staff and brilliant facilities for cyclists.
review: We stayed at the Viva Tropic in the week running up to Easter. We stayed in a top floor one bedroom apartment with a Royal Terrace with our two daughters aged 12 and 16. The accommodation was great, not massively roomy but fine for our needs. The terrace facilities, loungers, dining table, easy chairs and a jacuzzi were great and the top floor terrace is a real sun trap. The staff were excellent from the reception, shop, dining and cleaners - always polite and did a great job. We only had a couple of snack lunches at the pool bar, which were fine, but I can't comment further on the quality of the food.  I hired a bike from another bike shop, although bike hire of some pretty decent bikes is available from the hotel (look on their website for more details). The storgae facilities…

title: Good amenities , poor customer service.
review: The hotel overall was ok we were happy with the room and general cleanliness. The adult pool was very popular with our party. We were self catering and found the prices to be a bit steep at the bar and it was shut at 23:00 on the dot. Safety deposit boxes were chargeable so we took our bulky valuables with us. Joanne left her purse hidden in a bag out of sight only to find Spider-Man had been in our room and stolen it. We reported it to the desk and they said it was our fault for not taking out a room safe.but the only people to access our room on the third floor was ourselves and the cleaner.so thanks to there incompetence or light fingers we lost a half day filling in police reports and going to the police station ect, never mind the spending money and cards. When we did see…

title: Great for cyclists
review: Just returned from a week in the Viva Tropic. We booked as a last minute decision, and joined friends who were already there. First impression of the Hotel was good, with a clean entrance and reception area. We were very quickly booked in by friendly staff. Our room was on the first floor facing the garden, so it got the best of the sunshine. The room itself was basic but clean. We stayed on a self catering basis, and my advice would be to avoid the hotel shop. Lidl is only a short walk and will supply everything you need at half the price. We did have lunch at the hotel a couple of times around the pool bar. The food was quite good, and not too expensive. The main pool area seemed well kept and there were certainly plenty of sun beds. But I would imagine its would be very busy…

title: Viva la viva
review: After staying in the VIva Nova last year, I booked the tropic thinking it would have a similar feel. I'm pleased to say we weren't disappointed, indeed in most respects the Tropic was better because of its cleaner location (Alcudia rather than Palma Nova). The staff again were mainly friendly apart from a grumpy main barman inside bar. The only complaint id have was when I booked this hotel last July, I requested a low floor and quiet room due to having 2 young children, we ended up on the top floor in the 1st room next to the elevators where everyone walked past...Viva Tropic you dropped a mark for this

title: Great Stay
review: We arrived to a warm welcome from hotel receptionist,the hotel was spacious and spotlessly clean. Our room had all that you could wish for ,great range of toiletries and once again it was spotless.... We were on bed and breakfast basis ,and the breakfast didn't disappoint it was excellent with a fabulous range for all,the service was excellent with staff very helpful. We spent time relaxing in the indoor pool and spa which was total heaven. All in all a great place to stay with great facilities,near to the beach and local amenities. Hope to return back :)

title: Great hotel with great facilities
review: We arrived at Viva Tropic on a rainy day but there were so much to do in the hotel it did not ruin our day. The steam room, sauna, jacuzzi and the pools were great. The whole place was very clean and well-kept. Over the next three days, we had good weather and were able to just relax around the pool area. We were there before the peak season so lots of deck chairs to choose from. We could spend a whole day in the hotel without having to venture out. If you are having the buffet, we recommend that you arrive early, otherwise, the food gets a bit over-cooked sitting on the hot plates. The hotel is also close to the beach and there are some pleasant walks along the beach. There are several supermarkets nearby if you are doing self-catering. Great for children as well.

title: Great Hotel with Great Memories!
review: Stayed here in October 2013 with my friend for a week, we chose the hotel because we found it looked like one of the nicest and good value for money compared to others we'd seen in Alcudia. I was actually quite surprised at how nice it was when we arrived, the lobby area is very modern and well equipped, and every time we walked in to the hotel from outside we were hit with a really nice fresh, flowery smell - had no idea what it actually was but it was lovely! Our room was just as great, we were really pleased with what we got for our money. We had a spacious terrace with table, chairs, clothes dryer...  As far as I'm aware the hotel has the options of all inclusive, half-board and self-catering. We went for self-catering as we hoped there would be a nearby town with plenty of…

title: Booked up to return
review: Have stayed twice at this hotel, once in October and once in August.  Arrived both times on a Tuesday, which is the busiest day for the hotel.  Whilst we have had to wait a little to check-in, reception do have a system in place to ensure any delays are minimised.  Due to its location, we have always stayed on a self-catering basis as there is plenty of restaurants around the port area that are reasonably priced.  However, the food in the hotel when we have used the facilities has always been nice.  The hotel itself is very clean, well maintained and they are very mindful that most their guests are families, so the evening entertainment ends at about 2230.  Pools early in the day can be a bit on the cool side early in the day, but warm up quickly.  The pirate pool is firm…

title: Cannot fault this hotel
review: Stayed here for a week at the beginning of October, and just want to add our praise to the previous reviews.  Hotel location is ideal, only minutes from the beach, and if you're feeling up to it 15 minutes from the Old Town in the other direction. Hotel was clean and the staff all very friendly and helpful. Room was very well equipped, with maid service all but 2 days of the week. Loved the wet-room with the large shower. Had a balcony looking out onto the main street, with a marina and sea view at a distance. Loved the over 18 pool area, and when we weren't on the beach we were crashed on the beds surrounding the pool. The indoor pool in the spa was great, and usually warmer than the outside pools. The on-site supermarket was great for your early-morning pastries, as we were…

title: paradise hotel
review: brilliant lady on reception when we arrived very on the ball fabulous room we had garden room overlooking garden and pool on top floor great views. everywhere was very clean and fab large comfy bed.. the beach is 5 min walk and lovely long golden beach. everyone was great and can't wait to go back.

title: Great location
review: Me and my partner stayed for a week at this hotel with our 18 month old baby.she loved it. There was great kids entertainment.  The service was excellent.  We stayed in a studio apartment and it was nice. There was a lovely walk in shower and the room was clean. The only downside is getting charged 28 euros for a cot.  The hotel was very clean and loads to do for ny daughter.  The only negative is that the pools were freezing but the inside pool was gorgeous.   We went self catering but ate dinnee twice and it was outstanding.  It was all you could eat and great food.  The location was amazing it is ashort walk to a gorgeous beach and all the restaurants are nearby.  Overall a great holiday

title: Rainy paradise
review: An off-season break in April so rain was expected, but that did not spoil our stay. The hotel was still quite busy and vibrant. Helpful staff, clean and well appointed rooms. Our top tip would be to pay for the all inclusive deal as the food is very good and the evening buffet has great choice. A 15 min walk will take you into the old town, which is beautiful and has some good restaurants

title: Good, but not as good as other Viva Hotels!!
review: Stayed here in August for 10 nights with my husband and our 3 children (ages 12,10 and 4). We have previously stayed at Viva Palmavoa several times and at Viva Malllorca and, I have to say, this hotel was not at the same standard as the other vivas we've styled at.   Positives: The rooms were good (we stayed in a double apartment) and the all inclusive food and drinks were also good (albeit the service for drinks was very very slow to the point where we gave up a few times).  Pool areas were clean and the location was very good ( a few mins walk from the beach). The kids club was good for younger kids- our 4 year old enjoyed the games and football.  Negatives: The staff were not as friendly as in other Viva hotels and in some cases they were rude- particularly the female…

title: Perfect family hotel
review: We (family of four, kids aged 3 and 8) stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in september 2013. We had booked a royal top terrace apartment and this was truly a good choice. The apartment had a nice terrace with own jacuzzi. There are some things that make this hotel an excellent choice for families: the pool area, food and location. Only thing that could be improved is the service at reception and the bar. Some of the staff was not so service minded. No extra smiling there. Then again the staff at the restaurant were very nice and much more service minded.  The pool area is very good. There are three different pool areas. One for children, one for adults and one for everybody (including kids). The water temperature was ok when we where there (we had a nice weather about 25-30…

title: Mr Ed
review: We couldn't fault this hotel. Has great facilities like adult only pool, spa and a supermarket. This has all the normal brands and freshly baked baguettes in the morning which was good as we went self catering. Our apartment was ample sized, walk in shower and sufficient cooking appliences and clean. We didn't see many of the hotels shows, but looked of a good standard. The hotel was 100% spotless, there always seemed to be cleaning !!

title: lovely 1st Class  hotel .
review: We  had a bad start as we had to wait some time for our room to be ready, And  its a shame that this Hotel was full of Sad looking Germans ,  I think My Daughter And I Was  the only ones that looked happy to be here ! oh And the kids  seemed to Enjoy it ,  we had a Royal Terrace room And what a lovely Terrace ( balcony ) it was - Even had a Jacuzzi  on it ,   Nice Room But Nothing Special ,  very Clean  And the Bedding was Spotless, we did not Eat in the Hotel so can not Comment on that,  Lovely pool and pool Area,  Also   There is An Adult only Pool  with  Large Double Beds Around the pool,  But they have Built A Children’s Play Area Right Next to it, ... it does not make Any sense , who want to lay there listening to a Load of Screaming kids..... Not us !    Short walk to the…

title: happy holiday
review: Recently returned from Viva Tropic after a fabulous holiday.  Hotel in good position - less than 5 minute walk to nice beach with cheap umberellas and sunbeds. Much preferred this area to brash Aludia itself.  Lots of shops, bars and restaurants nearby offering a variety of quisine. Premier studio rooms were well equipt with fridge, kettle, hairdryer etc. and large comfy beds.   (Take your own hangers) Maid does not come 2 days and I would expect to have rooms cleaned every day at 4 star accommodation. We went all inclusive and the food was of a good standard - the red wine being particularly good.  Staff were generally very attentive (Pacco was brilliant) although a couple of staff behaved in an off-hand manner with us. Evening entertainment finished at 10.00 a.m. but was good…

title: A nice hotel for a family holiday
review: We just came back from a two weeks holiday at this hotel. We had "all-inclusive" for the entire stay. This is a great family hotel in Alcudia. In general we are very happy about our stay! The hotel is very clean and well kept.   Reception - Very friendly and helpful staff.   Poolbar - Here they served light snack for lunch such as pizzas, salads, hamburgers etc. A very nice alternative to the lunch buffet. In the poolbar you could go and get a drink all day, small bottled water, ice creams and fresh fruit. The bar menu had a wide selection of different drinks with or without alcohol. Waiters was friendly but a little bit pushy on the tipping and this i found a bit uncomfortable. I would have given them more if they didn't asked for it.  Restaurant - Great service! Very patient…

title: great hotel - perfect for families
review: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel on Monday 9 September for 5 nights. It is excellent. we stayed in a studio which was a perfect size and very well kitted out and also had the luxury of a balcony.  There are 2 main pools for children which looked great fun, however we chose to hang out mainly at the over 18s pool where are the double beds to sunbathe on with your partner/friend and is more relaxed and peaceful as no children around although you can still of course hear everything around you. It certainly seemed very glamorous in this area and we always managed to get a bed, even if returning from the beach later in the afternoon  Great value for money as well and wonderful service, the receptionists were very friendly and helpful. My only slight moan would be that we had…

title: The good & the not so good.
review: I recently visited this hotel for 7 nights with my fiance. We choose this hotel because of its location, less than 5 minutes walk to the port and about 2 mintues to the gorgeous beach, the adult only pool with balinese inspired beds and overall because the Viva chain had lots of great reviews.  I knew before I booked that this was a family hotel. We definitly were one of only a few couples without children but that really didnt bother us at any point during the holiday. We spent our days at the beach or at the adult only pool and ate out every evening so we never really came into contact with the kids club. The hotel seemed big enough for children and adults without children.   The hotel had 3 seperate pools. The main pool, a pirate splash pool for the children and an adult only…

title: Good facilities but appalling staff
review: The viva tropic is a great hotel but is let down by very poor service and awful management. I stayed for a week with my extended family (6 adults, 2 toddlers, 1 baby) and had numerous issues including lifts breaking trapping me inside and ants infesting a 4th storey bedroom. The staff are rude and obnoxous and did not care let alone want to help. One to avoid based purely on their staff, not a real taste of majorcan hospitality.

title: Really good family holiday
review: First of all we would like to thank you for taking the time to send us your comments and queries. It is very important to us as it improves the service level of our hotel.Now let me apologise that you were not given the holiday you expected. Our aim here in Viva is to ensure that your holiday is an extremely happy one. We pride ourselves in having many returning, satisfied customers. When we do have a complaint we treat all correspondence seriously.  I’ll hope next time you can come at the reception and ask for me to solve any problem that you have, because in our complex there are eight different types of room, and we want that our guests enjoy their holidays.          I hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you again to Hotels Viva.

title: Great family holiday!
review: We are a family of 4 (2 children aged 8 & 10) and stayed in a privilege apartment for 11 nights. We did not go all-inclusive, preferring to eat breakfast and a light lunch in the apartment and go to alcudia or port alcudia for dinner in a nice restaurant. Tried the breakfast on a few mornings but at €50 for the 4 of us it wasn't good value for money.   Positives: All staff were helpful and competent. Our apartment had a nice big garden with a hammock. Close to children's clubs and pools. Food was good. Rooms were clean. Kids loved the children's club. Apartment cleaned and tidied well every day and at a time we decided. Close to the beach (5 min walk) and good restaurants. Family oriented.  Negatives: No good water slides for older kids. Apartment was small for the price. No…

title: Very family orientated hotel
review: Jus back from ten days self-catering. On arrival was impressed with hotel. Booked a premium studio apartment and I emailed hotel requested lower floor as had 2 year old. I understand this is not always possible however was given key and was helped to room. It was on 5th floor and at very end of long corridor. I immediately went to reception and requested lower floor unhelpful female receptionist said this was not possible as only had another one studio available  on 4th floor i asked to be move then she changed  her mind said this was not available. I was disappointed tho couldnt  be bothered arguing. Room was nice very modern cleaned daily though still felt slightly dirty walls had some stains, had good air on and nice enough view. We were self catering though food looked great…

title: Viva :)
review: My daughter and her husband booked this hotel for themselves, their 2 sons aged 4 and 17 months, and ourselves. It was not the hotel to visit without children as it was full of them! The waiters were excellent being able to carry trays and avoid scampering children at the same time! Reception staff spoke excellent English and helpful. The whole place was very clean. The rooms a good size and the air con worked well. We really appreciated the fridge. I thought hire of the safe rather expensive at 16.50 euros for a week, but at least it was large enough to contain all that we and rest of my family had. My only complaint about the room was no maid service on 2 days a week. It is many years since I have stayed in accommodation without 7 day service. We stayed B&B. the breakfast was…

title: 3rd time back and still a good hotel
review: We stayed at the viva tropic again 27th May to 6th June which was partly over the kids holidays, the hotel was quite busy. We stayed self catering with our 6 year old son. Overall we had another great stay, the hotel offers everything we look for in a hotel, nice rooms, good food at the pool restaurant, kids club, a 5 minute walk to the beach and a great kids pool. A couple of things that have begun to dissatisfied myself and my partner, you cannot book at the time of booking a pool view room this has to be done on arrival. For the last 3 stays my partner has emailed and telephoned the hotel to see if he can book a pool view room directly with them and pay over the phone but they wont accept this, they say you can only do it on arrival and it will depend on what rooms are left.…

title: Great location, but the hotel needs managing better.
review: I don't complain at all but feel need to share this....We have just returned from what was supposed to be a 7 night stay at the Viva Tropic, we actually only stayed 5 as when we arrived we were told they had over booked, we arrived at 10.30 at night to be told this news,we had a very tired 9 year old, we were told we could stay at another hotel in the viva chain for one night and return to a studio or 2 nights and be upgraded to a garden room. We chose the 2 nights, were taxied to the a hotel that was in an area we didn't know and had not a lot around it. We couldn't unpack and were very frustrated. Apparently we were chosen as it had less impact on us. We arrived back at the viva tropic as advised at 10.00 two days after our holiday started to be told they didn't have a room…

title: Our best holiday ever!
review: I went to the Viva Tropic with my brother, Mum and Dad from 1st to 11th August 2013.  We went because we'd looked round last year and it looked good.  The apartments are nice.  They have a television opposite a settee in the living room.  The settee sleeps one person on the top and one person on a bed pulled out from underneath.  For an extra 200 euros for 10 days we had a private garden with chairs and an umbrella right by the pool. For an extra 800 euros for 10 days you can get an apartment at the top of the hotel with a Jacuzzi and other excitements.  In the hotel, there are three god pols. There is a pol with a pirate ship and eight slides for younger children.  There is a pool for any age that starts shallow and gets deeper. Lastly, there is a top pol that has very shallow…

title: This is only my opinion, but it is the correct one
review: Me and my family has been two years in a row before this one on VIVA PALMA NOVA, we were looking forward have a really good family holiday again. The hotel was exactly the same as VIVA PALMA NOVA. But one thing stood out, I know, I am also a family with a kid, but this is absolutely crazy! Even the middle pool was occupied with children all day. Again, this ia family hotel and the SHOULD be children, but again, this was crazy. The food is very average, I am happy that I did not go for all inclusive. The rule they have when it comes to the fact that it is not allowed to reserver the sun beds for more than 40 minutes are not controlled, one day of the whole week the staff removed some the towels.

title: Fantastic Hotel, Highly recommended
review: We stayed in August 2013 family of 4 (kids aged 7 & 11yrs). We couldn't recommend this hotel enough. You really couldn't ask for more. It had everything for all ages, a small pool with slides for young kids (away from the normal pools so you didn't have screaming kids if you didn't want it). Over 18's only pool with double sunbeds, the main pools had a deep pool & a shallow pool. Plenty of sunbeds which did say you couldn't reserve although when we were there people did everyday and no-one did anything about it. There was daily entertainment in the pool aerobics half an hour everyday (but if you didn't want it it wasn't loud and in your face), they did a kids pool game everyday i.e volleyball. Again this only used a small area of the pool and didn't matter if you didn't want it.…

title: Just as good, second time round!!!
review: My family and I have just returned from another fantastic ten day stay at the Viva Tropic Hotel, in Port d'Alcudia.    I have to agree with most of the reviews on here.  Beautiful surrounding/grounds, great pools (Pirate "Splash" Pool, over 18's pool and the main double central pool) and fantastic rooms.  This year, we upgraded to the Garden Room, following on from being at the Royal Terrace last year and were not disappointed.  The garden was to the rear of the apartment, with a gate leading onto the pool area.  It gave us privacy to chill out, whilst being amongst all of the action!!!  All of the apartments are equipped with everything you would need if going self catering.  We tend to do this, as we prefer to get "out and about" in the resort and like to sample what the many…

title: Fantastic family all inclusive
review: Just returned back from viva tropic ...superb hotel if travelling with children ...we stayed all inclusive and could not fault the food ...the hotel is spotless and staff are always cleaning....if I had one negative it is that the grounds seemed a bit cramped every inch of space was used ..where one thing stopped another one started ...but it is what it is and you can't change the grounds etc ...may have felt more cramped because it was August ...overall we had a fab holiday and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it ...we would definitely consider viva hotels again !!!!

title: Fantastic family friendly holiday
review: We have just come back from a 9 night all inclusive holiday at the Viva Tropic and have had a fantastic holiday. I have never been to an all inclusive hotel and was quite dubious but this hotel has totally changed my opinion. The food was excellent; there was a buffet in the morning and evening and an extensive menu served at the bar at lunchtimes. All the food was of excellent quality and all of our family were satisfied from my elderly parents to my young daughter. Our room was very clean and had good air conditioning (which we needed due to the heat!) and was cleaned regularly, We were upgraded for the last 2 days of our holiday to the Royal Terrace rooms which had a Jacuzzi and amazing views over the mountains and the sea. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially…

title: Great hotel
review: Just returned from the viva tropic and can honestly not fault the hotel. Room was superb, got a garden view, not hassled from reception as some guests have mentioned. The grounds were lovely and well maintained. The pools were good, we spent most of our time at the splash pool as we were a family of 3 with a 7 year old and she loved the slides and made lots of friends.  We ate at the pool bar a few lunchtimes and the quality of food and choice was good. We were self catering so were out most nights when the entertainment was on but we did catch the "rock of all ages" show which was good. The location of the hotel was brilliant, beach is a short stroll away and when you walk down to the harbour there are loads of shops and restaurants. We would recommend the beach restaurant and…

title: Fantastic family Holiday
review: Just back from a 10 night all inclusive family holiday with my 9 year old daughter at the viva tropic,Alcudia. The hotel was very clean and had a relaxed atmosphere.Staff were very friendly and helpful, Excellent choice of food at all meal times whether buffet or table service and for those eating out there is loads of restaurants just a short walk away. We had no problems getting a sun lounger near the pool of which there were a few to choose from. Kids club was great with different activities like T-shirt painting, pony riding and pool games. Shops were just a short walk away and there was a supermarket within the hotel with plenty of choice. The beach was a 5 minute walk away and was amazing soft white sand.

title: Fantastic all-inclusive
review: The hotel is an apartment hotel that allows you to choose to cook your own food, go outside the complex, or eat at the hotel. The pool area is super nice, childrens pool a hit! Unfortunately, the pools were not heated so the water was a bit cold, warmer to swim in the sea.  Dinner buffet was heavenly! We were there for a week all-inclusive and we have nothing to complain about in terms of food and beverages. New buffet theme every night. Children activity with the bear Bufo was ok, we went with a three year old, she was probably a bit too young, the older kids there liked it.  The weather was terrible! Mallorca in may is a no no.. ;)

title: Great holiday for young families
review: Just returned from 10 days holiday at Viva Tropic, family of 4 (mum, dad, 15 and 11 year old) The hotel is lovely, very clean and well maintained by an army of cleaners! On arrival we were advised that guests are given rooms that look onto road as standard, however we could pay extra 10 euros per night for a pool view. We chose pool view as although not  busy  by any means the road view was dreary and did not get any sun. Loads of entertainment advertised daily for 4 separate age ranges, under 8, 8-12, 13-17 and adult.The entertainment staff are really good, especially with young children.No pressure to take part in any activity, however sometimes this meant that the events were cancelled (both my children found events didn't take place because not enough people turned up to…

title: **excellent hotel**
review: Just returned from this hotel and nothing but great things to say about it, Great welcome from all staff, the room was very modern and was spotless, the whole set-up of the hotel is catered for family`s and they will do anything to help you have a great holiday, we went all inclusive and the restaurant and food was second to none and there was something to choose for everyone, all children are entertained all day and they have some great shows for all at night, I would love to go back here again and vowed to do so as we was gutted to leave.

title: We love viva!
review: Always clean and spotless.  When entertainment team there always something going on fitness related.  Not too pushy with it.  Great team that work there, many staff been there for our 3 visits over 3 years. Very short walk to beach. Bike hire good.  All inclusive good.

title: Great hotel, great location
review: We have just returned from ten nights a viva tropic, myself, partner our two children (ages 2 and 7) and my parents. The hotel was lovely, all the staff were really friendly and did anything to help, including all the lovely waiters who are there most of the day yet still always happy to help. The girls who run the entertainment were all lovely and there were loads of activities for the kids.  The hotel is very clean and rooms were cleaned nearly every day we were there, the hotel has a supermarket adjoining if you need anything. We went all inclusive and the food was great, always lots of choice and different theme every nite.  The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the beach.  We will be returning to the viva tropic again as we all enjoyed it so much.

title: Great holiday!
review: Just back from 10 days at the Viva Tropic with my boyfriend. We're both 20 and were not looking for a mad crazy holiday just a relaxing one. It was the perfect hotel for that. We stayed in a studio in block 1 on the first floor. A lovely modern room with hob, kettle and toaster for making breakfast and lunch. The balcony only had sun in the evening time but that didn't bother us much as we spent all our time at the pool. The adult pool was lovely but preferred the sun loungers at the other pool as opposed to the flat Balinese beds. The hotel was full of families and kids but it didn't annoy us that much. We could still relax at the huge pool area. The food at the pool bar was quite expensive and not really that nice. Drinks were lovely and cheap enough. The hotel is just 2 mins…

title: Viva Tropic Family Stay June 2013
review: £ little one and 4 Adults 2 Appartments in the Viva Tropic, Good Facilities for the Kids, Pretty Good Entertainment, different shows each night from different entertainers rather than the same faces, really helpful staff and good standard of food.  If we had got the ajoining rooms we asked for then this wouldhave been 5 star but we were on separate floors which was OK but not what we asked for. There is a good play pool with a Pirate ship for the kids and a quiet pool for adults only with those devan beds which is good as well as the main pool.

title: Bouncing castle accident
review: This is the second time I have stayed at viva tropic it's a great hotel and fantastic for kids. We had a great holiday till my little six year old niece fell of the bouncing castle and split her head open she fell on concrete that went round the edge of the play area luckly i was right ther watching her as there was no life guard or any staff around to help me . I waited 45 mins for a doctor to come then he cleaned the wound and phoned for a ambulance 4 stitches to the back of her head I ask them to numb her but they did not poor little thing. It ruined our holiday. Very traumatic and upsetting experience . Could of been prevented if the bouncing castle was in a safer place.

title: Second time round...brilliant holiday yet again!
review: Dear guest, Let me start by thanking you for taking time to give us your feedback. We are constantly trying to improve our service here at Hotels Viva and your comments and queries help us in this matter. It was a shame that this accident happened because all the surroundings from the playground area are covered with rubber. As soon as you told us about the accident we called the medical service and you have spoken in my office with them and have accepted to wait them. We have given the medical check in the hotel for free and we offered  you to pay the transport to the hospital and we were constantly looking for you and your family to know if you enjoyed the rest two days of your holidays.  I’ll hope that this attention was good enough for you and We hope in the future to welcome you again in Hotels Viva, and allow us the opportunity to give you the holiday experience you desire.

title: Superb hotel and facilities
review: We stayed here for the last 2 weeks in June with our two children aged 10 and 7. Having stayed here 2 years  ago the kids have been pestering us to go back and we were not disappointed. The entertainment team led by the wonderful Kaisa are what makes this hotel the perfect family holiday destination. Body Balance and Aqua Aerobics for the Mums each day, football, archery etc for the Dads meant we all had something to do. The children's programme ran from 10-5pm daily and due the excellent set up the kids could dip in and out of various activities. The night time entertainment was excellent resulting in very few meals eaten off site! If you do get out try Trattoria down in Alcudia port is very good and not expensive. Maite & Pep in Reception were very efficient and most helpful…

title: viva tropic family holiday
review: Our experience at this hotel was absolutley fantastic, we were enjoying ourselves so much we actually extended our holiday from 7 days to 9 days while we were there! The staff were very friendly and helpful at the reception desk, the girls and one lad who did the entertainment for the children were fab, our children really enjoyed the disco every night with them, the tshirt painting, football, facepainting etc. the pools were clean and ideal for all families and couples of all ages. \the hotel is situated very near to the beach and shops. we will definatley be returning again next year!

title: family only hotel
review: Firstly this hotel is created for families with children, I thought it looked suitable for myself and a friend for a relaxing break. I felt because we looked young (even though am late 20s) with no children we were overlooked, at front desk the staff were very rude to us, I only asked the older man on at night how long would it take to get to the aeropuerto (I had car rental), and he was very rude, no hospitality but when a family came up they were treated with respect, also the bar man at the pool bar was very rude to myself and nice to other guests, not very professional. Not what I expected for a 4 star hotel and paying nearly a grand including upgraded garden view (of a tree). The hotel is in a good location however close to the town centre, and the small pool area for 18+…

title: Fantastic Family Holiday
review: First of all I would like to thank you for taking the time to send us your comments and queries. It is very important to us as it improves the service level of our hotel.  Now let me apologise that you were not given the service that you expected. Our aim here in Hotels Viva is to ensure that your holiday is perfect. If you would  come to the reception and ask for hotel manager ,i would be very happy to help you about these incidents. I am going to inform about these to all the departments involved and ensure that this is not going to happen again.   I hope that we will have the opportunity to welcome you again to Hotels Viva. We pride ourselves in having many returning, satisfied customers. When we do have a complaint we treat all correspondence seriously.    Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: "Viva. Celebrate your holidays. Viva." - The hotel song as cheap and cheerful as our stay!
review: Our first family holiday away with our 4 year old son and it was amazing! We stayed in a studio Room 1307 which overlooked the park area (great as not overlooked). Quiet and reasonable view. Room very clean and modern with a fantastic walk-in power shower! Room had extremely large double bed and sofa bed to accommodate 3 of us - comfy and spacious. Went self catering - ate most lunchtimes in hotel (good food) and most nights at the Brunel Inn (great food at great prices; ideal for the kids). Excellent entertainment for kids (daytime and evenings), everything from T-shirt painting, Hama beading to an array of sports/games. Entertainment staff were brilliant and variety/quality of shows excellent for adults/kids alike. Beach 5 mins walk away (tip: beach/sea not great near…

title: Fantastic Family Holiday
review: After much deliberation on where to go on our limited budget, we finally settled on Viva Tropic based on previous reviews. As with anywhere you hope that the place wasn't rated by some monkeys hired by the hotel to bump it up the rankings. Now, this was our first gander abroad together on a 'proper holiday' so naturally we wanted a place where we weren't in the middle of nowhere and had a nice beach within walking distance in case the boyfriend wanted to seek solace from his girlfriend who is, from time to time, somewhat challenged in the rational-emotion department. Thankfully, this was not a feature we needed in the end. However the beach served its standard purpose well, nice white sand to wriggle your toes in etc. There were lots of loungers you could hire and in peak season…

title: 4 Star Facilities & Location, 2 Star Service
review: Spent 11 nights at the Viva Tropic in June with my wife and 2 kids (aged 2 & 5) and would have to sya was somewhat disappointed by what I got for the money it cost.  The property itself is in excellent condition, certainly looks much better than the Viva Sunrise which we dropped into to have a look. We had a 1 bed “premium” apartment which was probably the best hotel room we’ve ever had on holidays in Spain. It has a large sitting room / kitchenette with a good balcony and a nice large flat screen TV. The bathroom was large with a walk in shower and the bedroom consisted of 2 double beds pushed together, which was very comfortable. The basin in the bathroom had a huge spider web like crack in it which looked terrible but wasn’t a huge inconvenience. The smaller shower head…

title: Well worth its 4 stars
review: Stayed here last week in May, with family consisting of 2 kids aged 10 and 5. Hotel is immaculately kept. Grounds and all areas are constantly tended to. Not that it should put anybody off, but English seem to be the minority nationality here. Rooms are well decorated, but are a slight squeeze, when 2 adults and 2 kids occupy it. The splash pool area is fantastic, but added to this, there is a small park adjoining, this allowing the kids to jump from one to the other, without you having to up sticks and move. Even though the hotel literature states you should not reserve sunbeds, you tend to have to around the splash pool area, as there is only around 50 or so beds. With this is mind, follow the motto or " If you cant beet them , join them. " Get your place early, or you will be…

title: Grat place for families
review: Staying with grandchildren and my daughter and partner.The room was very good,cleaning efficient and the faclilities including pools were great for kids as were the activities.location to get around town great. The down factor is it is noisy with kids,entertainment full on. A quiet getaway no but a great fun place for kids and families yes. Grandparents in recovery mode

title: A bit of a dump - not as good as Viva Menorca
review: Having previously stayed at Viva Menorca which we enjoyed thoroughly, we felt that it was going to be a safe bet stopping at the Viva Tropic, which seemed to have the best feedback of the several Majorca Viva's.   We were wrong.   Whilst the main selling point is the "Pirate ship pool" for the children, it was much smaller than the Menorcan one, and the water was cold as ice.   Seriously it was so cold it was almost empty and obviously not heated. The poolside array of sun loungers was very limited. I'd say there about 18 sun loungers and they were all occupied and if your child wanted to brave the cold, then you had to stand as an onlooker, not a hotel guest enjoying their break.   Next to this area was a plastic climbing frame and bouncy castle. Again, this is another…

title: Perry/Brentwood
review: First of all we would like to thank you for taking the time to send us your comments and queries. It is very important to us as it improves the service level of our hotel. Now let me apologize that you were not given the holiday you expected. Our aim here in Viva is to ensure that your holiday is an extremely happy one. We pride ourselves in having many returning, satisfied customers. When we do have a complaint we treat all correspondence seriously. The main problem that you comment about the mosquitos is the changing weather. Now everything is perfect,very good weather and no rain and there are no mosquitos   About the comment of the utensils it was a shame that you didn’t tell us anything, because as soon as we know we can notify to the head-cleaner to check it and to solve that. I have informed to all the responsible of the different departments of all that your comments.   I’ll hope next time you can come at the reception and ask for me to solve any problem that you have because we want that our guests enjoy their holidays.          I hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you again to Hotels Viva.

title: Family holiday
review: Our family of four including two boys aged 2 and a half and five years stayed here for one week the first week of May.  For the last three years we have stayed at Viva Sunrise.  Decided to book Tropic for a change. It was well worth the extra money paid.  The indoor pool was heated and was used if the weather was a little over cast. The playground is much better equipped than the tropic hotel. There is a lovely adult pool area with sun loungers which we would take turns using.  The food was excellent and a much better quality than a lot of the restaurants in the area. The staff were lovely and seemed much friendlier than it sister hotel sunrise.  We found problems in the bar of sunrise where the bar staff were very slow to serve the all inclusive guests, even ignoring us which…

title: Decent hotel
review: Stayed for 3 nights with my family (2 daughters 4&6).  The hotel has a good location just 5 mins walk from the beach, a very nice foyer and the welcome was sincere.  We upgraded to the pool view rooms (10 Euro per day I think) which was a bonus as we got the late afternoon/evening sun and since the weather had been partly cloudy this was welcomed!  The room was clean and tidy and other than a few loose laminate floorboards, nicely furnished.  The majority of guests were all inclusive but we were room only and had a room with kitchenette which i guess is available throughout.  A very nice bathroom but with a few hairs from other people still lurking!    The swimming pools were a real bonus as they are 4 to choose from.  That said we spent 90% of our time at the splash pool which…

title: Wonderful Viva
review: Really enjoyed my recent stay in the Viva Tropic. The staff from those on reception to the waiters at the bar and the cleaners were all friendly and helpful.  When we checked in we were given and took the opportunity to upgrade to a pool view room for an extra 10 euros per night. The original room we were offered overlooked the street at the front of the hotel so we didn't mind paying the extra.  The room itself although a little small for 3 adults had everything required. The bed was the best I have ever slept in whilst abroad and rather than being the usual twin beds was at least a large king size. The shower was a really good walk in size with a monsoon shower head and there was always plenty of hot water. The kitchen though small was well equipped and even had washing up…

title: perfect
review: This hotel was perfect, we decided to join my daughters family on holiday and she booked us into the hotel as they were booked there, we were absolutely impressed and couldn't find anything but good things to say about it, the receptionists were helpful, food delicious and rooms clean and very comfy and well designed including some self catering facilities and a fridge, which is unusual to find in a hotel of this high standard, we would definitely return again and have to say we were very impressed, and it was better than we could have ever expected.   Breakfast selection was bigger than anything we have ever set eyes on, and the lunchtime food was lovely, they had a few pools, and children's play areas which my granddaughter loved!  I would be surprised if any hotel in the area…

title: Another great stay with Viva Hotels..... i wouldn't stay with any other hotel.
review: We have stayed the last two years at the Viva Sunrise based about twenty minutes walk from the port, this year all the Royal Terrace apartments were booked at the sunrise, so we decided to try the Viva Tropic, which is based in the port.   Viva Hotels have a range of different rooms, but we always opt for the Royal Apartments, these come with a larger balcony, complete with a dining table and chairs, relaxing sofa area, loungers a hammock and a Jacuzzi. The Royal Apartments are what makes this hotel 4 star.  Although we never stay all inclusive in hotels we did go and look at the buffet breakfast, and oh my word, I honestly can say even in Five star London Hotels I have never seen such a massive collection of breakfast, every fruit you could imagine, cold meats, cooked breakfast…

title: Another Great Stay
review: Just back from another great stay in the Viva Tropic with extended family.On arrival even though the hotel was very busy we were allocated adjoining rooms which was a great help.Rooms have been upgraded since last season new beds and brighter decor .As always staff are very helpful at all times and cleaning staff do a great job maintaining high standards throughout

title: Clean, but not 4 stars
review: Came to Majorca, Porto d'Alcudia to visit a friend, spent 5 nights at this hotel. The staff at reception and the cleaning lady that took care of my room, where all very nice and helpful.   The waiters at the breakfast and the bar was just noway near the quality and service-minded that I expect of a 4 star hotel.. not even a Spanish 4 star hotel.  The walls between the rooms was just thicker than paper, and I could hear the couple next door having a conversation, using the bathroom and toilet being flushed.  The pools outdoors looked ok, but I did not use them due to poor weather. The one indoor was heated and had a lifeguard in the room.  Use the SPA centre, and was very pleased with the level of quality and professionalism shown there.  Quality of break-feast was good, but the…

title: fantastic hotel
review: my partner decided to suprise me with a 5 day break to spain and booked this hotel we arrived at 3am on the sunday morning hotel was spotless and the reception staff were very helpful and pleasent considering the time in the morning we had room 2203 walked in and wow what can i say had a large living area beautiful bedroom and bathroom was lovely with all added little extras. we did not have the best weather so we made use of the indoor pool with the jaccuzzis and steam room and sauna room .We travelled without my 8 year old son but we would not hesitate on booking a trip here again with him plenty of things to do for children.id give this hotel 5* thank you viva tropic for making our anniversary special.

title: good clean hotel,good spot.
review: Stayed at this hotel 21st April for one week. We had a room main building forth floor overlooking pool. The hotel was spotless. We were self catering,not a lot of crockery in the very small kitchen,but enough to make breakfast,or snack at lunchtime. Plenty of places to have an evening meal at the port which was only five minutes walk away. The hotel has an indoor pool,and a gym which my husband used most days. There is also an adult pool which is very nice. We had a problem with one of the lights in our room and the maintaince guy was up right away to sort it out. Staff always very pleasant. The only thing was the maids are very noisy early in the morning when they are getting ready to service the rooms although they done an excellent job at keeping the room clean. We had two…

title: Excellent, but it wasn't fully open yet.
review: We stayed here 17th April to 21st April for a short break. Travelling was myself and my partner, 13 year son and 5 year old daughter. On arrival which was in the early hours of the morning we were very impressed with the welcome, efficiency and the general service we received. Check in complete we went up to our room which was very easy to find and we had been upgraded for free to a room with a pool view.  The room was clean and tidy with usual basic kitchen, sofa with pull out bed underneath and a separate bedroom and shower room. The bathroom was particularly clean and inviting with a lovely large walking shower and the water pressure was good. My daughter slept on the pull out bed and I would say anyone any older than her would have been uncomfortable, especially if it was…

title: PLEASANT HOTEL IN GOOD LOCATION
review: This really is a lovely hotel.  The staff in the hotel and shop are very helpful.  The rooms are clean and the shower is lovely and big.  The swimming pools are well kept.  It is located approx 100m from the beautiful beach of Port D'Alcudia.  One downside is that they have located the over 18's relaxation pool right next door to the childrens swimming pool area.  If you thought you would use it to relax then forget it because every 20 minutes the bucket on the pirate ship fills with water and splashes into the pool.  There is certainly no peace and quiet from kids screaming and enjoying themselves.  The sun loungers are uncomfortable for any length of time as they have no additional mattress.  The other downside for us was that we were located in the main hotel next to the…

title: Great location, fantastic refurbished rooms
review: Just a 5 min walk from town and beach and beautiful port. Bustling town with restaurants and plenty to see.  Building looks old from outside but beautifully refurbished inside.
