Very comfortable, spotless clean rooms. We booked the premium ones, lovely inside, decent balconies, beautiful bathroom, flat screen TV , kettle and toaster in kitchen.  Nicer rooms with private decks and furniture are available at extra cost, but pool area is well maintained, with lovely restaurant and bar surrounding. Plenty of decent adjustable chairs and parasols for sun lounging, nice green areas adjacent for children. There is also a premium pool area we didn't use.  Large indoor restaurant and bar also. I would highly recommend this hotel, great value for what you get, not your normal package…

title: Good overall experience.
review: This large complex is well located 200 yards from the beach and several nice restaurants. We opted out of all-inclusive as we like to travel around, prefer to be served at meals, and like to eat in different towns and restaurants. The food here though is good value at 16 euros for the evening buffet. The main disappointment was the pool temperatures. There are lovely pools here both outdoor and an indoor spa, but both were too cold for most people to enjoy!

title: Well done viva tropic!!!
review: We stayed for a week in the Easter half term in the viva tropic and we thought it was amazing. We stayed with self catering cuz all inclusive is 50euro a day. If you wanna stay here you need to have some money. We thought that only 1week isn't enough to stay as you have 6 pools including an indoor spa children's pirate ship, two main pools 18 and over relax area and a little relax pool. There's also a supermarket which is a bit overpriced like lollies 50c! We still had to use it though. Reception is lovely decorations lovely lamps and each night there's some entertainment on well not all nights sometimes just mini disco but we watched 2 shows within our time. Viva tropic is close to the beach about 2mins then you have the shops really near by and no frills excursions direct…

title: Perfect base for cycling
review: My hubby spent a week in this hotel as part of an organised cycling training camp with Sport Active. Location was perfect and the choice at breakfast and more especially at the buffet dinner was absolutely brilliant.  Staff were very friendly and the room had everything we needed. The only issue was the mattress wasn't very comfortable, and after a long day cycling that was a disappointment!

title: Relaxing, high-quality experience in beautiful location
review: My family and I had a wonderful stay at Viva Tropic - we were a party of 6 with very different needs: 2 young children (4 and 7 years old), couple, grandmother with limited mobility and retired uncle.  The landscaping of the hotel meant that there were very few steps so my mother-in-law could relax once she got her bearings. Retired uncle loved the all-inclusive bar and restaurant and liked to get away to the nearby beach when he needed a break. White sand and gentle waves in Alcudia were out of this world, the beach has elegant properties overlooking the sand and feels sophisticated.   My children loved the swimming pools and made new friends at the well-equipped playground every day. They are very fussy eaters and we were able to find something they liked every day.  The rooms…

title: Stunning Hotel!
review: Me and my partner stayed here for 3 nights and didn't want to leave! It really exceeded all our expectations. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a self catering studio it was really clean, modern and had a plasma in which a view channels could be viewed in english. The spa and adult chill out room were amazing. We did travel out of season in March, and i can understand the annoyance of the noisy kids pool next to the adult one. With it being mainly couples and cyclists at the tim ewe didn't have that problem.  Viva Tropic is very close to shops, restaurants and bars with the strip literally round the corner. The ports and beach are really close also and its definitely worth a walk on a nice day.  The only bad thing i have to say is the food is overpriced and the quality is average…

title: Great time away
review: We stayed in a self catering apartment because we have a 9month old boy and we wanted flexibility when feeding  the apartment was clean the only issue we had was the shower was a nightmare for overflowing as the pressure was so strong but we just turned it down and it didn't flood. the apartment has cooker and toaster and all the things you need to cook. we done breakfast in but eat out most nights  the hotel is about a 6 min walk from the beach and the beach is in a bay and when the sun comes out it takes your breath away, I really enjoyed it as it was very clean and lovely to walk along or sunbath plus it was very close to us  I am sure if anyone went here they could pick faults but all in all you would have a great time I am sure

title: Disappointing lack of Kids club
review: We Returned to Viva Tropic after giving it a 5* review last year. We travelled for Easter break each time. We arrived late (10.45PM) due to a delayed flight and I was surprise to find everything closed apart from reception - no bar, food or entertainment. The following morning we looked for the kids club (like in 2012) to find it wasn't going to be on 'til mid-April and there would be no entertainment either. A girl did arrive for the Easter weekend and she was great to be fair, but left after weekend. We had recommended the hotel to our friends who holidayed with us, and they were disappointed also - at least we had two families of children who entertained one another.  The hotel was not quiet so they should have organised something.  Other than that the hotel has a good…

title: Great location
review: Let me start by thanking you for taking time to give us your feedback. We are constantly trying to improve our service here at Hotels Viva and your comments and queries helps us in this matter.  It is very disappointing that your holiday did not meet your expectations and we send our apologies. We pride ourselves in having very high standards and strive to give our guests a wonderful holiday experience.  We hope in the future to welcome you again in Hotels Viva, and allow us the opportunity to give you the holiday experience you desire.

title: Nice cycling appartment
review: Booked a appartment for me and 3 mates at the Hotel Viva Tropic in a self catering appartment for a week of cycling. The room was not overly spacious but provided a great base to go out biking. It had all the amenities required for a stay inc. microwave, hob, fridge. etc and was cleaned regularly.  The only downside was that it was a little noisy late at night especially as we were in bed early up for the cycling.  We didnt eat there as we were self catering and ate in town.  It was very quiet and if it weren't for the cyclists the resort would have been dead

title: Highly recommend!
review: We travelled here for 1 week over Easter as a family of 9. As requested  via booking, our rooms were on the first floor a couple of doors apart which was helpful. The floor is divided into two corridors with a central glass area and one of our rooms was at the start of the second hallway so that was slighty disappointing. Because of this you are close to the lift and there can be soe noise as everyone goes past to get to them. As a premium apt you get one bedroom and then a bed settee which converts to a pull out bed , so one child is on the upper sofa and one on ground, again not ideal if you have adults, get a two bedroom apt.  The rooms are well equipped with glasses, two hobs rings, saucepans etc though as were half board we didnt need this. It is quite small and im glad i…

title: Unfortunately disappointed
review: Stayed here for Easter (11 nights) s/c. Initially impressions were good and we were pleased to have chosen another Viva branded hotel (last year viva c'an picafort A/I).  1 bed apartments are small but functional.  kids are in the lounge/kitchen on a sofa with a pull out trundle bed. The kitchen is well equipped an the bathroom is well stocked with towels.  The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the stunning beach and port that has many restaurants to choose from and the usual holiday shops to peruse. There is also a playground on the beach for the children.  The hotel has a good kids pirate pool and the larger pools are a suitable depth for our 7 year old so she's happy.  The sunbed availability is good if that's important to you.  There is waiter service to the table, expect a long…

title: Very good value
review: Dear guest, Let me start by thanking you for taking time to give us your feedback. We are constantly trying to improve our service here at Hotels Viva and your comments and queries helps us in this matter.  It is very disappointing that your holiday did not meet your expectations and we send our apologies. We pride ourselves in having very high standards and strive to give our guests a wonderful holiday experience.  We hope in the future to welcome you again in Hotels Viva, and allow us the opportunity to give you the holiday experience you desire.

title: Three times and still as good as the first time
review: We stayed in a studio, but only self catered for breakfasts. However we had a 2 ring hob, microwave, kettle & toaster. The room was spacious & had a good shower (a must for me). the hotel arranged a hire car for us at a very competitive rate. The staff friendly. The hotel has an indoor pool, which we had to ourselves ( february) when we used it. We got the room at a very reasonable rate, and were pleasantly suprised at the quality of the hotel. Would definitely stay here gin

title: My second home
review: Been to Viva Tropic 7 times now and going back again this year! The hotel is amazing, with a kids pool complete with pirate ship, the main big pool and a relax pool for over 18's. There is lots of activities for everyone to do during the day. The entertianment team every year are always so nice and friendly. Every evening there is a show put on by Viva's Flying Team. The hotel is in a great location, only 2 minutes from the beach, restaraunts, shops and supermarket. Alcudia old town, the port and Hydropark (waterpark) are about 10 minutes walk from the hotel, and Alcanada is about half an hours walk which is deffinetly a place you should take a visit. The rooms are always nice and clean and are of a decent size. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: A very nice hotel
review: Stayed here this winter (feb 13), and I really enjoyed it. Staff is very friendly, and its close to the beach, and the center of port d´alcudia.  It has a large pool area with a playground/pirate ship, and spa with sauna.

title: Does what it says on the box
review: I am here as part of a group on a seven day cycling holiday mid-Fenruary - and not to stay in the hotel or spend all day in the hotel grounds, e.g. lounging by the pool. So not a typical family summer holiday and my comments must be interpreted in this light.  I've found the hotel to be functional, clean and located fairly close to the beach. I could imagine that families will enjoy it, but certainly not people who are on a romantic holiday.   As for the cycling - it is world class in Majorca. The hotel offers great rental bikes and a bike service/rental centre is attached to the hotel. Alcudia is central to much of the best cycling that the island has to offer (Team Sky is staying just around the corner.)  Free wi-fi all over the hotel is brilliant. The staff are friendly and…

title: Deadly hotel
review: Amazing amenities and great for kids  I would highly recommend.  stunning layout and   great location to beach.  The pools are excellent and the staff are lovely the evening entertainment is great and does not exclude the children.

title: I Really Liked It
review: Great place for families with kids . great food .The staff were just ok though but will return next year hopefully. the kids club was good and the pirate pool a fab touch The area is very close to a long and sandt beach which is very safe with good amenaties

title: Clean & good location
review: We booked in for a 7 day stay self catering we were on the first floor above supermarket. When we went to bed we could hear a pumping noise every 30 seconds may have been something to do with the fridges. The next morning we asked to be moved they offered to move us to the room next door not really going to erase the problem so we had to put up with it for the week.     The location was good for access to the beach, shops and restaurants, but there wasn't much entertainment about, probably the time of year, we did find a bar around the corner Brunels Bar it served nice food and drinks reasonably priced with Sky Sports on every night. Entertainment in hotel was on each night for an hour but not the best acts. Everthing was shutting down during the week don't think we'll be going…

title: A fantastic holiday
review: Just came back from Viva Tropic hotel and i must say what a fantastic hotel it is, we stayed in the Royal Terrace which was lovely. Our kids loved it, plenty of room for them to run around and it also had a jacuzzi which they loved. Food there was really nice and was decently priced. The staff were very friendly and made you feel very welcome. Hotel had all amenities needed, shop was a bit over priced but we just went down to the local spar if we needed anything which was only 2mins down the road and much better priced. Entertainment was really good, the kids loved the disco. The splash pool was fantastic our 5 yr old son and 2 yr old daughter loved it, the pirate ship they thought was great. The only thing that I would say would improve this hotel would to have the pool heated…

title: Lovely holiday
review: Just back fromViva Tropic. Very family friendly hotel but also OK for couples. My husband and I went S/C and found lots of lovely places to eat nearby, especially loved the restaurants on the beach. Hotel is very well looked after, rooms have everything you need, we upgraded to a garden room for 6 euros a night extra. We overlooked a park but best bit was our balcony had the sun from just after midday until sunset whereas street views only had early morning sun. The matresses were very hard but we asked at reception and we then had matress toppers which made them much more comfortable. Air con was a bit ineffective but in October it didnt really matter. Lots of things for children to do there. Adult pool was lovely, yes it is next to childrens pool but that didnt really matter…

title: Not bad .. but couples should look elsewhere
review: The Viva Tropic Hotel is in a very good location within a short walk of ample bars and restaurants (5-10 minutes walk from the main hub). It takes around 5 minutes to walk to the clean and well maintained beach.   Our room, on the fourth floor, consisted a view across the road and the surrounding hotels. You are offered an upgrade to a garden view for six euros, however we were personally happy with our balcony and we felt it provided more privacy than overlooking the garden. The rooms (except the top priced rooms) all have twin beds pushed together. There is a telephone, satellite television, air conditioning (which we felt did not work very well), a safety deposit box (at an additional charge) and good self-catering facilities (tea/coffee making facilities, microwave, two hob…

title: First impression was good.
review: When we arrived,we were very impressed with the Viva Tropic. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room was very well appointed with all we could need for a weeks SC. However the bathroom door was a sliding door affair and just slid across the doorway leaving a 10cm gap all around the door. Not very private and definitively not 4 star! The entertainment seemed to be enjoyed by everyone. I did not eat here but my wife did one night and she enjoyed her meal. Food was very nice and staff very attentive  What made me pick  this hotel was the adult only pool. This looked like an oasis of bliss in the pictures. When we got there, although is was very nice, it was right next to the children's splash pool.Not very peaceful and again not 4 star.  We needed to use the…

title: Great for families
review: Lovely spot in Port d'Alcudia. Minutes from the beach and the Port. Plus easy walk to Old Town. The hotel was lovely. 3 nice outdoor pools plus one indoor, Spa, lovely grounds and walkways. We were travelling with a baby and the hotel was very family friendly. Pretty much everyone had kids, although it would have been fine for couples too as there is an adults only pool and plenty of ways to get away from the kids if you want to!   We had a Studio apartment. Bear in mind websites don't offer you the Studio if you include an infant in your booking, however the hotel allows it so just book 2 adults and email the hotel separately informing them you are bringing an infant. We took our own equipment but they do also have travel cots for hire and buggies/highchairs for extra cost.  …

title: Great family holiday
review: We spent a week in the Viva Tropic and had a ball. Its a great family hotel with great entertainment for the kids.  My expectations of the evening entertainment wasn't that high to be honest and we were very pleasantly surprised. Great to watch the kids minidisco first and see all the very happy dancing faces, and then the tribute shows were brilliant, like a professional production.  The staff were all lovely, we had a priviledge apartment, it was basic but very clean, perfect as we spent most of the day on the beach or at the pool. the pool was lovely and the kids pool and play area was great.  we ate one night in the hotel and food was very basic, but there are lovely restaurants to eat in the area. I would definately recommend this hotel to families, if your looking for…

title: Hated it
review: Well this is out last night an I can honestly say I can't wait to get home, on arrival we was asked if we wanted to upgrade to a garden view for 6 euros extra a day we agreed as we didn't want a road view!! We was then told we had to wait half an hour for our room, when we finally got our room it was basic an our view was a little bit of green grass what we was actually viewing was a felt floor! I couldn't be bothered to go an argue about it as we would probably have to wait again! The room was clean but the bathroom wasn't, there was hair under the sink and also on the toilet as well as dust. It's Saturday night an the entertainment is boring, a man an woman singing!  The chill out pool would be lovely I it wasn't right next to the children's pool, been say there d'or a while…

title: Hotel manager having a bad day?
review: Let me start by thanking you for taking time to give us your feedback. We are constantly trying to improve our service here at Hotels Viva and your comments and queries helps us in this matter. Due to the occupation it was a shame that we can’t offer to you all the possibilities that our complex has, and you can enjoy your holidays with the room that you are expecting for. According the entertainment, we try to cover all the expectations of our guest and we have a night program with different type of shows daily.  It is very disappointing that your holiday did not meet your expectations and we send our apologies. We pride ourselves in having very high standards and strive to give our guests a wonderful holiday experience. We hope in the future to welcome you again in Hotels Viva, and allow us the opportunity to give you the holiday experience you desire.  Best Regards, Daniel Martorell Hotel Manager

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL  brill holiday.
review: Just back from what was eventually a great trip! We booked a royal terrace with jacuzzi on the balcony. As I was travelling with my mum, I emailed twice to confirm the room had twin beds. On arrival I was told no, double beds only. We were told there would be a two bedroom apartment available the next day and as far as both my mum and I recall were given the option to stay 1 night then View the other room in the morning. The 1st room had a distinct smell of damp and damp marks which I pointed out. We spent night 1 in the room which was very noisy as it was above the entertainment space but also, the jacuzzi started up at 7:30, right outside the window!! I went to reception to say yes, we'll view the 2 bed room to be told by manager Toni, too bad, it's no longer available as you…

title: Main Block
review: Having stayed in the Viva Tropic a number of times always in the studio's here are some details.Main block ground floor is reception,indoor pool,gym,sauna,supermarket expensive but handy,bar restaurant,Rooms are on floors one to five served by three lifts lots of cyclists stay here in May and use lifts to bring the bikes to there rooms even cycle down corridoors to rooms, really, I've seen it .Hotel very busy in high season for both these reasons lifts can be slow think about rooms on lower floors and use stairs,Rooms on street side get sun from early morning to mid day giving a cool shaded balcony in hot high season, Expect some noise from coaches arriving and departing with guests.Rooms with garden view which is really a public park and you will be charged a supplement for,…

title: Fantastic Hotel- first time here and will return
review: This hotel is absolutely fantastic for children, it is exeptionally clean. I am 55 and have stayed in quite a few 4 star hotels, but this is definately one of the best. I cannot find fault with anything ,the food is outstanding well presented and so much to choose from. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. As for the swimming pools and entertainment once again faultless.

title: 2nd time around Love it!
review: Just returned from the Viva Tropic this is our 2nd time visiting it in the last 12 months and its just as good as the first we stayed in the exact same room as requested in the main building with a pool view which you pay extra for, everything there for children, 4 swimming pools the kids entertainerment were great night time entertainment for the adults 5 mins fom the beach which is stunning and so safe if i was to fault anything this time around it would be the food at night time in the hotel, its expensive and slow service and comes served cold we didnt eat there that much because of that resaon we ate in the Brunel Inn which was very tastey. The bar service is still very slow i just guess some things never change. Reception staff very nice very clean hotel i would return…

title: Very European
review: Having stayed at Viva Sunrise before we decided to try the Viva Tropic this time- its a great hotel in a great location and very convenient for the port and beach.  However as previous reviewers have mentioned its geared mainly for the European market.  It's got great kids facilities including playground, trampoline and bouncy castle plus a lovely kids pool area.  The hotel has signs up saying sun beds cannot be reserved but by 9am they had all been reserved by the main pool although there were still some beds left by the children's pool.  We had a premium 1 bedroom apartment which was lovely and spacious although we were roadside and at times it could get noisy and on one Friday night we were kept up until 3am with what sounded like a nightclub.  On arrival the hotel staff take…

title: Fab holiday
review: Just returned from 11 night all inclusive stay at the Viva tropic. Our party consisted of myself and husband and our two boys aged 6 and 4.    We paid extra for pool view room and we were pleased we did this as we had a great view and could even see the stage on an evening where the entertainment was going on from our balcony.   Our room number was 3109. Room was adequate for us .. Decor perhaps a little tired but made no difference to us .. It was scrupulously clean.  Overall would definitely recommend this hotel for the following reasons. Every area of the hotel was kept immaculately clean at all times.   Extremely well staffed in every area. Facilities were excellent ... In particular the children's pool and play area is outstanding.  Also the main pool areas are really good…

title: viva tropic
review: Recently statyed in Viva Tropic for 10 nights. Brilliant apartments with great facilities. Apartments located very near to beach and port. Check out the over 18's pool - heaven!  Also check out the Brunel inn located close to hotel. Nice bar with pool table and great hosts John, Em and Jas.

title: Fantastic hotel location great!
review: We have just returned from 9 nights at the viva tropic hotel and I must say it is probably the best hotel we have been to that ticks all boxes!! We travelled as a party of 9 including children aged 12,9,3 and 8 months and it had something for everyone. We stayed in 2x premium pool view apartments (2nd floor) which were absolutely lovely although if we were being really picky, a little in the small side, but great wet room with big shower and loads of shelf space in sink area... And a 2 bed apartment on the ground floor. We had booked a 1 bed with garden, however we really wanted a 2 bed as we have 3 year old and an 8 month old, they couldn't guarantee us this until check in as we were under occupancy. I had originally asked via email if we could havd the 3 rooms near to each…

title: Great for children
review: Just returned from a week stay in Viva tropic and had a Fantastic time. We booked a standard studio and room was great, good size with a view looking over the gardens. We travelled as a Family with our 3 year old and our parents. Facilities in the hotel were fantastic, the childrens pool was perfect, pay area and councy castle beside the childrens pool were great as close enough for you to sunbathe and watch the children play. We did not eat in the hotel so cant comment on the food but can suggest you visit THE BRUNEL INN, it is just round the corner, great food (great prices) and great people and made our holiday much more enjoyable.I would highly recommend this hotel and resort.

title: Good Time at Viva Tropic
review: Had a 10 night stay recently at the Viva Tropic in a one bed superior pool view apartment. Although quite small, the apartment was very clean and served its purpose. Pull out sofa bed not the most comfortable but we got by. The comlex itself is great for kids, we had a 3 and a 7 year old and both had a ball. The pirate pool with all the slides was great. Beside that pool was a playground, with a bouncy castle and crazy golf course, so if needing a break from the pirate pool there was the answer. The main pool was split into two, with a slope leading down to the deeper part of the pool at one end, and a step at the other. Entrtainment was provided daily at the pool by the superb entertainment crew the tropic employs.  Usual problem with towels occupying sunbeds first thing, and…

title: Some good, some not so..
review: Just back from 10 days at the viva tropic as a family of four travelling with a 2 year old and 4 year old. We have mixed feelings about this hotel. On arrival, like other reviewers we had to wait over 2 hours for our room to be ready. This wasn't great having just travelled a long way and with two young children not being able to get in our room and get changed etc. We had requested a ground floor apartment but were given a room very high up on 5th floor. This made me very nervous having young children that high up and the only other choice was a 3rd floor room but at a cost of 100 euros as had a pool view. Opted for the 5th floor as we felt we had already paid a premium for the hotel as it was. Spent the holiday quite nervous being so high. Room was fine size wise but bed…

title: Very nice hotel
review: I'm just back from a week's stay at Viva Tropic.  Our party had 2 rooms, 1 bedroom apartment and a studio.  The apartment was nice and roomy, bathroom was nice, although there was a sewage smell that we were very aware of, but after telling reception it was dealt with that day.  The studio was compact but manageable.  My only criticism was that one of the beds in the studio had ripped sheets and for a supposedly 4 star hotel we thought this was unacceptable.  Oh another disappointment was the TV channels, all geared for German visitors, no kids channels.  However all in all it's a very nice hotel.  Great pools, clean, we didn't get a chance to try the restaurant in the hotel as they didn't start serving until 6.30pm for evening meals and we had a hungry 2 year old always ready…

title: Nice hotel with tree view???
review: We have just got back from a weeks holiday at the viva tropic hotel port alcudia. (22-29 june).Overall we had a great time but a few things made it less than perfect. We booked the holiday with thomas cook and we will not be using them ever again. We had a 6.30am flight but were delayed and did not fly until 8.45am. The excuse was due to staff issues and the pilot had done too many hours so had to be replaced!!!!-not a problem with the plane which would have been acceptable. On boarding , all of the passengers were bussed over to the aeroplane steps at the same time and left waiting on the ground to board. It was absolutely pouring with rain and very cold so 10 mins later everybody was soaked wet through! Really bad organisation! Our flight was ok and when we landed it was 26…

title: Summer Holiday
review: Just back from Viva Tropic, Alcudia.  First time in Alcudia.  A great place for families and couples also as there is very nice over 18's pool which is a Spa pool with Jacuzzis and very comfortable sun loungers.   The hotel boasts a very impressive reception and the staff are courteous and helpful, they even supply you with a little map of the surrounding area which was a great help.  The hotel has its own supermarket which is very convenient for lunch things and the newspaper.  Although, pay a visit to Eroski (about 5 minute walk) as it is a proper supermarket with very reasonably priced foods and has excellent choice.  There is also a gym and an indoor pool.  Our room was a studio which had twin beds pushed together, a table and chairs, kitchenette and fantastic modern…

title: Viva Tropic mixed feelings
review: We are just back from a two week break at the Viva Tropic Hotel port Alcudia.  Overall we had a great stay with a few little niggles, but no where is perfect I suppose.  On Arrival 12. 30 in the afternoon we were informed our room was not ready.  This was ok as it was so early and we were immediately offered a ,  ourtesy room for our luggage which was very secure.  However we did not get into our room until nearly 5pm, which really ruined our first day(We had specifically booked an early morning flight so we would not miss a full day of holidays travelling).  The reception area is extremely bright and modern, with lovely relaxing furniture and plants around it.  A very nice first impression.  This is also where the internet terminals are available and quite reasonable priced at…

title: Fantastic family hotel
review: I stayed here in June 2012 with my mother and sister. Altough we didnt have any small children with us, we would definitely recommend it for families that do. The hotel itself was beautiful, rooms were very comfortable and modern (a particularly comfortable bed). The staff were fun and friendly. It was mostly Nordic families with a few British and Irish too. 5 minutes walk from the lovely beach. We would recommend going half-board as it was great value, with a great selection for breakfast and dinner.

title: Family Holiday
review: Nice hotel , usual package you get from Viva. Not as nice as the Viva palma nova probably because they dont have as much space around the grounds. Rooms are what you would expect. TV has no english channels . Pool s lovely but quite cold. Kids club very good . Food very good in fact so good we went allinclusive for the second half of our holiday. Nightly entertainment , good mini disco for kids after that hit and miss. Hotel is 10 mins walk from the beach which is very nice. All and all relaxing holiday which we enjoyed dont think I would go back though.

title: Top hotel for families
review: Great quality, clean, comfortable , close to beach and bars / restaurants etc. royal terrace suite are a bit special. Recommended.

title: Family Holiday to Viva Tropic
review: Just backs from our hols with a six year old and a 2 year old. The hotel was clean and lots of facilities with plenty of sunbeds to go around. All the staff provided an excellent service would recomened to any family with young children. We upgraded our room to a superior room with a pool view so i dont know what the other rooms are like. The food was excellent and plenty  to choose from. The beach is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.  Would go back again.

title: Family holiday to viva tropic aparthotel
review: Just returned from our first family holiday abroad with our 5 year old twins, found it an excellent hotel to stay in.  Travelled from The Isle of Man direct, 2 1/2 hour flight, transfer just over 1 hour on coach with AC and seatbelts so pleasant enough. The hotel and all areas were very clean, with a choice of pools, though we only really used the kids pirate pool, the water coming half way up the kids legs at any point and the slides safe and fun.  Kids play area and trampoline next to it, with sunbds all around so you can watch them.  The entertainment at night was child friendly, our two loved the kids disco nightly. You can hire pool towels at 10euro deposit each, rerturned when you hand them back. Supermarket in the hotel well stocked and reasonably priced. Beach only 5…

title: First Stay And Never Again
review: We are just back from a holiday here and after staying in its sister hotal Viva Sunrise for the last 3 yrs the Mgt in the Tropic certainly downgrade this hotel big time. On checking in we were met by a Manager with an obnoxious manor. When I asked him could we upgrade to a pool view he replied €20 per day. When the family after us (unknown to him who were with us) were checking in he informed an upgrade to a pool view would be €10 per day loudly for me to hear.Later I enquired the cost to upgrade to a poolview at the desk and was told €10 per day, however this had to pass this through the Manager and it came back with €20 per day!!. Customer Service  needs more attention. The facilities were good however, their check-in boy needs to come down off his high horse!!!

title: First stay and not the last one
review: Very nice hotel, many facilities, excellent service, clean room and excellent cuisine. Should try without hesitation.

title: Still good!!
review: Re-visted the Viva a couple of weeks ago and i'm pleased to sell it is still excellent value for money. We stayed self catering in a 1 bed apartment on the top floor. 'Kitchen' area is very small and is ok to make brekkie and a quick baguette but anything more would be limited! Didn't bother us as we don't want to cook on holiday!  Drinks from the bar were expensive but the lunches are reasonable priced. My 9 year found the choice of TV channels a bit limiting but didn't bother us too much as she only wanted it on while she was waiting for us to get ready! Don't go on holiday to watch UK tv!!

title: Keep going back
review: I have stayed in the viva tropic 5 times in the last four years and it is a lovely hotel, situated very close to the beach and only a few steps away from a lovely little pub called the bodegon (well worth a visit). The tropic is a lovely hotel with a great selection on pools spas saunas and entertainment for the little ones, the staff are very friendly and the hotel and grounds are very well kept the only issues i had this year was the pools were very very cold and the jacuzzi's in the pools weren't working also the aircon is hit and miss in the rooms.

title: Couldn't have asked for more
review: my husband, myself and our 2 children, aged 6 & 5 have just returned from Alcudia, 4th-18th may. We stayed in the Viva Tropic hotel. This was our first holiday abroad and I made my choice of hotel by reading all the reviews on here, so felt it was only fair to come back and do my own. The hotel was very clean and tidy and everyone was very helpful, my husband said one of the barmen was grumpy, but it was never a problem.  We had a premier room booked and when we got there they asked if we wanted to upgrade to a pool view for an extra 10 euros a night, garden room for about an extra 20 euros a night or a room with a hot tub for an extra 58 euros a night. We decided to stick with the room we had originally, which was ready waiting for us when we arrived at the hotel at lunch time.…

title: Enjoyable Holiday
review: Having previously stayed twice at the Viva Palmanova, we decided to give the Viva Tropic a try. Even though the Tropic is very similiar, I would prefer the Palmanova. The layout of the Tropic is not quite as good. There seemed to be less room around the pools. The Pirate splash pool is smaller and is a bit away from the main pool. The kids mini disco and evening entertainment shows took place at the stage inside rather than outside which did not have the same atmostphere (maybe they move this later in the year). However, overall it was an enjoyable holiday and our kids had a great time.  Checking in was a little slow. The reception staff seemed to be trying to do about 10 things at once. However the rest of the time during our stay they were very helpful and friendly. We got a…

title: Return Visit
review: Stayed at the Tropic for a week in May.Its been two years since we last stayed here and have to say it has kept its high standard.The room was well apointed, spacious ,clean as was the bathroom complete with rain shower.All equipment in the room was in working order,gardens are well kept,The hotel was quite full yet the staff manage to keep the public area's very clean all the time,reception staff are very helpfull and friendlyThe hotel guests were of all ages, with adult only pool to relax,kids pool with slides,large pool for everyone and indoor pool plus gym,snackbar and restaurant there is something for everyone.There is a good choice of shops,restaurants, supermarkets,bars beach and public bus all within 10 minutes walk of the hotel

title: Good family hotel
review: We have stayed at the Viva Tropic 3 times so far and have always enjoyed our holiday there. It is clean , quite modern with very reasonable facilities and a good price-competative supermarket on site. The beach and town centre are a comfortable 10 minute stroll along fairly quiet roads. Facilities for children are very good (and there is an adult only pool if you wish to escape). Staff are very helpful.  I can not comment on the food as we always self cater/eat -out but there appears to be a reasonable choice. A good quality , good value hotel.

title: Fantastic Holiday
review: I recently stated at the Viva Tropic with my daughter  her husband and 2 small children.  The hotel was spotless, the buffet meals were excellent and the rooms spacious.   The hotel catered for families and the children were made really welcome.  The kids pool was a particular favourite with the Relax pool close by for each of us in turn to use. The trampoline was an instant hit with my three year old grand-daughter.  It was a short walk into the beach/port area and the resort again was spotlessly clean.

title: fantastic hotel
review: just back from aholiday here didnt want to leave. was a great hotel very clean and apartment big and comfortable. kids had great time at mini disco and pool. the pirates boat is amazing kids loved it. will definately be back

title: Viva the Viva Hotels
review: We have stayed in two Viva hotels and they have both been superb.  We travelled here in September 2008 with our twin daughters, aged 18 months. Apartments are spacious and very clean. Great pool which is set in a clean well laid out area. Kids pool with mini slides etc.  A few minutes walk to the port area of Alcudia which was very nice with plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from.  Hotel is quite pricey during peak season but end of Sept/October there are some great deals direct.

title: 'Fantastic'... cant wait to go back
review: stayed the 1st week of april 2012.'fantastic hotel' we cant wait to return next year  Booked this as a last min holiday for me and my 6yr old son,,, with thomas cook a bargain at £230 pp self catering.  only took 2hours on the plane from manchester. hotel is about 50mins from airport on booking in  11am  we were told our rooms were still being cleaned so we had  to wait and it could be up to about 2pm, took my mobile number to phone wen room ws ready. As i ws with my 6yr old i decided to get us both changed in the wc and store our cases in the store room near reception  and went streight to the kids pool, th hotel called at 12.30 as our room was ready, so not to bad of a delay. rooms clean, but not a lot of kithen equipment to use to make a meal if u wanted to ... luckly we were…

title: BUFO ! GIVE ME FIVE !!
review: We have stayed at the Topic in 2008 (family of 4) & 2011 (family of 5) and on both occasions we have had a fantastic time. I'm afraid now that the children are growing up we are finding it difficult to secure a double room for this years summer holiday.  We feel that the entertainment team are second to none and gave the kids a holiday experience they will never forget. Things to note with the kids club are that they run two 90minute sessions both morning and afternoon. With a show in the evening were the kids actually take part. This is followed by a mini disco and then an all-round entertainment show. We found that there weren't many English staying here and our daughter sometimes felt a little uncomfortable around some of the nationalities in the club.  You will find that…

title: Nice hotel
review: Stayed here recently as part of a cycling holiday. Hotel was clean, tidy and modern. Food at breakfast and dinner was good and plentiful. My room was well kept and had a cracking monsoon shower. Hotel was full of Germans which is usually a good sign. Hotel also had well kept gardens and a couple of nice swimming pools

title: Above our expectations
review: We found this hotel to be very well appointed, clean and with great facilities. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast every day and dinner for 2 evenings. On all occasions the restaurant comfortable, served high quality fresh produce, freshly made and well prepared.

title: Great place to stay for cycling holiday
review: i stayed here for four days to use as a base for a cycling holiday with friends. the hotel and rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly.and there is a great choice for breakfast. will defiantly be coming back here.and its a great hotel if you are looking for bike hire the standard of the bikes are top quality.

title: A nice family hotel
review: This is a good hotel and has lots of facilities ie Spa; lots of pools including an indoor and Adult only pool. Our room was very nice and had even got a one bedroom garden room rather than a Studio which we had booked. The only slight problem was that there was a musty smell but after a day so we got used to it. My biggest critism of the hotel is the pools; the lack of space around them and the number of beds. The family pool is also very noisy as it was august so there was lots of Families and entertainment going on. Also the amount of noise around the adult "relax" pool as it was siutated next to the childrens play area & water slide pool and in front of the Tennis/Basket ball/Volley ball/ Football court! So not much relaxtion - if you dont have children travelling with you…

title: REALLY NICE COMPLEX
review: this review is very late,but i went here about nearly 2 years ago in 2010..not 2011..could not put correct date in box.. and took my 3 daughters with me..went in february but weather was ok..pool very cold..complex was very tidy and inside the main entrance was really nice,leather couches and marble tables etc..indoor heated pool and gymnasium which was great for working a sweat off..just watching the girls have a go was hilarious..area was pretty quiet at that time of year as expected but it was a break,i have been to alcudia many years ago so knew what to expect..dont think i would go back unless it was in main season and busy,just for the buzz of it..

title: Brill Holiday'!
review: Went to the Viva Tropic hotel in october for a week,Fab! I would love to stay here again.The Staff and everyone in the hotel were very friendley and could suit your every need.The rooms were Excellent! Bathroom with a power shower , Double pull out bed ,flat screen tele also had catering facilities like coffee machine,fridge,kettle ect.Even though it was the 'End Of Season' we still had a good time.The pools were amazing especially the over 18's with the kingsize beds to chill and relax.They also had a big Pirate ship for the little ones.If you go self catering there is a Eroski  supermarket just a few minutes down the road.We were 5 minutes walk from the beach,Bars and restaraunts.Just round the corner from the hotel was a bar called 'The Brunell Inn' run by John&Em.They made…

title: Good Holiday
review: Just returned yesterday - Thursday 27th Oct - it was the 'end of season' but 2 children 2 adults enjoyed good service - good selection of food although I was amazed that we got battered onion rings at breakfast - the 6 year old thought this was brilliant!!!!! Staff extremely friendly.  It would have been good if the pools were a little warmer but overall we enjoyed the holiday and would return. We chose to put the kids in the bedroom and sleep in the lounge - we did this so we could enjoy a drink and TV while the kids slept. The couch beds could have been more comfortable.

title: Very nice hotel and friendly staff, but dont book if you want relaxing indoor facilities.
review: Booked hotel for a week in October. Chose this hotel as the weather in Mallorca can either be great or bad in October, and as this hotel had indoor heated pool and spa facilities then this was the main reason we booked it.  On arrival the hotel was really nice and clean and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. In fact all staff in the hotel were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them.   The room was very clean and was just as advertised on the website, our request for a nice view and high floor was also met. We went self catering so can not comment on the hotel food. Self catering facilities were basic but average. No oven, just microwave.   Outdoor adult relaxing area was great, although it was situated right next to the kids pool but this was…

title: Excellent for first time holiday with 2 small children
review: Just returned on 15th October . Our forst holiday with a 4 month old and a 2 year old, so a liitle nervous. Location was excellent. Close to the becah ( 5 minute walk) restuareants were on the beachso our toddler played whilst waiting for her dinner and the baby slept. Childrens facilites and staff very helpful, although obviously too young . Parents could stay and join in activities to entertain the little ones. Childrens park included a bouncy castle and trampaline. The Accomadtion ( 1 bedrtoom apartment) was basic but done what we needed. Possibly not the greatest if planning to eat in your apartment every night. The only bad comment i have it that at this time of year the pools were far too cold for either children. Chill out are ( adults only) great if you have the…

title: Lovely hotel - rooms could be improved
review: We stayed at the Viva Tropic during the first week of October. I had booked the Hotel through Travel Republic and got off to a somewhat shaky start when several weeks after making my booking I was told that the hotel was no longer available - even though a member of the reception staff from the Viva Tropic had previously confirmed by room. However I was glad to find that I had a room waiting for me upon arrival. The hotel also left Cava and fruit in the room to apologise for the inconvenience they had caused us, which I thought was a nice touch.  On first glance I wasn't massively impressed with the studio room we had booked - there was an unpleasant lingering smell and the beds were not particularly comfortable. Furthermore we had to sleep on two single beds pushed together,…

title: Only Fairly Good
review: Frequent visitor to Majorca, but first time in Alcudia...Stayed here last week of September, booked hotel thru Thomas Cook, flights with Bmibaby, and Car Hire with DoyouSpain/Record.  Flights..... super, soo easy, no hassles, and cheap!!! £60 return!  CarHire..... great (80e), really nice car, quick n easy, just a rip-off payin for a full tank of petrol (70e), you'd find it hard to use half a tank in a week on such a small island, even transfering to Alcudia!  Alcudia.... Lovley resort, bigger than Palma Nova (our usual fave) excellent beaches, clean and family friendly, plenty going on! Maybe a little spread out if you'r walking (harbour to bellvue bridge 40 min stroll) Prefer the bellvue end, bit more to do n more english based, nice chippy (TradeWinds) near the "river" and…

title: Great family hotel
review: We have recently returned from a weeks stay at the Viva Tropic. Upon arrival we were given the option to upgrade our room for the week for €50 which we accepted. We were in Block 3 on the ground floor facing the pool, we even had a small garden along with a patio with 2 sun loungers.  The hotel is excellent for young kids, the kids club was excellent and the entertainment staff are very helpful.They had painting, games, pony rides, mini disco, shows etc  The hotel has 3 pools, one of which is a kids splash pool complete with a pirate ship & water slides. The playground with bouncy castle is adjoining this pool. The kids loved this & we found it easier to get a sunbed at this pool than at the main pool. There is also an over 18's pool with double bed sun loungers.  We only ate in…

title: A great place for families
review: Unlike most people I am going to review the hotel and give you factual usefull information. The hotel Viva Tropic is in Alcudia which is to the north of Majorca and the airport is in the south so expect a long transfer as ours was a shared coach and it was 2 hours before we got to the hotel from the airport, just a heads up as you might not be aware of this.  The hotel is in a great location, 2 minute walk to the beach and its right in the centre of the port area of Alcuida so it is surrounded by other hotels and very close to loads of bars and resteraunts and shops.  On arrival after our long transfer the hotel looks great, its very clean and modern looking, the reception staff were tipcally spanish and disinterested with us as I think they were a little bored and fed up with…

title: Not really 4 stars...
review: First of all, keep in mind that this hotel is supposed to be a 4 star hotell. I will point out both good and bad things about this hotell. Bare in mind that we paid extra forr a doubbleroom (superios or what they now choose to call it) Also, i e-mailed the hotell in advance and asked for a quiet and nice room some floors up and also got a quick reply from someone at the hotell.  Lets start with the surroundings. The hotell is situated a short walk from the beach and looks kind of messy from a distance. It is a large hotell with a small entrance on a narrow street. Surroundings is very clean and tidy, a small park is situated next to the hotell. If you don´t what to get ripped of by the "Supermarket" inside the hotell, and yes you will, there are two great larger foodmarkets to…

title: nicce but overrated
review: Dear Sir,  We thank you for spending your time in having your commentaries reach us.   We apologize that your stay in our hotel did not fulfill your expectations. Your impressions have been certainly taken into serious account and analyzed jointly the implicated departments which in this case are Supermarket and rooms. About the supermarket problem, It was a shame that you didn’t go to the reception and ask for the director,we can assure you that our clients’ satisfaction is our main objective in our company and we seek to attend comments with utmost seriousness and dedication in order to constantly improve our service and thus guarantee, we learn from them.  We remain at your disposition should you require anything,  Yours Faithfully,

title: What a great place!
review: Rooms are small and with no much character. Sun loungers were very packed though so the sun beds were a nightmare unless you are up early to reserve them. The hotel mainly caters for the germans so the food was aimed at them really. Too many children, too noisy. Just not our taste.

title: Great family hotel with really good entertainment!
review: We spent a week from 13th to 20th August this year in this resort. Very good, excellent entertainment both day and evening.  We had one child with us who is 12 and he had a great time.  There were four adults in the group.  Very clean, brilliant pool area and great chill out pool.  The only reason I did not give it 5 is because I think it is a little pricey. I think 900 euro for a week for a room for two (room only) is a bit steep.  We were actually under the impression we were staying in a one bedroom apartment.  But we enjoyed our stay.

title: Fan bloody Tastic!
review: I stayed in Viva Tropic with my husband, stepson and parents in August 2011. We had a nice time, mainly due to the great entertainment and activities at Viva Tropic.   Unfortunately there was a mix-up with the rooms we booked and we ended up in 2 1-roomed apartments, rather than 1-bed apartments, but the hotel did try to help us find extra space. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The pools were nice, though I have to say it sometimes felt a little cramped by the main pool. If you can get to the adult pool, I highly recommend that as a place to relax and chill.   The activities during the day were great and my 12 yr old stepson was kept entertained most of the time. My husband also liked the air rifle shooting and archery, as well as the water polo matches. We also…

title: good quality excellent value all inclusive
review: Just back from a weeks stay at the viva tropic.Arrived late and only ones checking in at the time.Given an awful room with view of car park and bins , didn't really want a pool view but didn't expect this.Stayed in room for one night and requested a change the following day.Reception frosty and unhelpful(particularly Antonio , reception manager) but did eventually get a different room block 3 ,very quiet .Did see other UK guests having problems at reception.Guests are mostly Scandanavian families and pleasant but do seem to get preferential treatment at reception ie. being shown hotel rooms prior to check in. The all inclusive option proved to be great value.The main restaurant is buffet style with lots of choice ie. fish,meat veg. pizza, paella and salads -all good quality and…

title: great relaxing stay
review: lovely hotel & staff very helpful the over 18,s pool wonderful also a good base for the port and alcudia  could not complain about any aspect had a great relaxing stay and the beach in alcudia 'fantastic,

title: Excellent hotel and facilities, I would highly recommend it!
review: We have just returned from a two week holiday at the Viva Tropic in Alcudia and were delighted with the hotel and it's friendy staff. The hotel does really live up to it's 4 star rating and to be honest there is nothing we as a family of three could fault. Our  one bedroom appartment was well equiped with everything you could need including a large flatscreen TV (only BBC news and Disney channel in English). The shower room was large and spacious and the shower was the best I have ever experienced - like the Niagra Falls! The air com was quiet and effective and the house maid cleaned the rooms 5 days a week. Although we were self catering we ate out every evening. Surprisingly the hotel food was very reasonably priced and a lot better quality than some of the other local eating…

title: Fun-Filled Holiday Great Place to Stay
review: When we arrived we had a fast check in, stayed studio basis for a week  with my husband and 10 month little girl. We had to hire a cot bed for 7 days 4 euro a day which was in our room waiting for us I also requested a room with a view which we got. The pools were very clean and you could always get a bed some where even though there were people putting there towels out at 7.30am. It was such a great family orientated hotel so many thing for kids to do. Staff we non invasive. Food was very tasty indeed. Had the a la carte menu and snacks menu both which were lovely. Bar staff at the pool bar (night time)were sadly very slow only something minor. Would definitely  stay full board( would be a better option ).Would consider this myself if i was to return again. Staff were also very…

title: Best Holiday Ever, didn't want to go home!
review: 2 adults & 10yr old 2 weeks stay end of July 11 - self catering basis.  The hotel is lovely, well situated, a 10 minute stroll to beachfront, very family orientated and spotlessly clean. We had a fruit basket & Bubblely delivered to our room after a few days of our arrival due to the increased cost of our apartment, Thomas Cook can’t book pool view (think no UK operator can?) – So if you want one, an upgrade is required on arrival (10 Euros per night). The apartment - one bedroom, pool view block 1 -very clean, air-con super, maid always left the spare card in the slot to allow air-con on all day. We had the refurbished rooms with large walk in shower – great shower. Hairdryer, shower gel, soap, washing-up liquid and tea towels are provided. Really good storage space. No teapot…

title: Not a place for relaxation, but excellent for kids.
review: We spent 8 nights at Viva Tropic on our recent holiday, we stayed in a "studio" room.  The hotel is supposed to be a 4 star resort, they try but fails in many areas.  Our room was ok, nothing to get fuzzed about. The balcony is nice but your neighbours could see straight into your apartment if they want. We asked for evening sun when we made the booking and it was nice to see that they had provided us with that. The hotel is a short walk away from the beach. Theres also free parking outside the hotel. This is a place for kids and Viva offered an impressive activity schedule for the young ones. It was also alot of scheduled activity for adults. Three swimmingpools of high standard. The relax area for adults was a excellent place to get away from all the screaming and chaos.  We…

title: We had great holiday.  We love viva!
review: Stayed in 2 viva hotels now.  Both spotless and well cared for, but a little different to each other.  Plenty for family to do but equally not any pressure if you don't want to take part in activites.  Sunbeds have 40min cards put on and then towels removed, always able to get a sunbed.  All viva staff fab.

title: Excellent hotel - definitely go back
review: My husband and I got back earlier today from a week at the Viva Tropic. I went on the website before booking this hotel and agree with all the positive reviews.  The room was clean when we arrived and cleaned everyday to a high standard.  The hotel is family orientated but as a couple found we could avoid the hussle and bustle of the family entertainment. There is a lovely pool for adults only and the children in the resort were all very well behaved with lots of activities.  The gym was impressive and there was a daily spin class! Plus there is always the lovely beach to run along. You can easily walk to Alcudia Old Town if you fancy too.  The staff were very pleasant and after a relatively long journey from the UK to Alcudia arriving in the early hours our check in was…

title: Very much a family hotel.
review: This is not a complaint, we used the hotel as a base to visit our family but I say this to inform others that it is a busy, lively hotel & perhaps not somewhere you would go for peace & relaxation as a couple. Of course there is noise from an early hour due to it being mostly families and kids making the most of the pool & sunshine. It looked like a struggle to get a sunbed, by 10 am , most appeared to be taken but I guess everyone is up early. There is however a hidden gem of an adult only pool which is like something from LA with cabanas, relaxing music and massage showers...very nice! Priviledge apartment was a good size with private garden, patio,sunbeds overlooking the pool. Huge shower/bathroom, well equipped kitchen with coffee maker, good air con. Have to say the beds…

title: A lovely Hotel
review: Well, this is the 3rd time we have visited the Tropic and once again we were extremely pleased with our stay.  We stayed for a week self catering in a Studio overlooking the pool. The room was very clean and all the facilities were in good working order, as it should be. I love the showers they have in the bathrooms. The beds are comfy. The TV was lacking in English channels (As it's mainly Scandinavian guests), which doesn't bother me, as I'm not there to watch TV, but that might bother families who want to stick there kids in front of a TV for an hour, while they're getting ready. I'd also suggest getting a room on the top floor, as it can be a tad annoying when a 5 year old keeps running up and down the room at 4am above you. After a couple of days of our stay, they left a…

title: Excellent apt.hote - clean, nice, great features.
review: This hotel is like heaven for kids, but even for a 35-ish couple without kids it's great. The "chill out pool" (no kids allowed) is so pretty and nice with the sofest sunbeds and a relaxing atmosphere. Good dinner restaurant and great entertainent every night (especially the 'tribute to Elvis'-show, very professional). Only downside is the extensive kids entertainment programmes - can be loud and fairly annoying when group of kids run around the hotel playing indians. (Mostly cute though).  Free wifi in reception area. Block 2 has good standard (July 2011) and the aircondition was superb. Privilege apt with terrace and private garden was great! Too hot to stay in the private sunbeds daytime but great evenings. Very pretty. A gardener came and took care of the grass and flowers. …

title: Absolutely fantastic for kids, we will be booking to go back next year
review: The hotel is in an ideal location to the beach and restaurants. We didn't go all inclusive as we enjoying dining out at different restaurants in the evening. We have a 4 year old and the hotel is great for him, the kids pool with the adventure pirate ship was a god send. We were sat on loungers feet away from the kids pool whilst the little man splashed about in the pool all day which meant we actually managed to relax. The rooms were really nice, the room we had had been recently been refurbished, we had a room that looked out onto the pool and you could see the sea. My only comments on the room would be that the shower waste didn't drain properly which meant on 2 occasions the bathroom nearly flooded whilst i was in the shower and the air conditioning in the bedroom hardly…

title: Disappointed, especially after all the great reviews on here
review: After reading lots of great reviews for this hotel on Trip Afvisor we booked the Viva Tropic. It was MEGA cheap (44E a night) but you really go get what you pay for. The air con didn't work, the staff weren't particularly friendly, there were a lot of people hogging beds with towels and not using them! We couldn't relax here and spent as little time in the hotel as possible. Although, for what you're paying then it could be a lot worse. It's also a bit of a scary trek into town.

title: Value for money
review: We stayed for a long weekend in May self catering,(70.3 ironman weekend so v busy!)  and didn't try out all the facilities so this may be a bit limiting as I know they do AI there.  We had a studio, nice size room, clean and not to cluttered. Good amount of storage space.  Bathroom nice size and shower was powerful and hot. Good amount of work surfaces to put your toiletries on!  Cooking facilities and kitchen area very small but as we ate out we only used it for breakfast so didn't bother us. The only slightly annoying thing if I'm bring picky was the noisy fridge as it woke us early! As we only had milk in it we switched it off at night and turned it back on in morning!  Pool area was good but would be packed in peak season!!! Bar area a little slow, very poor especially as it…

title: Great for a young family
review: We were a little nervous about going to Alcudia fearing it would be a little on the tacky side, but were very pleasantly surprised.  Viva Tropic is well situated about a 5 minute walk from the port end of the beach where there is a row of beachside cafes/restaurants behind a small, but good quality children's play area on the beach.  It was absolutely perfect for our 4 and 7 year old girls to play whilst we watched on with a drink or finished eating a meal.  The hotel itself was very clean and the service excellent.  We had requested a ground floor garden room overlooking the main pool and this is exactly what we got.  The room was basic, but clean.  It could probably have done with a little modernisation, but was by no means dingy.  Apparently many rooms in the main hotel block…

title: Only stay if you have children - hotel dismissive of your complaints
review: My daughter & I spent 8 days.  We did complain that their web page misleads you with the double beds pools etc and fails to tell you that the hotel is more interested in families because all their hotel rooms are studio based.   We wanted the facilities that the hotel had but from 09am to late and on one night in particular we returned at 11pm to have a drink at the bar and could not as the children & parents were all screaming with tirdeness while the parents tried to enjoy themselves. The Gym and indoor pool is nice but not heated.  The cycling equipment is dangerous as I found out with a gash on my shin.    The Staff in the hotel were exceptional but the staff manning the outside bar were very rude all the time.    Our hotel room had the beds made and a quick clean, all…

title: Fantastic Family Holiday, we'll be back
review: This was our first time going on a package holiday with our kids aged 8 and 5. We decided to stay for one week in case we wouldn't like being surrounded by children and kids clubs! How wrong we were. The entertainment team in Viva Tropic are the reason we had such a fantastic holiday. Dascha and Sandra entertained our kids while Barbara made sure there was plenty to do for the adults. I had the option of daily water aerobics  and my husband got to play soccer, archery , table tennis etc. It was totally up to us how involved or not we wanted to be. The hotel is well laid out with a separate adults  pool which I enjoyed going to. The kids were always nearby and popped in and out of the kids club. This was the first holiday we went on where 'I'm bored' was never mentioned. The…

title: Excellent hotel - highly recommended. Very family friendly.
review: We have just returned from a weeks stay, self-catering, (4th - 11th June) at Viva Tropic with my fiance and 2 kids (aged 7 and 4). We arrived at the hotel late afternoon and were greeted at the reception by Jutta, she was extremely helpful and very welcoming and answered everyone of our questions. First impressions of the hotel were good - with the overall finish very high and were what we’d hoped for.    We had booked to stay in a Premium apartment but were able to upgrade to a room with a pool view room for an extra 10 euros per night, which we thought was well worth it. The check-in process was seamless, despite it being quite busy at the time.  Staying on the 5th (top) floor, our room number was 1535. The room was clean and comfortable with all the things we’d require…

title: Just perfect, will definately return.
review: We were in the main hotel block in the a 1-bed apartment. The grounds are amazing and the room was very clean. The food was lovely both in the pool bar and in the buffet in teh restaurant at night (€15pp, well worth it). There are plenty of restaurants to choose from nearby, from chinese, to texmex to steakhouses, absolutely gorgeous. Our favourites were the texmex off the harbour and the steakhouse 2min walk from the hotel just before you cross the road to the beach. Hotel is perfect location for beach, walking, eating, etc. We had a one year old with us and he was well catered for and welcomed everywhere. The hotel entertainment was great for children and adults alike. Only negative is that the bar service was really poor and the bar staff made very little effort with guests.

title: A HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!
review: Having stayed the previous year at the tropics sister hotel the viva blue we were excited to stay at the tropic under the assumption that the" blueprint" for the viva hotels would be the same. The ameneties were pretty much the same what differed was the service..and boy did the hotels differ in that respect! The viva blue is exceptional but located in a very quite area  called playa de muro some km from alcudia. Having loved our stay there we thought we would try the livelier Tropic. The staff are rude with the exception of one young lady who had some manners one of the male reception staff is possibly the most inhospitable person i have ever encountered in a hotel. The upgraded rooms are not to our taste...LAMINATED floors and they look as if they have been done up on the…

title: Excellent value for money & great location
review: We have stayed here trice now and liked it even more the second time. One good piece of advice is to book a good standard room. A pool view room is a bonus and a premium rather than standard is a good move too. The facilities are great and there is so much for young children. Also a fantastic, clean, child friendly beach 5 mins away and the buzz of the port is lovely n the evening. We will definitely return.

title: A definite disappointment - not a 4 star experience, would NOT stay here again
review: I stayed at the Viva Tropic for 9 days in May 2011 when I was in Alcudia to race the Ironman Mallorca 70.3 triathlon. I was super excited to go Mallorca and thought the hotel looked great as well. By the end of my stay I couldn't wait to leave. There was not one big thing that was terribly wrong but just a lot of small things that lead to disappointment after disappointment.  The summary of my review is that it is not at all up to the standard I would expect of a "4 star resort", the staff were often rude and unhelpful, the rooms were okay but small and full of bugs, the cleaning staff never really cleaned our room very well. The breakfast and dinner buffets were pretty good though.   Read on for the expanded review:  I should start by saying that I am Canadian and typically…

title: Lovely hotel-great value-beautiful beach-definately worth a return visit soon!!!
review: My friend & I stayed here in early May & were absolutely delighted with our week, both the hotel & the resort. We weren't sure what to expect having taken pot luck on a bargain from the 'net, but we were so surprised at the quality of the hotel. The lobby is an oasis of calm & greenery & the staff were always pleasant, helpful & charming, both at the reception & around the hotel. Our self catering studio was in Block 3, opposite the main block, on the 2nd floor & to our delight, looked over the main pool which was particularly pretty at night, It was plenty big enough for the 2 of us, with a small but well stocked kitchen area & a very clean bathroom. In fact the whole hotel & grounds were immaculate the whole time we were there.Our room was cleaned every day & fresh towels left…

title: Fantastic!
review: Me & my friend booked this holiday early in Feb 2011. We booked through Easyjet as a package with flights, transfers etc for £280. To be perfectly honest we were not expecting much for the price as it was so cheap. How wrong we were! When you initally pull up to the hotel it looks very small from the outside, as soon as you go in you are greeted into the most gorgeous lobby I have ever seen. It looked stunning and we couldn't believe our luck, we got checked in and went to our room. We only paid for a studio apartment and went self catering. But you don't spend an awful lot of time in the room and it was plently for just 2. Clean rooms and reasonalble size. We then went on a little walk around to explore the hotel and was flowing with surprise after surprise. Especially when we…

title: A very average but clean hotel; a short walk from the beach; Puerto Alcudia as a location was disappointing
review: I thought that the hotel was very average in all aspects however it was clean. The hotel is located a short walk from the beach and so do not expect a decent sea view. The hotel has a nice pool area. In a way, I feel that the hotel was probably let down more by Puerto Alcudia. While it has some nice beaches, this part of Mallorca is extremely busy with tourists and not the affluent kind.

title: Great hotel, but beds are terrible!!
review: Visited this hotel for a week with my husband and two kids (1 & 3 years old). The pool areas and especially the splash area for kids were GREAT. Since may is not really high season there were plenty of space and sundbeds. If I could have one request for the pools, I would have appreciated heating. The water was cold and I didn't really enjoy staying in for very long.  The apartment (premium on 5th floor, pool wiew) was nice but quite small. Cleaning was ok, but not great. The only really bad thing was the bed. They were terrible, hard spring matresses  on wooden frame. Both me and husband slept worse than ever due to the beds.  Would go back though, the location, kids activities and overall impression is very positive!

title: Great hotel
review: This is the second time we have stayed at Viva Tropic this year, this time for the Majorca Ironman 70.3 as it is very close to the race venue. The hotel caters really well for triathletes and cyclist. Rooms are always very clean and well looked after. Staff are friendly and always happy to help.  Used the pools this time as we usually go in March to train and it is a bit cold to use the outdoor pools. Adult pool is great place to relax and get away from everyone with its large cabana style beds. We always get an apparent room (so separate bedroom off a lounge dinner) which is great if you want to make things like breakfast. Went to the buffet breakfast for the first time ever on this stay and it was not bad and had a good selection.

title: Fabulous holiday...but a few problems...wouldn't say this hotel was 'AMAZING'?!?
review: This will probably be a long review, but worth a read if you want to see an in-depth report from a couple travelling without children.  Myself and my partner booked a weeks stay at the Viva Tropic for the 2nd week of May after reading the reviews on here.  It was interesting choice as we were travelling alone (no children) and this hotel is predominantly aimed at families. But we liked the location, the price was good and hotel seemed better than many around the area with it being a 4 star.  We also booked our transfers through the company recommended on the hotels main website.  I travel with work for my job and stay in a different hotel each week, so I can recognise a true 4 star hotel when I stay in one.  Firstly, the transfer from the airport to the hotel was seamless. With…

title: AMAZING FOR KIDS..
review: Just arrived back from viva tropic. I booked the royal terrace apartment which is expensive but so worth it.when I walked in the first night I thought the living area was quite small but once u open the patio doors it's fantastic.huge decking area with eating tables and chairs and a chilled out couch with 2 chairs , 2 sun loungers( built in table in them if ur looking what to put ur drinks on like me) and best of all a private JACUZZI..bathroom huge and shower fantastic..a few channels.u need to use the source button on remote to go between TV AND DVT , Disney channel comedy channel and news channels .. Entertainment for kids excellent. Thank you VANESSA, my daughter adored you. Kids camp though lacking in information from day to day . Some days u would need to bring money for…

title: AMAZING !!!
review: We have just returned from Viva Tropic in Alcudia (24th April to 1st May 11) and i have to say its the best place i have ever stayed.  The location was great 5 min walk from the beautiful beach staff at reception were very helpful, the rooms were cleaned everyday with fresh towels everyday !! We were given a karge fruit bowl and a bottle of cava on arrival at the room there is a great kids club pools are lovely especilly the adult pool - kids pool is fantasic theres gym sauna and jacuzzi to use at your leisure free of charge !! the food was good the evening entertainment was great all staff brilliant with the kids -- this hotel must be visited if you get a chance.  The only downfall to the holiday was the weather wasnt the best but what did i expect in April?? all in all 11 out…

title: Air conditioning rubbish and watch out for mosquitos
review: We booked to stay for one week self catering, at the end of April.  Had a smooth journey there, but on arrival at 12 noon, was told the room wouldn't be ready until 2pm, which was disappointing to say the least.  Had to leave our luggage in an unlocked room by reception, which was worrying - the room was full of loads of other people's luggage, so gather we weren't the only ones waiting for rooms.  No apology when we finally got our keys and no compensation for this, not even an offer of free drinks while we waited.    Room was a bit smaller than we expected but exceptionally clean.  Soon discovered only one hob worked on the cooker and air conditioning was temperamental.  Would have complained, but didn't really want workmen in etc when we were only there a week, and it seemed…

title: Four Star but only just - don't book superior apartment
review: Based on reviews we booked Viva Tropic for an Easter getaway.  I booked the superior apartment but DON'T - there is a reason why there are no photos of these apartments on the Viva website - there are 5 apartments (according to receptionist) that were not refurbished in 2009 and these are misleadingly called the 'superior apartments'.  They are smaller than other one bed apartments with tiny balconies, the fixtures and fittings are worn (kitchen cupboards poorly fitted, rust on fridge door and bath plug) - there is no way that these could be considered 4 star accommodation.  I was very upset to be given this apartment and I asked to move but was told that I would have to pay surcharge to get the 'Premium' apartment as per the ones you see on their website - I did pay but the…

title: A great quality hotel, excellent service, good value - will definitely go back
review: I've just come back from a 4night trip to Mallorca with my husband, we wanted to spend our wedding anniversary abroad, in the sun, and somewhere we could use as a base.  So we wanted something clean, comfy, and which didn't break the bank.  We found a great deal staying at Viva Tropic, and chose a studio appartment (in the main hotel block) - studio facilities were top notch & much more than we expected: 2 hot plates, fridge, microwave, sink, plenty of crockery/cooking stuff.
