A well equipped bathroom, one of those 'rain' showers (& additional attachment) - plus it was massive.  We had a balcony, aircon, a TV, plenty of space for storage.  The hotel has plenty to do (facilities, sports, entertainment and food) for families, individuals and couples - it's one of those places that…

title: * * Had an Amazing holiday here! * *
review: Booked this hotel as a last minute get away and wasn't expecting much - I was very wrong! Booked a studio room which was more than adequate for 2 people. Bathroom was lovely- massive tropical shower and plenty of room, also had a hairdryer which was handy. Kitchen facilities were great - all the appliances and utensils were in ex condition and all very clean. Only annoying thing about the room was the classic european twin beds disguised as a double meaning one of us usually woke up lodged down the middle! The spa facilities here were excellent - especially the indoor pool and sauna room. Outdoor pools were also great - the kids pool looked like great fun! We spent most of our time at the adults only pool which was lovely - and again immaculately clean. You can also hire bikes…

title: fabulous hotel that caters for all
review: ,, we stayed april 11, my party consisted of ages of 15 month. 3 years and adults.. the hotel is beautiful, 5 mins to the lovley talcum powder beach,and 5 min walk to port and marina, rooms(we were upgraded to superior at no extra cost re early stay),were immaculate, cleaned 5 days a week, shower has 2 appliances, over head and hand held, beds comfortable, balconies large, plenty of storage, had microwave, 2 hotplates, toaster, and kettle, also had coffee jug. We were all inclusive, which i would recommend, as was fantastic, all drinks were branded,jack daniels, smirnoff,baileys, etc, etc, all cocktails free, as was irish coffees, food was fab, breakfast 8-10am, all cereals, cooked meats, bacon,boiled fried, scrambled eggs, sausages, hash browns, fruit, youghuts,beans, lots of…

title: Amazing hotel should be ranked number 1 in Alcudia!!!!
review: After staying at this hotel last year I couldn't wait to book again fo this April, It was even better than I remembered, facilities, location, staff all fantastic the rooms had also been done to a high stanadard, stunning bathroom and shower and that was just a studio which comfortably slept myself my husband and a travel cot for my infant. I really can't rate this hotel highly enough, I have stayed in other hotels in Alcudia which do not even compare. It is 2 minutes walk to the beach, shops harbour etc which is perfect as not quite so busy as the other end of alcudia where all the all inclusive hotels like bellevue and club mac are, it's a far more laid back elegant atmosphere with the most beautifull scenery and and everything you could possible need would also recommend Aqua…

title: Nice Hotel shame about the customer service
review: When we arrived at the Tropic it was 11.30pm and we were obviously tired and thirsty as it is a long coach trip from the airport.  We weren't offered any refreshments, and was told both thebar and shop was closed. My husband had to go outand walk the streetslooking for an open shop to purchase water. He eventually found a bar who charged him 16euro for a bottle if coke, water and 3 packets of crisps!. Not impressed that in the SC premium apartments they don't even leave you a coutesy bottle of water on arrival.You also had Tobit salt/pepper dishcloths etc nothing was grattias as the say. I also gad requested a quiet room as I am a light sleeper, and was horrified to find we were put right at the front above the reception on the Road side with passing traffic and coach drop offs…

title: Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant
review: Me and my partner stayed here at the beginning of April.  We weren't expecting much as we had paid a seriously low amount so were amazed when we arrived and found the hotel to be amazing! Our room was a decent size and very clean.  It had a balcony and kitchenette with lots of things already provided like washing up liquid and loads of utensils.  We cooked meals most nights and saved alot of money this way.  Don't bother with all the really expensive Spar's that are around the hotel - walk about 5 mins south down the main road and you will come to a local supermarket with a huge range of cheap food.   The bathroom was really nice and clean with a fantastic waterfall type shower, again, the hotel were thoughtful by providing a huge bottle of shower gel and all the usual…

title: Slightly disappointed
review: Have just returned from a one week trip with a daughter who is 13 and one who is 15.  We arrived at just past midnight.  We had booked 2 standard rooms and had requested that they were side by side which apparently wasnt possible.  We were on 5th floor at the end of a very very long corridor.  Our rooms faced onto the road and the view was pretty dismal of waste land & parked cars.  Our room was 1546 and our balcony was right on the far end and was smaller than the one our daughters had who were a few rooms away.  Whilst the room was clean and very modern in its decor, it was very small.  I was very glad indeed that the 4 of us were not sharing a room.  This room was very dark (even during the day with the curtains open and sun shining) and felt somewhat oppressive.  I certainly…

title: One of the best holidays ever
review: Just back from a week in Viva Tropic which was absolutely wonderful. We booked what we thought was a cheap and cheerful apartment break only to find ourselves in a really nice four star hotel with excellent facilities - our favourites were the indoor spa pool and the kids pirate ship. We were made to feel very welcome by staff particularly Mally the entertainments manager who took us on a trip to the market in the old town of Alcudia and ran a host of kids activities including mini disco and face painting even though it was very early in the season. Loads of nice touches from the hotel, for example for a 10 euro refundable deposit you get beach towels for the duration of the trip so no need to push your Ryanair luggage limit and a decent courtesy room with free towels if you are…

title: wonderful hotel, will definitely stay again
review: just home from a week in the viva tropic hotel, we(myself, husband&7month old son)  stayed on a b&b basis.found all the hotel staff very helpful and friendly, esp the waiters who are all brilliant with children.the childrens entertainer Mila is excellent also.breakfast every morning was lovely with a terrific selection for all tastes.location of hotel is also great, my husband is a keen cyclist and he hired a road bike for the week from a shop highly recommended by the hotel.the hotel provides a secure holding room for all the bikes.the spa in otel is open from 9am to 9pm and there is also a gorgeous adults only pool area with balineese sun beds!kids splash pool is fantastic and there is also a lovley little playground.all in all id recommend this hotel and will definitely be…

title: Great value for money
review: I stayed in an apartment, was newly refurbished and very spacious. Would be great for a family as the kitchen was basic but had all equipment. A nice hotel if you want to stay away from the 'fish and chips' side of the town! Lots of swimming pools, including an indoor one for off-season. Bar area was huge, and they seemed to have kids activities most days. Supermarket in the hotel was a bit basic, but there are other shops nearby.

title: Top Class
review: stayed at the Viva Tropic, late March, early April. On Arrival we was upgraded from the booked studio to an apartment. large living area bedroom and bathroom. the maid service was excellent and the apartment was kepy spotless, as was the rest of the hotel. Very well priced food and drinks, to a very high standard. we will be returning later in the year.

title: Fabulous hotel - you'll love it - we did
review: Had a lovely 3-night mini-break at this hotel at the end of march/early april.  Booked it through hotels4u.com and bagged a real good bargain.  The hotel was very peaceful during our stay - it attracted a lot of "pro" cyclists, who for the most part were out during the daytime and returned in the evening for dinner.  We booked a studio room, which in all honesty, was clean, a good size and well presented.  Pretty much the size of a hotel standard double room.  The swimming pool area was very peaceful - but I can only imagine that in peak season, it would be rather difficult to get a sunbed.  The over 18's pool was very pleasant but the water in both pools was very cold at this time of year.  Bar and food service was superb - all staff very attentive and polite.  Good quality of…

title: Great location and value for money
review: Booked this hotel last minute with Monarch Airlines - what a bargain! Arrived before lunch, the check-in staff were very welcoming and upgraded our room to an apartment. Room was very good - big sofa; kitchenette (though very basic); TV (be sure to press the 'language' button on the remote for English dialogue); nice big bathroom and separate bedroom.  As it is off season, we didn't use the outdoor pool area, but it looked excellent, including the adults only 'chill out pool'. If you use the indoor pool or spa, you might want to get changed in the room as the steam room etc seems to be a communal changing area!  Reception staff were very helpful at marking out driving day trips on our map.  There's an on-site shop, but prices are way too expensive. Walk around the corner to find…

title: Must Go FANTASTIC Short Break
review: Booked last minute All Inclusive for Feb 2011. Flew with Easy jet and booked the hotel on their website. Got a bargain price for 3 nights All Inclusive (really worth it). On arrival at Hotel first impressions were good. Reception lovely and clean staff very friendly and really helpfull. Had a good look around and wasnt disapointed. The Hotel is really clean and the bar area lovely again with staff who cannot do enough for you. Had a room on the 4th floor. Booked premium room and it was eactly what we expected. TV in room setee with balcony and views over alcudia. Shower and bathroom fantastic walk in shower room. Used the indoor swimming pool which was good and has a gym and sauna. I really cannot say enough for the hotel. Would definatly go again cant recommend enough.

title: great place
review: we liked this hotel. we didn't spend much time there - needed it just to sleep, since we hired a car and traveled around the island. it was very comfortable, since we were able to park a car next to the hotel - there was always place for it, even if we came back late. the room was small, but clean, comfortable, little kichen in it, very nice bathroom, comfotable beds. beach was very close, bars and restaurants near by, grocery stores close too. this side of the island is more calmer, nothing to compare with Palma, but has cosy little bars and restaurants, some right on the beach. so good and for families, and for couple. Also very comfortable to stay there and explore the island. we enjoyed staying there. don't know about the food or the night shows of this hotel, but have to…

title: Go slightly out of season to grab a bargain price
review: The rooms were massive; the balconies too and the pool area lovely.   Located close to the stunning port and beach. Plenty of bars and restaurants close by but nit tacky like the ones further away near the Bellevue.   Receptionists friendly; others maybe not so much.  Definitely recommended.   And as for the title? Well we went for 5 nights in April and paid under €100 total! Some days are nice enough for beach or pool. Others? Well there is a stunning island out there to discover by car, foot or bus.  Enjoy

title: Everything you need
review: Took my baby in feb stayed in an appartment which had everything we needed weather was ok not warming enough to use outside pool   So the indoor pool was used alot and very nice also used the gym, if you enjoy bike riding this is the perfect place, lots if Germans in the hotel but very friendly and take saunas naked so if your shy be worned, had a few meals in the resturant good value set price buffet but lots of nice places to eat went at the end of feb so things where just opening back up again, will be going back.

title: Amazing for kids, Great location, Can we go again!
review: We visited the hotel for 2 weeks between the 21st September and 5th October. We stayed in the newly renovated apartments and it was great. it was always clean and the staff were very friendly. we mainly stayed at the kids pool because of how great it was and seemed to keep the sun for the later part of the day, the one corner was a great suntrap.  My thoughts of the hotel was quite expensive for drinks and food but this could have been because of how poor the exchange rate is at the moment. the weather was quite good, had the odd overcast day and day that rained but we were expecting this for the time of year we were there.  Staff were very friendly, kids pool is probably one of the best i have ever seen in a hotel and had a park (slide, swing, see-saw), trampoline and bouncy…

title: A very comfortable stay
review: Although not my first choice this hotel turned out to be a bit of a bargain. I can not comment on the food as was staying on a self catering basis , but rooms were clean , there was plenty to do , especially if you have childeren , and the location was excellent , in a quiet side road a few minutes from the beach and town centre.

title: Fantastic holiday but the bar staff need to cheer up!
review: We have just returned from a week's holiday at the Viva Tropic and was more than happy with our holiday.  We had a good room although the view wasn't that great. The beds were comfortable and the kids had two travel cots that they slept through in.  The beach was in close walking distance and lots of shops for buying the buckets and spades. The beaches were clean and lots of nice restaurants by the sea to enjoy the views while you eat.  We ate in the hotel half the time as it was good value and a good choice. We never went hungry at dinner as there was a wide selection.  The hotel entertainment was brilliant for my two who are 3 and 1 and we were there every night. The hour disco for the kids between 8- 9 was fun and certainly made my two tired. Post 9pm the entertainment was a…

title: Just The Best
review: So we're just back from our third stay at Viva Tropic.  This trip was booked through Easyjet Holidays and we were expecting the most basic room available.  We were, therefore, most surprised to be allocated a refurbished studio in the main building.  The studio was spotlessly clean and nicely furnished, with the most noticeable improvement being in the bathroom, which now had a walk-in shower.  Our room was the last one along the corridor, which was great because we had no "passing traffic" and had no problem getting a good night's sleep.  We had a street view, but this provided great entertainment while enjoying the sun on the balcony.    The resort was slowing down for the end of the season but we again enjoyed the hospitality of Dave, Jane and young Daniel in the nearby Sgt…

title: Another Great Viva Experience
review: Third stay with Viva hotels now and this the best location so far.  Holiday with family , 2 young daughters (10 & 7) and this was a great location in terms of the complex and the very short walk to the beach and the port. The beach in Alucdia is fab for kids - shallow and warm and there are loads of restaurants around if you dont fancy eating in the complex. The  hotel is up the the usual high standards of Viva - clean and well maintained.

title: better when 3*
review: this was our 7th stay out of 10yrs- no probs before- we enjoyed our holiday in alcudia but not the hotel :                          pros... reception staff excelent as always- curtious,very helpful + with a smile.                      room cleaned every day and beds made + towels changed (this may have been because we were down as v.i.p guests being back so often)--the info in the room says no cleaning on wed+sun- thats the way it was past years--nice touch                      coffee machine in room also toaster and kettle + under counter fridge+2 ring hob--good hair dryer fixed in bathroom.                     excellent food in resturaunt--I'm sure it's the same head chef since we started going in 2001.                    all the pools are good and well maintained- over 18s…

title: Great family hotel
review: We had renovated apartment in the main building towards pool area with views both for entertainment in the evenings and artificial landscaped garden on the roof. We were very pleased with all facilities. Excellent children's pool area and 18+ area in addition to the general pool, what did we as a family for three generations were all met. We ate in the evening buffet every night and it was very good and commendable.  Very friendly service throughout the hotel.  We will certainly again and maybe next time will choose rooms with jacuzzi and large terrace with sofa.

title: Been In The Travel Industry For Over 20 yrs - My Opinion
review: I have been in too many, many hotels over the years on educationals and family holidays.  I have read through the latest reviews of this hotel and most of them are fair.  This hotel has recently been granted its 4th star.  This is because it has updated the rooms in the main block (1) and slightly reburbished the apartments in block (2) - not sure about block (3).  Gaining this 4th star has out priced itself for the majority of UK tour operators who won't pay the room rate increase that the Viva now want.  At the moment the only UK tour operator is Thomas Cook, other than that the hotel has many german operators using it.  There were also a few Irish people there so I presume an Irish tour operator buys rooms.  Do I think its worth a 4 star?  Maybe not, more like a 3.5.  We…

title: SorryCan't see the 4 star
review: We recently spent 2 weeks with our 3 teens aged 13,14,16. When we checked in which was late we found the reception staff very pleasant. We stayed in a two bed-roomed apartment in block 2. We had a view of the pool and I have to say we were not charged any extra.   On first impression of the room was really disappointing, very cramped and with only one bathroom, which was a disaster, what with 5 of us sharing ,including our "diva daughters" who spent all evening, morning in there, we actually had to book it !!! It was the first time we ever had a two bedroom apartment with only one bathroom. It was a real negative. Main pool too small for a apart hotel that caters for 950 guests. There is a relaxation pool but because we had kids,  we could not use it, which I respect.  Staff…

title: Enjoyable holiday at VIva Tropic
review: We have never been to Alcudia before and travelling with a 2 year, we wanted a place that was child friendly.   When we booked in, we were told that we would have to pay 70 euros for a pool view which I wasn't terribly happy about since we'd already paid quite a bit for a premuim apartment.  We paid the extra and I'm glad we did as the sun shone onto our balcony all afternoon which was lovely.  The apartment was lovely with everything you needed (toaster, kettle, microwave although no cereal bowls).  They provided a high chair and travel cot (at no extra cost despite an earlier review stating otherwise)  The apartment was cleaned everyday except a Sunday and there was no problem getting extra towels. A couple of negatives - the bed was uncomfortable, you had to turn the shower…

title: Good And Bad Points With This Hotel
review: We had mixed opinions on this hotel.   Good points are Location is good, 5 mins walk to beach and not far from port. Facilities good for children, pirate ship slide excellent, bouncing castle, playground, crazy golf. Entertainment staff never stop from 10.00am to 11.00pm, there is relaxation area for adults.  Shop on site with good selection, even if the prices are slightly above the shops outside.    Low points for us was the 'towel issue'!!! Not sure what time of the day you had to be up at to get a sun bed beside the main pool, I was up at 7.30am one morning had a look out and there were  towels on nearly every bed.  They have a policy of 40 mins on towels, if nobody appears after that time, they are removed, I only saw this happen once during our 12 days there.  Reception…

title: LOVED it, cant wait to go back
review: Booked with travel republic. Flights hotel and transfers but the transfers we booked later on and that wasn’t a problem – very helpful. Booked all inclusive.  Travelled 24th July for a week 2 adults 2 children (11,6) Staff were very helpful on reception.We were placed in block 3 not in the main hotel.  The rooms were pretty big, bath/shower room more than adequate, kitchen with everything you need and dining table, living area is quitebig until you make the beds up. Everywhere very clean, we put the children in the bedroom and we had the couches (which were pretty hard and we had bad backs, next time think we will have the bedroom)! We didn’t pay extra for a pool view which was really good in the end as the sun set on our balcony very warm sitting outside in the evening, and…

title: Great family hotel with excellent facilities
review: After our fantastic holiday in 2009, we went to Viva Tropic again in August 2010. The main building has been renovated last winter, as a result of which the hotel has now been awarded four stars. The rooms in building 1 our now called Premium Appartments, the rooms in buildings 2 and 3 are labelled as Superior Appartments. Premium Appartments include a flatscreen tv and a new bathroom. It is also possible to book Premium de Luxe appartments with a large balcony equipped with a jacuzzi. Please notice that the hotel charge an amount of € 10 per night for a preference of pool view.  All inclusive formula is possible. The dinner buffet is of great quality and diversity with almost every day another dining theme. Staff is lovely and enthousiastic, especially for children. The Viva…

title: Great family holiday - not perfect in every way but still great fun.
review: Rooms are a little dated with uncomfortable beds and patchy air conditioning. Fod was excellent, great choice and service and the all inclusive option is definitely worth considering.  Entertainment, particularly for the children, is first class with a team of 6 really going the extra mile to deliver something different every day and evening. Swimming pools are excellent with a children pool, an adult pool and a splash pool. Plenty of sun beds and also a lifeguard.  Gym is poorly equipped, just needs half a dozen more machines.  Bar service is excellent, staff very attentive. Hotel was very diverse in its clients, many from Holland, Scandanavia, Germany and some British.

title: Good Location - No Personality
review: We have not long returned from our first visit to the Viva Tropic and whilst the location and facilities were good we would not return. The hotel is most definately geared towards Scandanavian and Dutch and German guests. Upon our arrival we were told that we had been allocated a privilege room at an extra surcharge of 70 euros per night. This was as a result of an email enquiry that had been sent asking how much an upgrade would cost. Upon finding out the cost which seemed very high, I immediately sent an email back stating I would stay with my original booking which was made via Thomas Cook. The problem is that the standard of rooms indicated in the Thomas Cook brochure do not compare with how the hotel now grade their rooms now that they are a four star. We thought we had…

title: wont be staying again....
review: This was our 3rd stay in the viva tropic and we WONT be going back.  We were really looking forward to another stay in the viva tropic, especially that the hotel had been upgraded to a four star property! They may have been given an extra star for the upgrades to the property, but the service we received here was horrid and the rooms really havent been upgraded alot! The only changes that we noticed with the rooms were that the baths had been taken out and a walk in shower put in, new sofas and flat screen tvs. We booked a privilage room with sun beds and jaquzzi!  not worth the extra money if im honest. The jaquzzi had to be fixed three times during our stay, leaves fall off the plants and trees constantly and the cleaners dont sweep or mop the deck - we asked for sweeping…

title: Loved it!!!
review: I have just returned from a week in Viva Tropic, Alcudia. The resort was lovely. The resort is very much family orientated, and as we don't have any kids, we were worried about the noise! The resort had a relax pool where it was only over 18's allowed, this was brilliant. We never went to the other pools! Our room was cleaned daily, and the towels and sheets were changed every 2nd day! You can get pool towels at reception free of charge for the week, which was an excellent bonus...leaves more space in luggage for clothes! We wern't all inclusive, thank god! We went for the buffet on our last night and it wasn't great at all. I would definately return to this hotel....but maybe with a family!

title: Super holiday
review: Hi, Just returned from Viva Tropic with 2 small kids.  Excellent week. Stayed in Viva sunrise last year ( an absolutely loved it!) and was wondering how this would compare. We weren't disappointed.Hotel in an excellent location for beach, bay and variety of shops and restaurants. Excellent facilities for the kids- playground area superior to viva sunrise I would say with trampoline and additional slides. Viva sunrise  slighly  smaller hotel and kids pool less busy then viva tropic which can suit people with really small toddlers a little better perhaps  Only thing that we didnt like was the level access showers rather than bath- just personally we'd prefer the bath. We did upgrade our rool mid stay which was heavenly. It also hasd a fabulous level access shower rather than a…

title: Great Hotel
review: Me, my partner and little girl (19 months) stayed here for 11 days - i'll keep it short and sweet, facilities were excellent and food good (although can get a little bit repetative if your staying more than a week) Staff are amazing and lovely only i felt sorry for them as they seemed so overworked i.e - there at 8am when you went down for breakfast and still there at 11pm closing up. i really loved the location, a few minutes to the beach and there was a lovely mix of people there. dont forget you insect repellent as i counted 46 individual bites on me by day 4 and they litrally ate me alive. Entertainment was very good most days and so much to do for the kids. My daughter loved it here. It has a great splash pool ffor children. Only downside to the hotel would be the lifts. OH…

title: not as good a sister hotel viva sunrise
review: I stayed at the tropic for 1 week with my husband, son & his family (partner & baby aged 14 months)We stayed in 2 studios which were nicely furnished which included fridge,toaster,kettle & microwave.The bathroom was lovely with great mirrors and lighting.The shower with its drench head was lovely for adults but our grand daughter hated it and really needed  to be bathed.The drain for the shower kept blocking up and overflowing into the rest of the bathroom so we had to keep stopping the shower so it could clear.The drain was full of soap scrum!!The cleaniness of our room was a real let down as for the first couple of days we couldn't walk around in the room without shoes on or our feet turned BLACK.The room wasn't cleaned to a very high standard and sometimes all the maid did…

title: Excellent hotel
review: As mentioned by others, this hotel is very very good, but very much designed for young families. Mix is largely northern european (Scandinavia, Germany, Benelux) with a mix of Irish/British.  What appealed to me was:  -  the finish of the hotel/complex , recently upgraded to four star and it shows  - the small touches, for example lots of children's buggies you can use (for a small charge), free wifi in lobby, LCD tv in rooms, beach towels, courtesy rooms if you have a late checkout, great supermarket onsite, and so on.  - staff were particularly good, especially the entertainment for the kids and reception  - gym, nice new gym equipment and indoor pool for off season.  - food, when you arrive you can either go halfboard, or allin (or breakfast only, dinnner only) and children…

title: Liked it a lot but still not sure if I'll go back
review: Not sure why yet but I don't know if this hotel passes the acid test of whether I would return or not & I honestly can't put my finger on why - too big/too impersonal/me too fussy? I'll cover the main bits in some kind of order:  Location - just a short walk around the corner to main road & beach so quiet area. Cleanliness - spot on - Would struggle even for my wife to fault!!  Price - If booked direct with Viva looks dear - Came out at over £1000 for 6 nights half board for 4 of us direct or £760 with Alpha Rooms - they promise a price match but room descriptions were slightly different & simply went with Alpharooms - no problem. Price means clientelle are all ok as well with no problems at all - Mixture of nationalities & ages from toddlers to very elderly.  Drinks/snack…

title: Lovely Hotel would highly recommend
review: We hve just returned from the Viva Tropic and was great,the weather was not great but never mind. Rooms-Not massive but spacious enough,we had 2 adults and 2 kids (4+6) and had a 1 Bed-Priviledge apartment,the apartment was right by the pool and we had a patio area and garden and we also has 2 sun loungers.The apartment only had a shower(think they were designed for a wheelchair),the kitchenette was fine with a microwave,2 rings,fridge,toaster,coffee machine and kettle(take a corkscrew),There was a small table in kitchen for 3 people.The bathroom also had a hairdryer. Hotel-The hotel had loads of facilities-Indoor Pool,Gym,Sauna,Mini Golf,tennis Courts(you just went to the reception desk and they gave you all the equipment for free), Kids play area and splash pool is…

title: Most under-rated hotel in Alcudia - deserves 4*
review: The whole family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Viva Tropic in 2007 and went straight back again 2008.  Would still love to return again but got a little pricey! Well located, great entertainment,  lovely pools, food good, children's entertainment good too and my two kids really enjoyed Bufo!  The only negative I would say is that the management would need to do something about the sunbed situation around the pools.  People are inclined to hog the beds all day long with towels, even when at the beach!!!! Naughty!

title: Viva Tropic
review: This is a good 3* hotel.  Rooms were clean, well maintained and staff were helpful.   We were booked in for 1 week and were not expecting anything out of the ordinary.  The family pools were busy but in a family orientated hotel thats to be expected.  The adults only pool was much quiter but you have to be quick on a morning to get a bed here as they are limited in numbers, although the are very comfortable.  You also have to chose carefully if you want a shaded bed. The location is about 50-75 metres from the beach and you have to cross the busy main street but there are plenty of crossings to use. The beach at the top end, closer to the port does smell a little due to it being sheltered by the man made port, but if you move down the beach towards where the park is then the…

title: Viva Espana - A relaxing stay!
review: Myself and my wife stayed at the Viva Tropic for a week in early after using Trip Advisor reviews to base our choice. We booked a studio apartment as this suited our requirements. On arrival even though we arrived tired in the early hours of the morning we noted that the hotel lobby was very nice and spacious and the staff on the desk were very attentive and proffessional. Our room itself was slightly smaller than an apartment by Spanish standards but was certainly comfortable and relaxing enough with storage space, cooking facilities, fridge and a tv. It is also good to note that the air conditioning was free as we have been charged for air con at previous hotels on occassion. Overall the rooms were certainly up to standard. The hotel itself was upkept very well and had a…

title: Pirate ship with water slides and the staff are superb, we really enjoyed our tme at the VivaTropic.
review: I agree with the review from Scotsman below.  The rooms are a bit tired and could use a refurb BUT that is just about all I can say that is negative and trust me the rooms are not that bad and they are definately kept clean as is the whole complex .  We had a room looking North/East towards the mountains and although initially disappointed not to have a pool view, it was very quite in the evenings. (Just a note, if there is noise from dogs barking tell reception and they send the police to the dog owners to shut it up!). The rooms facing the pool will have to listen to the entertainment every night untill approx 11.30hrs, this would have got tiresome and kept our children awake, so be aware if booking a pool view. The animation team are really good and work very hard, they were…

title: its no viva palmanova
review: after staying at viva palmanova the year before and were overly impressed, we thought we would try the viva tropic, on arriving the lobby was very nice so we thought yes another great viva hotel. the room was in need of a major refurb, and very small compared to the palmanova,with no microwave and one ring that worked.the bath was very badly stained, the maids came 5 times a week and cleaned and changed the towels.there was also a very noticable drain smell around the complex, not very nice at all. The pool areas were very nice, while i was there i saw chlorine added to the water once at half 8 in the morning, and correct me if i'm wrong but this should be done the night before not half an hour before the pool opens. There were a lot of children with diarreah and ear infections…

title: Fantactic for a sunny and schild-friendly holiday
review: We stayed from August 6-20 in Hotel Viva Tropic. The hotel is favourably located: 300 metres from the beach, a 5 minute walk to Port d'Alcudia and about 20 minutes to the old city of Alcudia. The hotel has been renovated last year (kids splash pool, relax pool (18+) and multi-sport field and this year (new bar and buffet restaurant). Hotel Viva Tropic has 300 rooms in 3 buildings. Block 1 is the main building. The swimming pool is in the garden between block 1 and 3. Blovk 2 is situated between blocks 1 and 3. We stayed in block 3 in room 3202.  Swimming facilities: a large pool in tha garden with a small waterfall, a kids splash ppol (with pirate boat) and a chill out pool. Please be aware that all sunbeds are "reserved" by towels at already 08:00 (although this is formally not…

title: Well worth a visit.
review: Eventually booked Viva Tropic having read the many positive reviews on Tripadvisor....and  wasn't disappointed. I'd agree with some recent postings about the need for some refurbishment but on the whole, the accommodation was of a decent standard and kept spotlessly clean. My only real disappointment was upon arrival being allocated a room a couple of floors above the main entrance, with only a view of the neighbouring apartment block. I asked the receptionist (very helpful) if there was any possibility of a pool view and was informed that one might be available later in the week for an extra 10 euros a night. Being a typical Scotsman, I decided that I could put 100 euros to better use than a pool view and elected to stay where I was. The reality I suspect is that my room was…

title: Fantastic Hotel Complex
review: A wonderful hotel with plenty to offer.  Great pools with time for tennis and football.  Staff were wonderful and could not do enough for you. Apartments a bit on the small side and with maybe a refurbishment due but found the apartments very clean and well looked after,  Overall very impressed with the Viva complex and would recommend.

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed in Viva Tropic for 2 weeks at the start of June and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet relaxing holiday but especially for families.  The hotel was very well looked after and cleaned constantly.  There was alot going on at the hotel which was great for kids but our children were a bit young so we spent alot of time at the beach which was only about a 5 min walk way.  The beach was lovely, very long and the water stayed shallow for a good bit which meant you didn't have to be constantly watching the children.  Lots of cafes and restaurants along beach which is great because they are accessed by the boardwalk which means you don't actually have to go into the sand.  The hotel is only about a 5 min walk away from the Marina where there are also many bars…

title: Great Family Hotel
review: Hotel catered very well for kids with plenty to do. Relax pool was very nice and essential for parents who would like a rest....if possible!!! Hotel drinks/food were expensive but nice nevertheless. Plenty of entertainment on the night for all the family along with a full daytime schedule Apartment was a bit old fashioned and not to the highest of quality but very clean Sgt Peppers pub close by was great for people wanting great food and drink for a very reasonable price  Would recommend this hotel to anyone with children and for a great location not too far from beach

title: Fantastic holiday, will def be back!
review: We stayed in viva tropic the first week in may 09, my husband and i and three children. 13yr old, 7yr and baby. We had a fantastic time, the staff were great, cleaners cleaned 5 times a week. The kids club staff were brilliant, our 7yr old was a bit shy and didnt want to join the kids club but the staff still came around and invited him to join different activities during the day which to our delight he did and really enjoyed himself, he even won a medal which he was presented with at the mini disco. There is a splash pool for 2-12yr olds which was great fun as it had a huge pirate ship with four slides and a few more slides in the pool, it is perfect for families as there are sun loungers for mum and dad while kids play. next to that is a little playground with sea-saw, slide…

title: This hotel is absolutely fantasic!
review: My girlfriend and i ( aged mid 20s give or take a couple of years!)have just returned from a 3 day break, having stayed at the Hotel Viva Tropic on a room only basis. I was so impressed with this hotel that i felt compelled to write a quick review even though my girlfirend has intisted that I unpack and help her with the washing first! Yeah right! SERVICE-The service was very good. Staff were very pleasant and professional. Most staff speak good English, among other languages and made you feel entirely welcome. There were numerous staff within the complex from morning to night and plenty of handymen and gardeners etc looking after the upkeep of the place. In fact, I met one of the gardeners who worked a 12 hour day and was very friendly. He spoke little English and likewise, i…

title: Can't wait to go back!
review: My partner and I have just returned from a weeks holiday at the Viva Tropic and we are already looking for deals online so we can return! Travelled with Easyjet and Resorthoppa transfers-both were great,on time and the transfer was really quick. Got to the hotel to discover that we had the choice of two rooms-one with a pool view and one without. Only downside was that after a quick discussion in Spanish with her friend the receptionist informed us we would have to pay an extra 70 euros for the room with the pool view. We decided to have a look at the rooms before we decided but were a bit unhappy at having to pay the extra as we always thought it was just your luck if you got a pool view room. After having a look at both rooms we were very confused because we could see no sign…

title: A great location and a smart Hotel
review: My wife and I stayed here the week before Easter and had an absolutely fantastic time. A clean and modern looking hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Our studio apartment was very clean and comfortable with the kitchenette coming complete with Toaster, Kettle, Fridge, 2 Hobs and pots and pans. It may be worth taking a couple of plastic cereal bowls if that's your morning start as we struggled to tell the different between the plate and very shallow bowls! Our North-West, road facing balcony was perfect for the evening sun and was fairly quiet with little passing traffic. Some readers may be interested to learn that our apartment overlooked the beach volleyball court, much to my 7th month pregnant wife's dismay! The 3 pools are all well presented with plenty of sunbeds to go…

title: Not as good as I expected
review: Stayed in a studio at the Viva Tropic in April 2998,   Room was clean but basic.  Bath had been chipped and painted over.  We were on the first floor by the road which we found noisy.  We asked reception if we could swop rooms but they only had a room opposite us, which was also by a road and would cost 10 euros more a night or one overlooking the pool for another 40 euros a night.  Decided it wasn't worth it.  The beds were hard but we did get used to them.  Fridge noisy so turned it off in the night.  Strange tin opener - like a rusty blade!  Only english channel on tv was BBC world news and CNN, the rest was Spanish (fair enough) and German.  To hire a safe for the week cost 15 euros.  The indoor pool was good.  Outdoor pools and sun bed area nice, but too cold to go in…

title: Very nice place in great location
review: Went to this hotel in the week before Easter 2009 with my wife and two girls (5 and 3 years old).  The rooms / apartments were excellent and well designed with plenty of room, storage space and a decent well kitted out kitchen.  Position is great and is only a few minutes walk from a great part of the beach and only a few minutes more to the Marina / main part of Port D'Alcudia.  The week we went was very quiet probably because of the general recesssion but was very enjoyable and they had their annual Boat and Sepia (cuttlefish) festival over the first weekend which was a laugh and a bonus.  Nice feel to the whole Hotel ... although definitely seems to be a cycling mecca!  Positives: Apartment size, condition and layout Price Location Beach is close, huge and very nice Proximity…

title: Best Hotel In Alcúdia- Won't Dissapoint
review: My boyfriend and I were a bit worried before leaving about Viva Tropic although we read many good reviews on the hotel before we left. We booked the hotel on alpharooms.com and the apartment for the week worked out at €138 which was incredibly reasonable, the flights ended up being the most expensive part of our trip! When we arrived at out hotel we were far from dissappointed as it looked very impressive! The check in was fast and we were up in our apartment in less than 10 minutes I would say. There are 3 lifts in the hotel all together so waiting for one rarely takes long. The apartment is small but basic and sufficient and spotlessly clean.The maids came nearly everyday and also changed our towels. The hotel has much to offer couples and families alike with a pool dedicated…

title: Great!
review: Nice hotel, fresh, friendly staff. Great shows & entertaining. Good & tasty food.  Cold pool was the only thing that I can complain about, but I knew it when i went there.

title: Excellent hotel - would recommend to anyone!
review: My fiance and I stayed at the Viva Tropic for a week S/C in June 08.  It was fantastic!  The hotel was spotless with what seemed like an army of cleaners.  The rooms were typical twin beds with a small kitchenette, bathroom, wardrobe and balcony.  Just what you need on a summer holiday.  Free air con was a bonus.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The over 18's pool was where we spend most of our time relaxing on the double sun beds.  Only one day did some chav teenage English kids try to use the pool but the hotel staff soon had them out, it was so peaceful.  The hotel shop was well stocked with fresh bread and pasties everyday.      Lots of things for families to do too with the pirate pool, crazy golf, cycle hire.  A short walk from the lovely beach and harbour...try…

title: Terrific acomodation. Absolutely loved it!
review: This was our first time at Viva Tropic and we absolutely loved it. The service was second to none, but the entertainment varied. However the facilites offered lots of activities for my child to take part in. Overall it was an excellent holiday and I would definately reccomend it and go there again!

title: excellent facilities, should be 4 star!!
review: Having visited Alcudia 3 times this year as a family on an all inclusive basis i was a little little bit apprehensive this time as there was only myself and my 8 yr old daughter travelling alone. Looking at other members reviews i went ahead and booked Viva Tropic on a self catering basis (bearing in mind over the last 10 years i had holidayed all inclusive) i was aware that some places had already closed as it was the last few days in October and the weather was also reported to be very mixed, but not a problem as it was quality time we had come for. After an early morning flight from East Midlands airport we arrived at the Viva Tropic - first impressions seemed good, lovely entrance and reception staff pleasant. Our room was on the 5th floor and was really well equipped - a…

title: Fantastic
review: We returned from the Viva Tropic last week and had a fantastic time. Our Children of 5 and 2 loved all the activities and especially loved the Mini Disco. The entertainments team even kept my husband out of trouble too!  The hotel is immaculate and like the previous reviews should be a 4 star not just a three. The hotel is very central and puerto Alcudia is lovely. The other end of Alcudia looks a bit tacky full of british pubs etc. We managed to upgrade to a two bed apartment on arrival for not much extra. If you ask reception they will bring you a kettle and a toaster as they are not in every room but you can have them if you request them. We will definitely return either to this hotel or another Viva hotel in the chain.

title: lovely hotel, even in low season
review: We stayed for 3 nights/4 days during Feb half term, and flew out with Ryanair from Stanstead.  Myself, my husband and 7 year old daughter.  Total cost of flights, car hire and hotel was £130 all in.  The hotel was lovely, staff very friendly, the indoor pool complex and gym area was amazing.  I laid on a sun lounger reading the day away, while the others played in the pool.  The weather was fantastic and we ventured out in the evenings to small restaurants by the marina.  Not many people about, but we enjoyed a great family break, with no stress or planning.  If the prices are good again in 2009, we will definately be going back.

title: Mixed thoughts
review: We stayed for a week at the Viva Tropic returning this morning and wanted to write this while it was fresh in my mind. The price of the hotel was extremely reasonable and with it being a 3 star didnt expect the world.  Arrival was good with a quick check in and went straight to the room. We stayed in a studio on the 4th floor with nice views of the mountains and pool. Upon entering the room it was extremely hot so we opened the patio doors and turned on the aircon.. only to find it wasnt working. The following morning we went to report this only to find out that the aircon in the hotel was turned off as it is out of season!!!!! Unfortunately during our whole stay the weather was beautiful and the room was stiffling!!! (thats an understatement) No matter what we did we couldnt…

title: Possibly even better than last time!
review: We have just returned from a week's holiday at Viva Tropic, having previously stayed at this property in 2004.  At this hotel, they take your holiday seriously.  Every morning, an army of cleaners make sure that all communal areas are spotless.  There are activities available for kids, teens and adults from 10am and these change hourly, culminating in a "show" at 10pm.  These activities are optional and there is no pressure on you to take part, but, from what I could see, the kids and teens couldn't wait to get involved!  We stayed in a ground floor studio, which was spotlessly clean and overlooked the main pool.  There was a small kitchen area with two rings, toaster, kettle and fridge.  The on-site supermarket does fresh bread every day and stocks most necessities, although it…

title: Great family accommodation
review: This is a lovely hotel, set in what I was say was the nicer part of Alcudia, near the Marina. The rooms are nice, the public areas are well kept and clean, the staff are pleasant and helpful, but most of all the activities for children are fantastic.   The outside areas, pool and gardens, are lovely and make very pleasant surroundings. If we go back to this resort, we'll definitely go here.

title: Lovely Hotel, Fab time
review: I would advise anyone going to Alcudia to stay at this hotel. Firstly it is very clean and well maintained hotel. Rooms had everything you need, and the maids came 5 days a week, and changed the towels every day, and the bed linen twice in our 10 day stay.The childrens entertainers were brilliant. from 10am every hour, they had something ditterent for them to do. Mini golf, table tennis, games in the park, face painting etc. The evening entertainment was also to a high standard. Everyone works very hard to create a friendly atmosphere. Can't comment on the food as we were self catering, but less than a 2min walk, took us to a good british restaurant called Sgt Peppers. Good food and very reasonably priced. Its also only a 3min walk to the beach, which is lovely, and very clean.…

title: Absolutely the best ever
review: Have to say what an amazing holiday at an amazing hotel. I wanted a good hotel that was suitable for my 4 year old little boy, my partner and my self. We did not get a good hotel and holiday but a great one. This hotel was rated as 3* however i would say this is more 4*. The hotel had so many things to do for my little boy, there is mini crazy golf, a football pitch, trampoline, bouncy castle, mini park and an amazing pool area that was more like a small water park with a huge pirate ship with many slides, no need to pay to go to a water park with this on sight, wow. For myself and partner the bar and entertainment were great with good food, however the a la carte menu is very limited and thought would have been better, the buffet breakfasts were good though.Staff are so helpful…

title: Must stay at this place
review: Viva Tropic-Alcudia Before I start to review this particular Hotel  I think that everyone should know how BMI Baby can offer low cost flights.  We were a party of 4 with an overall 80 kilo allowance and flying home had 79 kilos overall, but we were charged 120 euros for being 12 kilos over,  How is this you may ask, well BMI baby state that it is 20 kilos/person which is norm but what isn’t clear is that it is per case as well.  Over three cases we were 12 kilos over, 25, 24, 23 respectively and 7 kilos for the bag.  No case should be over 20 kilos. Anyway back to the hotel:-  It is what everyone else says it’s the best hotel I have ever stopped at for kids.  They have 5 pools, 1 is dedicated to adults only, with 1 dedicated to kids that has a pirates ship built into it with…

title: Great Hotel
review: Just returned from V Tropic with my husband and 16 and 18 yr old boys.  Hotel is v clean. Lots going on for kids, teens and adults. New over 18 chill out area is heaven!  Rooms spacious but usual limited kitchen area. Only ate food from poolside snack bar which was reasonable and v good. Lots of v nice restaurants and bars nearby. Port is lovely in the day and evening. Port end of Aldudia beach is full of v smelly seeweed further up OK but put me off! 15 mins walk to right of hotel is sunny Blackpool which suited my sons as there a lot more bars and a few clubs and discos. Alcudia old town 5 mins drive away is beautiful - full of market stalls in the day but late afternoon or early evening the cobbled streets are clear and shining and the locals come out - special feeling about…

title: Brilliant!
review: We arrived at the Viva Tropic at 3am, after travelling from 2pm the previous day from Ireland ( Delayed flight and seemingly endless airport transfer, Falcon holidaymakers beware! ).  The only member of staff on duty was the night porter, however our room keys were waiting and we were directed to the first floor of the main building. The apartment was facing the pool area and we were perplexed when we opened the balcony door that we couldn't see the pool.   After some much needed sleep in very comfortable beds, we discovered the apartment was overhead the restaurant roof, which was the reason we couldn't see the pool. Instead of an ugly asphalt roof, there was a garden area with astro turf grass and raised beds, a tree sculpture and at night  the area was lit by mood lighting.…

title: 1st class hotel
review: my husband and myself have just returned from the viva tropic--our 5th time in 8 yrs and it is better than ever. we stayed in a studio which was bright and very clean as always(cleaners always do a 1st class job-5 days a week) . the reception area,bar area and restraunt have had a huge makeover since last year and very tastefully done-always spotless.Outside there are new sunbeds and plenty of them -around the main pool -also a new paddleing pool area for small children with a pirate ship and other amusments--ALSO THIS YEAR there is a court area where you can play tennis/basketball or soccer,perfect for the older kids. ALSO we found an extra pool--for over 18s..in it were three jacuzi areas..the pool was surrounded by double bed sized sun beds-they were more like 4 poster…

title: Brilliant time had at the Viva Tropic
review: I have recently returned from a two week stay at the Viva Tropic and can not speak highly enough of this hotel.  As a wheelchair user,  this hotel was very accessible for me.  I don't think there was any part of this hotel that I couldn't get access to. Our room was big enough for me to be able to easily move around and the bathroom was complete with wheel-in shower was again easily accessible.   I found the staff, particularly the reception and the dining room staff very helpful and friendly.  The room was cleaned everyday bar Thursdays and Sundays, bedding was changed and fresh towels were left (though you have to leave the used towels on the floor, if you put them back on the rails, the maids don't change them).   I enjoyed all of the food that was on offer in the buffet…

title: Fell in Love All Over Again
review: This is our second year visitin the Viva Tropic and I have to say I can't belive that tihis hotel is only a 3 star...to me it should be at least a 4 star. Everything about this hotel is quality and the location is perfect for every individual. The weather was pretty bad the time we visited again but that did not stop the hotels quality, they kept entertainment going for the kids.  If you are booking a hotel in alcudia...definitely pick the VIva Tropic.

title: Great Hotel!!!
review: I stayed at the viva tropic with my 2 yr old son and my friend with her 4 yr old son. I booked it on recommendation of a friend and we definitely were not disappointed. The hotel is in a good location to beach and port. I was amazed at the kids pool off the play ground with the slide's and pirate ship. Our children had a ball!!! Any kid of any age will get a kick out of the pool. The adult's only pool is devine with dig double sized wicker beds with plush mattresses on them. The hotel itself is spotless and the staff are all lovely. The only downfall I found was the food. People may disagree with me but it was always cold and not the best cuisine I have ever eaten. There are some lovely restaurant's in the port and a little coffee shop called L'illy's which is fab!!!!  I would…

title: value for money
review: just back from viva tropic value for money in my opinion.very clean complex in good location.full enterainment program for childern and adults.new indoor swiming pool,fitness room.internet room(not  a corner of a room)large playground with pool  water slides ,adult chillout area over 18 only.all these  are brand new.plus large pool for general use, poolside snack bar good value good food.we stayed in studio like previous reviewer would say kitchen is very basic two hot rings sink fridge,will be back next year.

title: The Viva Tropic was better than Ever!
review: We made a return trip to the Viva Tropic in May, having stayed there two years ago.  We were delighted to find that this property has gone from strength to strength, boasting some excellent facilities, which in our opinion raise it far above its current three star rating.  The complex is spotlessly clean and we were particulary impressed by the adult only relaxation area and pool. The double sun loungers are simply the ultimate in comfort and the pool is perfect for uninterrupted swimming.  We revisited some restaurants and tried a few more. We would definitely recommend the STEAK HOUSE CARABELA, DON CHON CHINESE RESTAURANT and TANDOORI INDIAN RESTAURANT.   We would advise anyone to steer well clear of the SHANGRILA Chinese Restaurant and the DAKOTA Tex --Mex. Both of these were…

title: Fantastic
review: My boyfriend and I booked a week at the Viva Tropic at the end of April and for the price we were totally amazed.  The facilities were amazing and the place was immaculate.  We booked self-catering and ate in the restaurant quite a few nights - the food was brilliant.  We didn't sample the buffet although I heard very few complaints.  There is a small poolside bar/cafe serving food up til 4.00pm, you will not believe the selection of food and the incredible value for money available.  We had a great time staying here the only one fault I had was that our apartment was in need of a bit of a spruce-up.  In comparision to the rest of the hotel it was just a bit shabby.  Don't let this stop you booking, everything else more than compensates for this.    There isn't much more to say…

title: Fantastic stay at Viva Tropic!
review: We have just returned from a 10 day stay at Viva Tropic with our 20 month old daughter and would definately recommend Viva Tropic and would go back again. This was the first time we have been on this kind of holiday with a child and we really impressed with how well it catered for families.  The pools are lovely, 2 beautiful outdoor pools for the grown-ups (one of which has jacuzzi etc, double rattan loungers and is for over 18s only), and a paddling pool and big splash pool for the children (including lots of water slides) plus an indoor pool and spa for those cooler days. The children's playground is fantastic, wooden adventure playground plus trampoline, bouncy castle etc, plus there is mini golf, football & basket ball courts, ping pong etc.We didn't use the 'mini club' as…

title: loved it 100%
review: just back from the viva tropic.i will be definitly be booking up again and going back next year! The hotel rating is 3 stars but i would say it was more like 4 stars.it is a very clean hotel with maids cleaning your room 6 days out of 7.When i booked the hotel,it only mentioned in the brochure that it had 2 pools.1 indooor and 1 outdoor.it actually has 1 indoor and 2 outdoor.the extra pool looks new and is a dream come true for adults.it is reserved for over 18's only with its own sunloungers(which are double loungers). the location of the hotel is also good.if you come out of the front of hotel and turn right then left then right and walk straight on,your at the beach which only takes 5 mins to walk.the bech is also one of the nicest i've seen and ideal for familys with young…

title: Great location
review: Stayed at the Tropic for one week in April 2008, in a studio apartment.  The location of the complex is excellent, just a couple of minutes walk from the beach and about 3/4 minutes walk from the Marina at Alcudia itself. Facilities in the hotel are very good - nice pool, restaurant looked fine (didn't use it) and welcoming reception area. Pool area has about 140 sun loungers - would probably be difficulty getting one in the summer season but no difficulty at this time of year. Indoor pool swarming with kids, probably due to outdoor pool being too cold. Staff were always pleasant and helpful. Main criticism was that the "studio" was basically a hotel room as distinct from a studio apartment that I have experienced in other resorts.   It consisted of two single beds, a small…

title: We'll go back
review: We're just back from a week staying at the Viva Tropic.  I travelled with my wife & 11 month old daughter.  First impressions on arrival were "Uh oh" but that quickly changed.  Check in was quick and staff were very friendly.  Room was pretty much as expected except we had asked for a cot and there wasnt one in the room when we arrived.  A quick trip to reception and that was sorted (It's €5 per day hire but it is a proper cot, not a travel cot so it's well worth it).  Kettle's & toasters are not supplied in the room but are available free hire it you ask in reception.  We only eat in the resteraunt one night.  Food is ok but there were no lables in front of the dishes so what was thought to be chicken was actually fish!  Some of the deserts are really lovely.  No problems with…

title: what a fantastic hotel ,the best ever!
review: What a fantastic time we had at this hotel ,we have got two girls aged 11 and 8,they had a brilliant time here,they loved the indoor pool and all the facilities ,that were on offer.We went self catering and upgraded when we got there to half board,its cheaper to do it that way !what can i say about the food it is 5 star,the choices are endless,it is all buffet style ,the staff are really friendly and very efficient ,the rooms were cleaned 6 times a week ,the hotel is immaculate every where ,the weather was beautiful,for that time of year,alcudia is very quiet at this time of year ,a lot of the places were still shut ,so it is a good idea to go  half board and base your holiday around the hotel ,we will be returning to this hotel again,we wouldnt stop anywhere else,we have been…

title: Good hotel for Cyclists
review: This is the seconds time we have stayed in this hotel (first time being last year 2007).  This year we had an apartment on the 4th floor (the year before we had a studio). Rooms are in good condition and well furnished. Bathrooms are clean and in fairly good condition.  We went to Majorca to road cycle and the hotel is well geared up. They have a room to secure your bikes and this year they allowed us to take our bike up to the rooms and keep them on the balcony. During the time of year we went (March) the hotel was full of large cycle groups.  We used the new indoor pool which has smaller pools around the edge with jacuzzi style mini pools around it. There is not that much room around the pool but for winter it does the job.  The only real problem we had was that they could not…

title: VIVA TROPIC family hotel
review: We were very surprised to see a new Tropic with a new swimmingpool inside. Specially for children there are a lot of new things. It is a very nice hotel and we hope next summer to be there again with our children and grandchildren to enjoy the fantastic shows and the friendly service. See the pictures we made in febr., the new nice reception, swimming pool and bar. Senta.

title: Could be really nice
review: First thing: obviously, it was a hotel for german people. I love Germany and germans but both of us, not germans, felt like the two black sheeps of the herd. Everything was made for germans, everyone was addressing us in german and were surprised that we were speaking english. And we got the worse located room of course, right by the busy road...  The hotel itself is pretty nice; the garden area which we didn't really use because of the bad weather was nice, the hotel well decorated and the rooms (we had a studio) spacious and well furnished. The GOOD thing about this hotel was the indoor swimming pool: well heated, beautiful, convinient to swim, jaccousi and massage showers on one side, there was even a choice of music to listen to while having a swim. Next to this pool was a…

title: Winter experience of this hotel - excellent
review: Booked via the easyjet website for £80 to sleep 3 of us for a 5 night stay as self catering, we had pretty low expectations of the hotel. To say i was impressed with what I got for my paltry £80 is somewhat of an understatement - £80 gets me one night in Birmingham in a stuffy room, or, 5 nights in a spotless apartment in very pleasant grounds in Alcudia. Alcudia is a bit of a ghost town in february but there were enough cafe's and shops for us and car hire was cheap enough for us to explore parts of the island we would normally miss. The hotel is a centre for Diana, a German cycling firm and there lots of cyclists in the hotel, the outdoor pools were spotless even though you would need to be mad, or a German cyclist to go in them but the indoor spa pool was just fantastic and a…

title: Very mixed emotions
review: Very mixed emotions about this place.  When we eventually got settled into our rather tiny, high up shaded room we found the kids club quite good for kids.  The pools were large but sun lounging areas very cramped.  Would hate to see it hight of season, must be some fights for loungers.  There is a 'pool life guard' type of person, that is changed daily, but 80% of the time they just look @ toty, there scabs, the sky hence why my son and 1 other child on consecutive days almost drowned.  No they didnt even flinch an eye lash or even ask if he was ok when my partner took an unexpected dip fully clothed.  Food nice but expensive.  Rooms cleaned every day, not intense but made comfortable.  Towels changed when needed.  Plenty to do if its what your into.  All in all it was…

title: Excellent resort for kids
review: We stayed for two weeks in August with our two children, aged 10 & 6.  We were upgraded when we got their to the superior apartments, which were very nice.  The pool area is very clean and ideal for kids.  The larger pool is all shallow so my kids loved this.  Their were kids activities all day & night.  On a Monday I never shaw my 6 year old as she was entertained all day and was given her lunch all for 4 euros.  Also the entertainment for adults was good especially the daily bingo.  I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.  The staff are very friendly.

title: Best family holiday you could wish for!!
review: We booked through the hotel website for a week at the end of August this year.  From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, we had a fantastic time.  We took our two kids - aged 6 and 7.  As soon as we arrived, they were straight in the pool, which was really clean (cleaned every day).  We had a one bedroom appartment on the first floor, which was a little small, but absolutely spotless.  The kids were over the moon with the activities in the kids club - a different one every hour during the day.  The evening entertainment was superb - especially the Grease and Chicago shows.  Our kids (and everyone elses too) really enjoyed the kids disco with BUFO the hotel mascot.  We all thought the entertainment team were fantastic - especially Daniel and Daniela.  A really big…

title: Nice hotel, but......................
review: I will try to be fair in my assessment of this Hotel. 1st of all, this is the first time we had to book a vacation during the holiday season since our child is now a school kid. We always booked a higher standard which during vacation time is out of our price range. Therefore, I can only compare it to what I know. The good stuff: The hotel itself was nice. The reception area, bar area and eating area, were all large and roomy. The food was plentiful and good but became repetitive after a few days. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful at all times. We booked too late to get an apartment so we were stuck in a room but it was bearable. Pool was clean. The bad stuff: Maids, while friendly, don't change the water very often when mopping. You have to wear shoes in your room,…

title: Great time overall (but pool too crowded)
review: We booked the holiday on the strength of the reviews here. We have a 5 yr, 3yr and 1yr and they had a fantastic time - as kids do. The staff in the kids club were brilliant. The pony rides were the hightlight. The shows in the evening varied in quality but done with enthusiasm.   The quibbles:  Biggest problem is the pool area, it's packed. For the number of rooms the pool area is not adequate (in mid July). The park along side is a good overflow and nicely shaded and the beach is a short walk.   With the one bedroom apts. the main living is really small! So don;t expect much from your room - get out and about. Good sized balcony though and we had a nice view over to the mountains. Though they do turn off the balcony lights around midnight which made the place feel like a…

title: great hotel but poor nightlife
review: We stayed in the Viva Tropic for two weeks from 22nd june 2007, I could not fault the hotel for the staff, cleanliness and location the only thing that I found poor was the poolside bar closes at 11pm...and the resort itself seems to close around midnight. The rooms were small but very clean and suited our needs as we only used as a base. It was nice and easy to get sun loungers which makes a change, but not if you wanted to sit by the pool. All round I would reccomend the Viva Tropic and would return at sometime in the future but next it would only be for one week. S.H. south london

title: great stay
review: What a great stay entertainment stay were brilliant, clean rooms , rececption stay great, food good, what a shame the bar staff waiters/waitresses let the hotel down .

title: Great place to stay !
review: We have just returned from our second visit in 2 years at the Viva Tropic and I can say that it is as good now as it was then. We travelled with our 2 children , ages 3 and 1 year .    This hotel is in a great location - only 5 mins walk from a beautiful sandy beach and 10 mins walk from the Marina.   The staff are all fluent in English among other languages and cannot do enough to help you.    The evening entertainment has something for everyone and both our children enjoyed it every evening.  We asked for a poolview room so that we could watch the entertainment from our room if the children were tired.  If you are reserving a 2 bedroom apartment as we did , there is no lift for buggies but this was not a problem for us.   The rooms are cleaned every second day and sheets are…

title: Two weeks at the Viva Tropic
review: Viva Topic:  My wife and I stayed in the Viva Tropic from 3/9/06 to 23/9/06.After a nightmare at Palma airport , where we had to wait hours for our suitcases we finally arrived at the Viva Tropic.  The rooms were well maintained and very clean , with the cleaners doing an excellent job. We were Self catering which suited ourselves so I cant comment on the hotels catering.When we required the hotel staff , they were helpfull and pleasant. Although we spent a lot of time at the beach , we did spend a few days around the Pool and its surrounding gardens , These were again well maintained . From what we seen of theHotels night time entertainment  was more family orientated but all seemed to enjoy it. The viva tropic is situated close to the marina  where it was a lot quieter and…

title: Good value holiday
review: We have just returned from 2 weeks at the Viva Tropic and we had a lovely family holiday. This is our 3 visit to a Viva complex and It won't be our last. There hotel ratings are accurate, so when I booked Viva Tropic I know it was 3 Star. The other’s we've stayed in have been 4 Star so I know it would be a little more basic than before. The staff from check in to departure where good. The rooms are clean the staff friendly and helpful. We requested a ground floor room with a pool view next to each other…isn’t that what everyone asks for! We were in the main block on the 4th floor facing the road. We were able to move my parents to a pool view room on the 5th floor.  So we were a floor apart. This want ideal but we managed. I guess not everyone can have a low floor pool view! We…

title: Excellent Holiday at the Viva Tropc
review: Staff, waiters and entertainers were brilliant.  They all worked really hard and were excellent with the children.  Great location, 15 mins walk to waterpark, beach 5 mins walk, lots of shops and restaurants in easy walking distance.  The facilities at the hotel are great.  Pool is fantastic.  Food at hotel good and their entertainment was spot on.  Room basic but exceptionally clean.  You can hire beach towels, iron, hairdryer (so don't take with you).   We had a really good holiday with our 2 children aged 12 and 8 - would definately go back there again.

title: Disappointed
review: Very disappointed all round with this holiday.  This picture of this accomodation in the travel brouchue and on this web site does not show that the large majority of the rooms are situated within a 6 storey barrack like building. The holiday was booked on the basis that we wanted accomodation no higher than 3 storeys high. Our room was on the 5th storey next to a service lift, which woke all at the crack of dawn as cleaning staff arrived and spent half an hour riding up and down moving mops, buckets cleaning skips to the various floors. The room itself although clean was basic, patio door extremley hard to open even a few inches. The pillows provided were so thin that all 4 could have been slid under the door at the same time. The room was over 100 yards down a corridor…

title: Excellent family resort - Lovely Beach
review: As VIVA TROPIC hotel manager, I am very satisfied of having a great deal of repetears guests, in all months that the hotel is opened. In some months we have about 30% of the rooms occupied by repeaters guests.  Concerning the guest who was in our hotel, we do not understand that, if it is true that they did not like neither the hotel nor Puerto Alcudia itself, why they did not ask their touroperator representative, to change into another zone in Mallorca.  Concerning the entertainment, there is information about it at the reception, as there are some big boards at the wall with the schedule of all activities organised for every day at every time, for miniclub, teenagers or adults. All the shows displayed in the hotel (by our own entertainers, by our flying team between Viva Hotels or by external professional shows) have a great response from the guests, who are very enthusiastic.  About the photos in the brochure, it is shown the lower building, but this does not imply that all the rooms are going to be there. If they would have asked to have a room in the small building, perhaps they could have had one there. On the other side, for example, nothing is said that the rooms equipment is much better than expected, as all rooms have been fully renovated after brochures were done.  Concerning the bar service and room cleaning, it happens exactly the same as said before:  every fifteen days an external enterprise (which does not belong to Viva Hotels) comes to all hotels and make lots of questions to the guests, about the departments service, food, equipment, etc. We can show at any time that we have always very good results coming from opinions from the guests.  Related to Alcudia itself, and specially to hotel Viva Tropic, this one is located near the harbour (only 5 minutes away walking), and only 2 minutes away from the beach. In Puerto de Alcudia there are lots of differents restaurants, which suit to all differents money levels, from fast food restaurants to extremely distinguished famous restaurants.  About the beach, we should only say that most beaches have the “blue flag”, international award not given by us, but by the European Community, done following very stricted rules concerning the water, sand, environment, first aid services, etc.  To sum up, and as it is shown in the enclosed graphics about the satisfaction from our guests in the hotel, there are many reasons to consider that almost all people are very satisfied with their holidays in our hotel and with Puerto Alcudia. We do not know all reasons for the disappointment, but what is sure, is that our staff always do their best to hear the guests reasons, give full explanations and help looking for a good and quick solution or response.  All the staff, as always, will be waiting for guests coming here, to offer them the best choice to enjoy their special holidays.   THIS IS OUR MAIN GOAL.  Best regards,  VIVA TROPIC MANAGER

title: Soooooooo - perb!
review: Our 10 day stay at Viva Tropic was excellent, at first it seems the hotel is nowhere near the beach and places mentioned on tripadvisor reviews. However turn a corner and yes there are LOTS of restaurants, and one of the best beaches I have ever seen is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel.  During the day we never spent time by the hotel poolside, simply venturing on down to Alcudia beach where the sand is pure white and very wide. The Sea is also pretty shallow a long way out, so great for a family to use. I don't know about July / August, but for June there was more then enough room on the beach, unlike some crowded narrow beaches found elsewhere. Lots of snack bars dotted along the beach, although drinks can be a little more expensive. With regards to restaurants, there were…

title: great holiday at viva tropic
review: To all customers,   From Viva Hotels & Resorts, we want to thank you for all the reviews that you have posted on this website. We are very happy to see how you share the great experiences you had in Viva Tropic with other costumers.   We wish you a pleasant stay at Viva Hotels & Resorts!  See you soon!

title: 3rd year at the viva tropic
review: We have stayed at the viva sunrise and the viva tropic for the past 3 years. It is the best hotel we ahve ever stayed in. The staff are so friendly and the maids are great.  Food is fantastic, we have never seen a hotel which is cleaned so much. The only thing is you have to be up early to get a sunbed. You are usually only allowed to have a sunbed at 9am. Any later than 10 you may struggle.  There are more sweedish and dutch there than english so they tend to grab the beds and have the same place every day.  Entertainment fantastic for kids both young and older.  If you need to know anything about either of these hotels just drop me a line as we know the great places to eat.. My sister lived there for 15 years.

title: The best
review: First stayed at the hotel in august 2001! Returned in august 2003 as we couldnt fault the complex. Huge clean pool with plenty of sunbeds and a large grass area to sunbathe.  Apartments are basic but spotlessly clean and have everything you need. Cleaning staff were excellent, as were all the other staff at the hotel. Supermarket onsite is reasonably priced, and the pool bar serves delicious snacks such as baguettes etc. Entertainment team were excellent...everything from grease to iceskaters on stage and mini disco for the kids!    Location of the apartments couldn't be better, across the road from the beach and in the lovely port area with plenty of bars and restaurants. I recommend the drunken duck bar for a lively night out! Still within walking distance to both the old town…

title: above usual standard package deal
review: We had a gorgeous relaxing time here. The facilities were brilliant and of a much higher standard than you would expect on a package holiday. We used everything from the pool to the sauna and jacuzzi. It couldn't be better situated and a lovely stroll on down the beach towards the marina, where we had delicious paella. Nice mixture of nationalities in the hotel. Room very spacious and clean and had all you could need. The staff were very nice and all spoke numerous languages. Only downside was the coffee was terrible and one receptionist was very rude at one point but one incident doesn't make a holiday.

title: A1 Hotel
review: Myself & my husband have just come back from this brill apart/hotel,  let me start by saying it is situated great, just 5 mins from the beach & the harbour which has lovely bars /restaurants, the more lively bell vue area is a steady 20 mins walk, however I would suggest you get a taxi to this area as we did on your first visit just to get to know where it is. back to Viva Tropics we was self catering and the apartment and balcony was very spacious, clean towels everyday apart from sunday when the maids have a well deserved day off because they work there socks off & do a superb job. The attached supermarket is not overpriced as you would expect, the drinks in the bar are averaged price, the entertainments team are worth there weight in gold & god knows how many hours they put…

title: holiday at viva tropic
review: stayed at viva tropic Excellent hotel, great resteraunt,  Extremly helpful and friendly staff, probaly one of the best hotels that we have stayed at in Majorca

title: We're going back - Brilliant
review: We stayed at the viva tropic in July 2004. We have 2 children 7 and 4. The Children had a brill time as there was something for them every hour throughout the day from 9am to midnight. The food in the complex was surprisingly good. We normally go out to restaurants every night but this year we ate in at the complex many times. The Entertainment was very good at night with a mixure of professional shows and shows from the entertianment team . The entertainment team shows were very good too and very entertaining. The complex is in a great location only 3 mins walk to beach and 7-10 mins walk to the marina area with lots of bars and restaurants. The apartment was very nice, clean and a good size with air conditioning. We booked again for 2005.
